112.Aisha Bewley: Allah makes an example of a city which was safe and at peace, its provision coming to it plentifully from every side. Then it showed ingratitude for Allah´s blessings so Allah made it wear the robes of hunger and fear for what it did.

113.Aisha Bewley: A Messenger from among them came to them but they denied him. So the punishment seized them and they were wrongdoers.

114.Aisha Bewley: So eat from what Allah has provided for you, halal and good, and be thankful for the blessing of Allah if it is Him you worship.

115.Aisha Bewley: He has forbidden you carrion, blood and pork and anything consecrated to other than Allah. But if someone is forced to eat it, without desiring to or going to excess in it, your Lord is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

116.Aisha Bewley: Do not say about what your lying tongues describe: ´This is halal and this is haram,´ inventing lies against Allah.

117.Aisha Bewley: Those who invent lies against Allah are not successful — a brief enjoyment, then they will have a painful punishment.

118.Aisha Bewley: We forbade the Jews those things We told you about before. We did not wrong them; rather they wronged themselves.

119.Aisha Bewley: But to those who do evil in ignorance and then after that make tawba and put things right, to them your Lord is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

120.Aisha Bewley: Ibrahim was a community in himself, exemplary, obedient to Allah, a man of pure natural belief. He was not one of the idolaters.

121.Aisha Bewley: He was thankful for His blessings. Allah chose him and guided him to a straight path.

122.Aisha Bewley: We gave him good in this world and in the Next World he will be one of the righteous.

123.Aisha Bewley: Then We revealed to you: ´Follow the religion of Ibrahim, a man of pure natural belief. He was not one of the idolaters.´

124.Aisha Bewley: The Sabbath was only enjoined on those who differed about it. Your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Rising regarding the things about which they differed.

125.Aisha Bewley: Call to the way of your Lord with wisdom and fair admonition, and argue with them in the kindest way. Your Lord knows best who is misguided from His way. And He knows best who are guided.

126.Aisha Bewley: If you want to retaliate, retaliate to the same degree as the injury done to you. But if you are patient, it is better to be patient.

127.Aisha Bewley: Be patient. But your patience is only by Allah. Do not be grieved by them and do not be constricted by the plots they hatch.

128.Aisha Bewley: Allah is with those who have taqwa of Him and with those who are good-doers.

1.Aisha Bewley: Glory be to Him who took His slave on a journey by night from the Masjid al-Haram to the Masjid al-Aqsa, whose surroundings We have blessed, in order to show him some of Our Signs. He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing.

2.Aisha Bewley: We gave Musa the Book and made it guidance for the tribe of Israel: ´Do not take anyone besides Me as a guardian.´

3.Aisha Bewley: Descendants of those We carried with Nuh. He was a grateful slave.

4.Aisha Bewley: We decreed in the Book for the tribe of Israel: ´You will twice cause corruption on the earth and you will rise to a great height.

5.Aisha Bewley: When the promised first time came, We sent against you slaves of Ours possessing great force, and they ransacked your houses, rampaging right through them. It was a promise which was fulfilled.

6.Aisha Bewley: Then once again We gave you the upper hand over them and supplied you with more wealth and children and made you the most numerous group.

7.Aisha Bewley: If you do good, you do it to yourselves. If you do evil, you do it to your detriment. When the next promised time arrived, it was so that they could injure you and enter the Temple as they had entered it the first time, and in order to completely destroy what they had conquered.

8.Aisha Bewley: It may well be that your Lord will have mercy on you. But if you revert to what you did, We also will revert. We have made Hell a prison for the kafirun.´

9.Aisha Bewley: This Qur´an guides to the most upright Way and gives good news to the muminun who do right actions that they will have a large reward.

10.Aisha Bewley: But as for those who do not have iman in the Next World, We have prepared for them a painful punishment.

11.Aisha Bewley: Man prays for evil just as he prays for good. Man is prone to be impetuous.

12.Aisha Bewley: We made the night and day two Signs. We blotted out the Sign of the night and made the Sign of the day a time for seeing so that you can seek favour from your Lord and will know the number of years and the reckoning of time. We have made all things very clear.

13.Aisha Bewley: We have fastened the destiny of every man about his neck and on the Day of Rising We will bring out a Book for him which he will find spread open in front of him.

14.Aisha Bewley: ´Read your Book! Today your own self is reckoner enough against you!´

15.Aisha Bewley: Whoever is guided is only guided to his own good. Whoever is misguided is only misguided to his detriment. No burden-bearer can bear another´s burden. We never punish until We have sent a Messenger.

16.Aisha Bewley: When We desire to destroy a city, We send a command to the affluent in it and they become deviant in it and the Word is justly carried out against it and We annihilate it completely.

17.Aisha Bewley: How many generations We destroyed after Nuh! Your Lord is well able to be aware of and see the wrong actions of His slaves!

18.Aisha Bewley: As for anyone who desires this fleeting existence, We hasten in it whatever We will to whoever We want. Then We will consign him to Hell where he will roast, reviled and driven out.

19.Aisha Bewley: But as for anyone who desires the Next World, and strives for it with the striving it deserves, being a mumin, the striving of such people will be gratefully acknowledged.

20.Aisha Bewley: We sustain each one, the former and the latter, through the generous giving of your Lord; and the giving of your Lord is not restricted.

21.Aisha Bewley: Look how We favour some of them over others. But the Next World has higher ranks and greater favours.

22.Aisha Bewley: Do not set up any other god together with Allah and so sit there reviled and forsaken.

23.Aisha Bewley: Your Lord has decreed that you should worship none but Him, and that you should show kindness to your parents. Whether one or both of them reach old age with you, do not say ´Ugh!´ to them out of irritation and do not be harsh with them but speak to them with gentleness and generosity.

24.Aisha Bewley: Take them under your wing, out of mercy, with due humility and say: ´Lord, show mercy to them as they did in looking after me when I was small.´

25.Aisha Bewley: Your Lord knows best what is in your selves. If you are righteous, He is Ever-Forgiving to the remorseful.

26.Aisha Bewley: Give your relatives their due, and the very poor and travellers but do not squander what you have.

27.Aisha Bewley: Squanderers are brothers to the shaytans, and Shaytan was ungrateful to his Lord.

28.Aisha Bewley: But if you do turn away from them, seeking the mercy you hope for from your Lord, then speak to them with words that bring them ease.

29.Aisha Bewley: Do not keep your hand chained to your neck but do not extend it either to its full extent so that you sit there blamed and destitute.

30.Aisha Bewley: Your Lord expands the provision of anyone He wills and restricts it. He is aware of and sees His slaves.

31.Aisha Bewley: Do not kill your children out of fear of being poor. We will provide for them and you. Killing them is a terrible mistake.

32.Aisha Bewley: And do not go near to fornication. It is an indecent act, an evil way.

33.Aisha Bewley: Do not kill any person Allah has made inviolate, except with the right to do so. If someone is wrongly killed We have given authority to his next of kin. But he should not be excessive in taking life. He will be helped.

34.Aisha Bewley: Do not go near the property of orphans before they reach maturity, except in a good way. Fulfil your contracts. Contracts will be asked about.

35.Aisha Bewley: Give full measure when you measure and weigh with a level balance. That is better and gives the best result.

36.Aisha Bewley: Do not pursue what you have no knowledge of. Hearing, sight and hearts will all be questioned.

37.Aisha Bewley: Do not strut arrogantly about the earth. You will certainly never split the earth apart nor will you ever rival the mountains in height.

38.Aisha Bewley: All of that is evil action and hateful in the sight of your Lord.

39.Aisha Bewley: That is part of the wisdom your Lord has revealed to you. Do not set up another god together with Allah and so be thrown into Hell, blamed and driven out.

40.Aisha Bewley: Has your Lord honoured you with sons and Himself taken the angels as daughters? It is truly something terrible that you say!

41.Aisha Bewley: We have made things clear in this Qur´an so that they might pay heed, but it only makes them run away the more!

42.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´If there had, as you say, been other gods together with Him, they would have sought a way to the Master of the Throne.´

43.Aisha Bewley: Glory be to Him! He is exalted above what they say in Greatness and Sublimity!

44.Aisha Bewley: The seven heavens and the earth and everyone in them glorify Him. There is nothing which does not glorify Him with praise but you do not understand their glorification. He is All-Forbearing, Ever-Forgiving.

45.Aisha Bewley: When you recite the Qur´an, We place an obscuring veil between you and those who do not believe in the akhira.

46.Aisha Bewley: We have placed covers on their hearts, preventing them from understanding it, and heaviness in their ears. When you mention your Lord alone in the Qur´an, they turn their backs and run away.

47.Aisha Bewley: We know how they listen when they listen to you, and when they confer together secretly, and when the wrongdoers say, ´You are only following a man who is bewitched!´

48.Aisha Bewley: Look how they make likenesses of you and go astray. They are unable to find their way.

49.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´What! When we are bones and crumbled dust, will we then be raised up as a new creation!´

50.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´It would not matter if you were rock or iron,

51.Aisha Bewley: Or indeed any created thing that you think is harder still!´ They will say, ´Who will bring us back again?´ Say: ´He who brought you into being in the first place.´ They will shake their heads at you and ask, ´When will it happen?´ Say: ´It may well be that it is very near.´

52.Aisha Bewley: On the Day He calls you, you will respond by praising Him and think that you have only tarried a very short time.

53.Aisha Bewley: Say to My slaves that they should only say the best. Shaytan wants to stir up trouble between them. Shaytan is an outright enemy to man.

54.Aisha Bewley: Your Lord knows you best. If He wills, He will have mercy on you, and, if He wills, He will punish you. We did not send you to be their guardian.

55.Aisha Bewley: My Lord knows best everyone in the heavens and earth. We favoured some of the Prophets over others. And We gave Dawud the Zabur.

56.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Call on those you make claims for apart from Him. They possess no power to remove any harm from you or to change anything.´

57.Aisha Bewley: Those they call on are themselves seeking the means by which they might approach their Lord — even those who are the closest to Him — and are hoping for His mercy and fearing his punishment. The punishment of your Lord is truly something to be feared.

58.Aisha Bewley: There is no city We will not destroy before the Day of Rising, or punish with a terrible punishment. That is inscribed in the Book.

59.Aisha Bewley: Nothing has prevented Us sending you Signs except the fact that the previous peoples denied them. We gave Thamud the she-camel as a visible Sign, and then they mistreated her. We do not send Signs except to frighten people.

60.Aisha Bewley: When We said to you, ´Surely your Lord encompasses the people with His knowledge.´ We only appointed the vision We showed you and the Accursed Tree in the Qur´an as a trial and temptation for the people. We frighten them, but it only increases them in their excessive insolence.

61.Aisha Bewley: When We said to the angels, ´Prostrate yourselves to Adam!´ they prostrated, except for Iblis. He said ´What! Am I to prostrate to one You have created out of clay?´

62.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Do You see this creature You have honoured over me? If You reprieve me till the Day of Rising, I will be the master of his descendants except for a very few.´

63.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Go! And as for any who follow you, your repayment is Hell, repayment in full!

64.Aisha Bewley: Stir up any of them you can with your voice and rally against them your cavalry and your infantry and share with them in their children and their wealth and make them promises! The promise of Shaytan is nothing but delusion.

65.Aisha Bewley: But as for My slaves, you will not have any authority over them.´ Your Lord suffices as a guardian.

66.Aisha Bewley: Your Lord is He who propels the ships on the sea for you so that you may seek His bounty. He is indeed Most Merciful to you.

67.Aisha Bewley: When harm occurs to you at sea, those you call on vanish — except for Him alone! But when He delivers you to dry land, you turn away. Man truly is ungrateful.

68.Aisha Bewley: Do you feel secure against Him causing the shore to swallow you up or sending against you a sudden squall of stones? Then you will find no one to be your guardian.

69.Aisha Bewley: Or do you feel secure against Him taking you back into it another time and sending a violent storm against you and drowning you for your ingratitude? Then you will find no one to defend you against Us.

70.Aisha Bewley: We have honoured the sons of Adam and conveyed them on land and sea and provided them with good things and favoured them greatly over many We have created.

71.Aisha Bewley: On the Day We summon every people with their records, those who are given their Book in their right hand will read their Book and they will not be wronged by even the smallest speck.

72.Aisha Bewley: Those who are blind in this world will be blind in the Next World and even further off the Path.

73.Aisha Bewley: They were very near to enticing you away from some of what We have revealed to you, hoping that you would invent something against Us. Then they would have taken you as their intimate.

74.Aisha Bewley: If We had not made you firm, you would have leaned towards them a little.

75.Aisha Bewley: Then We would have let you taste a double punishment in life and a double punishment in death. You would not have found any helper against Us.

76.Aisha Bewley: They were very near to scaring you from the land with the object of expelling you from it. But had they done so they would only have remained there a short time after you.

77.Aisha Bewley: That was the pattern with those We sent before you as Our Messengers. You will not find any changing of Our pattern.

78.Aisha Bewley: Establish salat from the time the sun declines until the darkening of the night, and also the recitation at dawn. The dawn recitation is certainly witnessed.

79.Aisha Bewley: And stay awake for prayer during part of the night as a supererogatory action for yourself. It may well be that your Lord will raise you to a Praiseworthy Station.

80.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´My Lord, make my entry sincere and make my leaving sincere and grant me supporting authority direct from Your Presence.´

81.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Truth has come and falsehood has vanished. Falsehood is always bound to vanish.´

82.Aisha Bewley: We send down in the Qur´an that which is a healing and a mercy to the muminun, but it only increases the wrongdoers in loss.

83.Aisha Bewley: When We bless man, he turns away and draws aside. When evil touches him, he despairs.

84.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Each man acts according to his nature, but your Lord knows best who is best guided on the Path.´

85.Aisha Bewley: They will ask you about the Ruh. Say: ´The Ruh is my Lord´s concern. You have only been given a little knowledge.´

86.Aisha Bewley: If We wished We could take away what We have revealed to you and then you would not find any to guard you from Us —

87.Aisha Bewley: but for a mercy from your Lord. His favour to you is indeed immense.

88.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´If both men and jinn banded together to produce the like of this Qur´an, they could never produce anything like it, even if they backed each other up.´

89.Aisha Bewley: We have variegated throughout this Qur´an all kinds of examples for people, but most people spurn anything but kufr.

90.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´We will not believe you until you make a spring gush out from the earth for us;

91.Aisha Bewley: or have a garden of dates and grapes which you make rivers come pouring through;

92.Aisha Bewley: or make the sky, as you claim, fall down on us in lumps; or bring Allah and the angels here as a guarantee;

93.Aisha Bewley: or possess a house built out of gleaming gold; or ascend up into heaven — and even then we will not believe in your ascent unless you bring us down a book to read!´ Say: ´Glory be to my Lord! Am I anything but a human messenger?´

94.Aisha Bewley: Nothing prevents people from having iman when guidance comes to them but the fact that they say, ´Has Allah sent a human being as Messenger?´

95.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´If there had been angels on the earth going about in peace, We would have sent down to them an angel from heaven as Messenger.´

96.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Allah is a sufficient witness between me and you. He is certainly aware of and sees His slaves.´

97.Aisha Bewley: Whoever Allah guides is truly guided. But as for those He leads astray, you will not find any protectors for them apart from Him. We will gather them on the Day of Rising, flat on their faces, blind, dumb and deaf. Their shelter will be Hell. Whenever the Blaze dies down, We will increase it for them.

98.Aisha Bewley: That is their repayment for rejecting Our Signs and saying, ´What, when we are bones and crumbled dust, will we then be raised up as a new creation?´

99.Aisha Bewley: Do they not see that Allah, Who created the heavens and earth, has the power to create the like of them, and has appointed fixed terms for them of which there is no doubt? But the wrongdoers still spurn anything but kufr.

100.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Even if you possessed the vast storehouses of my Lord´s mercy, you would still hold back, fearing they would run out.´

101.Aisha Bewley: We gave Musa nine Clear Signs. Ask the tribe of Israel about when he came to them and Pharaoh said to him, ´Musa, I think you are bewitched.´

102.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´You know that no one sent these down but the Lord of the heavens and earth to be clear proofs. Pharaoh, I think you are destroyed.´

103.Aisha Bewley: He wanted to scare them from the land but We drowned him and every one of those with him.

104.Aisha Bewley: We said to the tribe of Israel after that, ´Inhabit the land and, when the promise of the Next World comes, We will produce you as a motley crowd.´

105.Aisha Bewley: We have sent it down with truth and with truth it has come down. We only sent you to bring good news and to give warning.

106.Aisha Bewley: We have divided up the Qur´an, so you can recite it to mankind at intervals, and We have sent it down little by little.

107.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Have iman in it or do not have iman in it.´ Certainly, when it is recited to them, those who were given knowledge before it fall on their faces in prostration,

108.Aisha Bewley: saying, ´Glory be to our Lord! The promise of our Lord is truly fulfilled!´ Weeping,

109.Aisha Bewley: they fall to the ground in prostration, and it increases them in humility.

110.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Call on Allah or call on the All-Merciful, whichever you call upon, the Most Beautiful Names are His.´ Do not be too loud in your salat or too quiet in it, but try to find a way between the two.

111.Aisha Bewley: And say: ´Praise be to Allah Who has had no son and Who has no partner in His Kingdom and Who needs no one to protect Him from abasement.´ And proclaim His Greatness repeatedly!

1.Aisha Bewley: Praise belongs to Allah Who has sent down the Book to His slave and has put no crookedness in it.

2.Aisha Bewley: It is straight, to warn of violent force direct from Him, and to give the good news to the muminun, those who do right actions, that for them there is an excellent reward,

3.Aisha Bewley: a place in which they will remain for ever,

4.Aisha Bewley: and to warn those who say ´Allah has a son.´

5.Aisha Bewley: They have no knowledge of this, neither they nor their fathers. It is a monstrous utterance which has issued from their mouths. What they say is nothing but a lie.

6.Aisha Bewley: Perhaps you may destroy yourself with grief, chasing after them, if they do not have iman in these words.

7.Aisha Bewley: We made everything on the earth adornment for it so that We could test them to see whose actions are the best.

8.Aisha Bewley: We will certainly make everything on it a barren wasteland.

9.Aisha Bewley: Do you consider that the Companions of the Cave and Ar-Raqim were one of the most remarkable of Our Signs?

10.Aisha Bewley: When the young men took refuge in the cave and said, ´Our Lord, give us mercy directly from You and open the way for us to right guidance in our situation.´

11.Aisha Bewley: So We sealed their ears with sleep in the cave for a number of years.

12.Aisha Bewley: Then We woke them up again so that We might see which of the two groups would better calculate the time they had stayed there.

13.Aisha Bewley: We will relate their story to you with truth. They were young men who had iman in their Lord and We increased them in guidance.

14.Aisha Bewley: We fortified their hearts when they stood up and said, ´Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and We will not call on any god apart from Him. We would in that case have uttered an abomination.

15.Aisha Bewley: These people of ours have taken gods apart from Him. Why do they not produce a clear authority concerning them? Who could do greater wrong than someone who invents a lie against Allah?

16.Aisha Bewley: When you have separated yourselves from them and everything they worship except Allah, take refuge in the cave and your Lord will unfold His mercy to you and open the way to the best for you in your situation.´

17.Aisha Bewley: You would have seen the sun, when it rose, inclining away from their cave towards the right, and, when it set, leaving them behind on the left, while they were lying in an open part of it. That was one of Allah´s Signs. Whoever Allah guides is truly guided. But if He misguides someone, you will find no protector for them to guide them rightly.

18.Aisha Bewley: You would have supposed them to be awake whereas in fact they were asleep. We turned them to the right and to the left, and, at the entrance, their dog stretched out its paws. If you had looked down and seen them, you would have turned from them and run and have been filled with terror at the sight of them.

19.Aisha Bewley: That was the situation when we woke them up so they could question one another. One of them asked, ´How long have you been here?´ They replied, ´We have been here for a day or part of a day.´ They said, ´Your Lord knows best how long you have been here. Send one of your number into the city with this silver you have, so he can see which food is purest and bring you some of it to eat. But he should go about with caution so that no one is aware of you,

20.Aisha Bewley: for if they find out about you they will stone you or make you revert to their religion and then you will never have success.´

21.Aisha Bewley: Accordingly We made them chance upon them unexpectedly so they might know that Allah´s promise is true and that there is no doubt about the Hour. When they were arguing among themselves about the matter, they said, ´Wall up their cave, their Lord knows best about them.´ But those who got the better of the argument concerning them said, ´We will build a place of worship over them.´

22.Aisha Bewley: They will say, ´There were three of them, their dog being the fourth.´ They will say, ´There were five of them, their dog being the sixth,´ guessing at the Unseen. And they will say, ´There were seven of them, their dog being the eighth.´ Say: ´My Lord knows best their number. Those who know about them are very few.´ So do not enter into any argument concerning them, except in relation to what is clearly known. And do not seek the opinion of any of them regarding them.

23.Aisha Bewley: Never say about anything, ´I will do that tomorrow,´ -

24.Aisha Bewley: Without adding ´If Allah wills.´ Remember your Lord when you forget, and say, ´Hopefully my Lord will guide me to something closer to right guidance than this.´

25.Aisha Bewley: They stayed in their Cave for three hundred years and added nine.

26.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Allah knows best how long they stayed. The Unseen of the heavens and the earth belongs to Him. How perfectly He sees, how well He hears! They have no protector apart from Him. Nor does He share His rule with anyone.´

27.Aisha Bewley: Recite what has been revealed to you of your Lord´s Book. No one can change His Words. You will never find any safe haven apart from Him.

28.Aisha Bewley: Restrain yourself patiently with those who call on their Lord morning and evening, desiring His face. Do not turn your eyes from them, desiring the attractions of this world. And do not obey someone whose heart We have made neglectful of Our remembrance and who follows his own whims and desires and whose life has transgressed all bounds.

29.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´It is the truth from your Lord; so let whoever wishes have iman and whoever wishes be kafir.´ We have prepared for the wrongdoers a Fire whose billowing walls of smoke will hem them in. If they call for help, they will be helped with water like seething molten brass, frying their faces. What a noxious drink! What an evil repose!

30.Aisha Bewley: But as for those who have iman and do right actions, We will not let the wage of good-doers go to waste.

31.Aisha Bewley: They will have Gardens of Eden with rivers flowing under them. They will be adorned in them with bracelets made of gold and wear green garments made of the finest silk and rich brocade, reclining there on couches under canopies. What an excellent reward! What a wonderful repose!

32.Aisha Bewley: Make an example for them of two men. To one of them We gave two gardens of grape-vines and surrounded them with date-palms, putting between them some cultivated land.

33.Aisha Bewley: Both gardens yielded their crops and did not suffer any loss, and We made a river flow right through the middle of them.

34.Aisha Bewley: He was a man of wealth and property and he said to his companion, debating with him, ´I have more wealth than you and more people under me.´

35.Aisha Bewley: He entered his garden and wronged himself by saying, ´I do not think that this will ever end.

36.Aisha Bewley: I do not think the Hour will ever come. But if I should be sent back to my Lord, I will definitely get something better in return.´

37.Aisha Bewley: His companion, with whom he was debating, said to him, ´Do you then disbelieve in Him who created you from dust, then from a drop of sperm, and then formed you as a man?

38.Aisha Bewley: He is, however, Allah, my Lord, and I will not associate anyone with my Lord.

39.Aisha Bewley: Why, when you entered your garden, did you not say, "It is as Allah wills, there is no strength but in Allah"? Though you see me with less wealth and children than you possess,

40.Aisha Bewley: it may well be that my Lord will give me something better than your garden and send down on it a fireball from the sky so that morning finds it a shifting heap of dust,

41.Aisha Bewley: or morning finds its water drained into the earth so that you cannot get at it.´

42.Aisha Bewley: The fruits of his labour were completely destroyed and he woke up wringing his hands in grief, rueing everything that he had spent on it. It was a ruin with all its trellises fallen in. He said, ´Oh, if only I had not associated anyone with my Lord!´

43.Aisha Bewley: There was no group to come to his aid, besides Allah, and he was not given any help.

44.Aisha Bewley: In that situation the only protection is from Allah, the Real. He gives the best reward and the best outcome.

45.Aisha Bewley: Make a metaphor for them of the life of this world. It is like water which We send down from the sky and the plants of the earth combine with it but then become dry chaff scattered by the winds. Allah has absolute power over everything.

46.Aisha Bewley: Wealth and sons are the embellishment of the life of this world. But, in your Lord´s sight, right actions which are lasting bring a better reward and are a better basis for hope.

47.Aisha Bewley: On the Day We make the mountains move and you see the earth laid bare and We gather them together, not leaving out a single one of them,

48.Aisha Bewley: they will be paraded before your Lord in ranks: ´You have come to Us just as We created you at first. Yes indeed! Even though you claimed that We would not fix a time with you.´

49.Aisha Bewley: The Book will be set in place and you will see the evildoers fearful of what is in it. They will say, ´Alas for us! What is this Book which does not pass over any action, small or great, without recording it?´ They will find there everything they did and your Lord will not wrong anyone at all.

50.Aisha Bewley: When We said to the angels, ´Prostrate yourselves to Adam,´ they prostrated with the exception of Iblis. He was one of the jinn and wantonly deviated from his Lord´s command. Do you take him and his offspring as protectors apart from Me when they are your enemy? How evil is the exchange the wrongdoers make!

51.Aisha Bewley: I did not make them witnesses of the creation of the heavens and the earth nor of their own creation. I would not take as assistants those who lead astray!

52.Aisha Bewley: On the Day He says, ´Call My partner-gods, those for whom you made such claims,´ they will call on them but they will not respond to them. We will place between them an unbridgeable gulf.

53.Aisha Bewley: The evildoers will see the Fire and realise they are going to fall into it and find no way of escaping from it.

54.Aisha Bewley: We have variegated throughout this Qur´an all kinds of examples for people, but, more than anything else, man is argumentative!

55.Aisha Bewley: When guidance came to the people nothing prevented them from having iman and asking for forgiveness from their Lord but the fact that the pattern of previous peoples did not happen to them or that the punishment did not appear before their eyes.

56.Aisha Bewley: We only send the Messengers to bring good news and to give warning. Those who are kafir use fallacious arguments to deny the truth. They make a mockery of My Signs and also of the warning they were given.

57.Aisha Bewley: Who could do greater wrong than someone who is reminded of the Signs of his Lord and then turns away from them, forgetting all that he has done before? We have placed covers on their hearts, preventing them from understanding it, and heaviness in their ears. Though you call them to guidance, they will nonetheless never be guided.

58.Aisha Bewley: Your Lord is the Ever-Forgiving, the Possessor of Mercy. If He had taken them to task for what they have earned, He would have hastened their punishment. Instead, they have a promised appointment and they will not find any refuge from it.

59.Aisha Bewley: Those cities: We destroyed them when they did wrong and fixed a promised time for their destruction.

60.Aisha Bewley: Remember when Musa said to his servant, ´I will not give up until I reach the meeting-place of the two seas, even if I must press on for many years.´

61.Aisha Bewley: But when they reached their meeting-place, they forgot their fish which quickly burrowed its way into the sea.

62.Aisha Bewley: When they had gone a distance further on, he said to his servant, ´Bring us our morning meal. Truly this journey of ours has made us tired.´

63.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Do you see what has happened? When we went to find shelter at the rock, I forgot the fish. No one made me forget to remember it except Shaytan. It found its way into the sea in an amazing way.´

64.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´That is the very thing that we were looking for!´ So, following their footsteps, they retraced their route.

65.Aisha Bewley: They found a slave of Ours whom We had granted mercy from Us and whom We had also given knowledge direct from Us.

66.Aisha Bewley: Musa said to him, ´May I follow you on condition that you teach me some of the right guidance you have been taught?´

67.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´You will not be able to bear with me.

68.Aisha Bewley: How indeed could you bear with patience something you have not encompassed in your knowledge?´

69.Aisha Bewley: Musa said, ´You will find me patient, if Allah wills, and I will not disobey you in any matter.´

70.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Then if you follow me, do not question me about anything until I myself make mention of it to you.´

71.Aisha Bewley: They continued until they boarded a boat and he scuppered it. Then Musa said, ´Did you scupper it so that its owners would be drowned? This is truly a dreadful thing that you have done!´

72.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Did I not say that you would not be able to bear with me?´

73.Aisha Bewley: Musa said, ´Do not take me to task because I forgot. Do not demand of me something which is too difficult.´

74.Aisha Bewley: So they went on until they met a youngster whom he killed. Musa said, ´Have you killed a boy who has done no wrong, without it being in retaliation for someone else? This is truly an appalling thing that you have done!´

75.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Did I not tell you that you would not be able to bear with me?´

76.Aisha Bewley: Musa said, ´If I ask you about anything after this, then you should no longer keep me company. I will have given you excuse enough.´

77.Aisha Bewley: So they went on until they reached the inhabitants of a town. They asked them for food but they refused them hospitality. They found there a wall about to fall down and he built it up. Musa said, ´If you had wanted, you could have taken a wage for doing that.´

78.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´This is where you and I part company. I will let you know the explanation of those things about which you were not able to restrain yourself.

79.Aisha Bewley: As for the boat, it belonged to some poor people who worked on the sea. I wanted to damage it because a king was coming behind them, commandeering every boat.

80.Aisha Bewley: As for the boy, his parents were muminun and we feared that he would darken their days with excessive insolence and kufr.

81.Aisha Bewley: We wanted their Lord to give them in exchange a purer son than him, one more compassionate.

82.Aisha Bewley: As for the wall, it belonged to two young orphans in the town and there was a treasure underneath it, belonging to them. Their father was one of the righteous and your Lord wanted them to come of age and then to unearth their treasure as a mercy from your Lord. I did not do it of my own volition. That is the explanation of the things about which you were not able to restrain yourself.´

83.Aisha Bewley: They will ask you about Dhu´l-Qarnayn. Say: ´I will tell you something about him.´

84.Aisha Bewley: We gave him power and authority on the earth and granted him a way to everything.

85.Aisha Bewley: So he followed a way

86.Aisha Bewley: until he reached the setting of the sun and found it setting in a muddy spring and found a people by it. We said, ´Dhu´l-Qarnayn! You can either punish them or else you can treat them with gentleness.´

87.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´As for those who do wrong, we will punish them and then they will be returned to their Lord and He will punish them with a dreadful punishment.

88.Aisha Bewley: But as for him who has iman and acts rightly, he will receive the best of rewards and we will issue a command, making things easy for him.´

89.Aisha Bewley: Then he followed a way

90.Aisha Bewley: until he reached the rising of the sun and found it rising on a people to whom We had not given any shelter from it.

91.Aisha Bewley: Our knowledge encompasses all that happened to him.

92.Aisha Bewley: Then he followed a path

93.Aisha Bewley: until he arrived between the two mountains where he found a people scarcely able to understand speech.

94.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Dhu´l-Qarnayn! Yajuj and Majuj are causing corruption in the land. Can we, therefore, pay tribute to you in return for your constructing a barrier between us and them?´

95.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´The power my Lord has granted me is better than that. Just give me a strong helping hand and I will build a solid barrier between you and them.

96.Aisha Bewley: Bring me ingots of iron!´ Then, when he had made it level between the two high mountain-sides, he said,´Blow!´ and when he had made it a red hot fire, he said, ´Bring me molten brass to pour over it.´

97.Aisha Bewley: They were, therefore, unable to climb over it nor were they able to make a breach in it.

98.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´This is a mercy from my Lord. But when my Lord´s promise comes about, He will crush it flat. The promise of my Lord is surely true.´

99.Aisha Bewley: We will abandon them, that Day, to pound against each other in surging waves and the Trumpet will be blown and We will gather them all together.

100.Aisha Bewley: That Day We will display Hell in its totality to the kafirun,

101.Aisha Bewley: those whose eyes were blind to My remembrance and whose ears were unable to hear.

102.Aisha Bewley: Do those who are kafir imagine that they can take My slaves as protectors instead of Me? We have prepared Hell as hospitality for the kuffar!

103.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Shall I inform you of the greatest losers in their actions?

104.Aisha Bewley: People whose efforts in the life of the dunya are misguided while they suppose that they are doing good.´

105.Aisha Bewley: Those are the people who reject their Lord´s Signs and the meeting with Him. Their actions will come to nothing and, on the Day of Rising, We will not assign them any weight.

106.Aisha Bewley: That is their repayment — Hell — because they were kafir and made a mockery of My Signs and of My Messengers.

107.Aisha Bewley: Those who have iman and do right actions will have the Gardens of Firdaws as hospitality,

108.Aisha Bewley: remaining in them timelessly, for ever, with no desire to move away from them.

109.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´If all the sea was ink to write down the Words of my Lord, it would run out long before the Words of my Lord ran out,´ even if We were to bring the same amount of ink again.

110.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´I am only a human being like yourselves who has received revelation. Your god is One God. So let him who hopes to meet his Lord act rightly and not associate anyone in the worship of his Lord.´

1.Aisha Bewley: Kaf Ha Ya ´Ayn Sad

2.Aisha Bewley: Remembering your Lord´s mercy to His slave Zakariyya,

3.Aisha Bewley: when he called on his Lord in secret

4.Aisha Bewley: and said, ´My Lord, my bones have lost their strength and my head is crowned with white, but in calling on You, My Lord, I have never been disappointed.

5.Aisha Bewley: I fear my relatives when I am gone and my wife is barren, so give me an heir from You

6.Aisha Bewley: to be my inheritor and the inheritor of the family of Ya´qub, and make him, my Lord, pleasing to You.´

7.Aisha Bewley: ´Zakariyya! We give you the good news of a boy named Yahya, a name We have given to no one else before.´

8.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´My Lord! How can I have a boy when my wife is barren and I have reached advanced old age?´

9.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´It will be so! Your Lord says, "That is easy for Me to do. I created you before, when you were not anything."´

10.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´My Lord, give me a Sign.´ He said, ´Your Sign is not to speak to people for three nights despite the fact that you are perfectly able to.´

11.Aisha Bewley: He came out to his people from the Upper Room and gestured to them to glorify Allah in the morning and the evening.

12.Aisha Bewley: ´Yahya, take hold of the Book with vigour.´ We gave him judgement while still a child,

13.Aisha Bewley: and tenderness and purity from Us — he had taqwa —

14.Aisha Bewley: and devotion to his parents — he was not insolent or disobedient.

15.Aisha Bewley: Peace be upon him the day he was born, and the day he dies, and the day he is raised up again alive.

16.Aisha Bewley: Mention Maryam in the Book, how she withdrew from her people to an eastern place,

17.Aisha Bewley: and veiled herself from them. Then We sent Our Ruh to her and it took on for her the form of a handsome, well-built man.

18.Aisha Bewley: She said, ´I seek refuge from you with the All-Merciful if you have taqwa.´

19.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´I am only your Lord´s messenger so that He can give you a pure boy.´

20.Aisha Bewley: She said, ´How can I have a boy when no man has touched me and I am not an unchaste woman?´

21.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´It will be so! Your Lord says, "That is easy for Me. It is so that We can make him a Sign for mankind and a mercy from Us." It is a matter already decreed.´

22.Aisha Bewley: So she conceived him and withdrew with him to a distant place.

23.Aisha Bewley: The pains of labour drove her to the trunk of a date-palm. She said, ´Oh if only I had died before this time and was something discarded and forgotten!´

24.Aisha Bewley: A voice called out to her from under her, ´Do not grieve! Your Lord has placed a small stream at your feet.

25.Aisha Bewley: Shake the trunk of the palm towards you and fresh, ripe dates will drop down onto you.

26.Aisha Bewley: Eat and drink and delight your eyes. If you should see anyone at all, just say, "I have made a vow of abstinence to the All-Merciful and today I will not speak to any human being."´

27.Aisha Bewley: She brought him to her people, carrying him. They said, ´Maryam! You have done an unthinkable thing!

28.Aisha Bewley: Sister of Harun, your father was not an evil man nor was your mother an unchaste woman!´

29.Aisha Bewley: She pointed towards him. They said, ´How can a baby in the cradle speak?´

30.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´I am the slave of Allah, He has given me the Book and made me a Prophet.

31.Aisha Bewley: He has made me blessed wherever I am and directed me to do salat and give zakat as long as I live,

32.Aisha Bewley: and to show devotion to my mother. He has not made me insolent or arrogant.

33.Aisha Bewley: Peace be upon me the day I was born, and the day I die and the day I am raised up again alive.´

34.Aisha Bewley: That is ´Isa, son of Maryam, the word of truth about which they are in doubt.

35.Aisha Bewley: It is not fitting for Allah to have a son. Glory be to Him! When He decides on something, He just says to it, ´Be!´ and it is.

36.Aisha Bewley: ´Allah is my Lord and your Lord so worship Him. This is a straight path.´

37.Aisha Bewley: The parties differed among themselves. Woe to those who are kafir when they are present on a terrible Day!

38.Aisha Bewley: How clear will be their hearing, how perfect their sight, on the Day they come to Us; whereas today the wrongdoers are clearly misguided.

39.Aisha Bewley: Warn them of the Day of Bitter Regret when the affair will be resolved. But they take no notice. They have no iman.

40.Aisha Bewley: It is We who will inherit the earth and all those on it. They will be returned to Us.

41.Aisha Bewley: Mention Ibrahim in the Book. He was a true man and a Prophet.

42.Aisha Bewley: Remember when he said to his father, ´Father, why do you worship what can neither hear nor see and is not of any use to you at all?

43.Aisha Bewley: Father, knowledge which never reached you has come to me, so follow me and I will guide you to the right path.

44.Aisha Bewley: Father, do not worship Shaytan. Shaytan was disobedient to the All-Merciful.

45.Aisha Bewley: Father, I am afraid that a punishment from the All-Merciful will afflict you, and turn you into a comrade of Shaytan.´

46.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Do you forsake my gods, Ibrahim? If you do not stop, I will stone you. Keep away from me for a good long time.´

47.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Peace be upon you. I will ask my Lord to forgive you. He has always honoured me.

48.Aisha Bewley: I will separate myself from you and all you call upon besides Allah and I will call upon my Lord. It may well be that, in calling on my Lord, I will not be disappointed.´

49.Aisha Bewley: When he had separated himself from them, and what they worshipped besides Allah, We gave him Ishaq and Ya´qub, making each of them a Prophet.

50.Aisha Bewley: We endowed them with Our mercy and made them highly honoured.

51.Aisha Bewley: Mention Musa in the Book. He was truly sincere and was a Messenger and a Prophet.

52.Aisha Bewley: We called out to him from the right hand side of the Mount and We brought him near in close communication.

53.Aisha Bewley: We endowed him with Our mercy, making his brother Harun a Prophet.

54.Aisha Bewley: Mention Isma´il in the Book. He was true to his promise and was a Messenger and a Prophet.

55.Aisha Bewley: He used to command his people to do salat and give zakat and he was pleasing to his Lord.

56.Aisha Bewley: Mention Idris in the Book. He was a true man and a Prophet.

57.Aisha Bewley: We raised him up to a high place.

58.Aisha Bewley: Those are some of the Prophets Allah has blessed, from the descendants of Adam and from those We carried with Nuh, and from the descendants of Ibrahim and Isra´il and from those We guided and chose. When the Signs of the All-Merciful were recited to them they fell on their faces, weeping, in prostration.

59.Aisha Bewley: An evil generation succeeded them who neglected the salat and followed their appetites. They will plunge into the Valley of Evil —

60.Aisha Bewley: except for those who make tawba and have iman and act rightly. They will enter the Garden and they will not be wronged in any way:

61.Aisha Bewley: Gardens of Eden which the All-Merciful has promised to His slaves in the Unseen. His promise is always kept.

62.Aisha Bewley: They will not hear any prattling there — nothing but ´Peace´. They will receive their provision there morning and night.

63.Aisha Bewley: That is the Garden which We will bequeath to those of Our slaves who have taqwa.

64.Aisha Bewley: ´We only descend at your Lord´s command. Everything in front of us, and everything behind us, and everything in between belongs to Him. Your Lord does not forget.´

65.Aisha Bewley: He is Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything in between them, so worship Him and persevere in His worship. Do you know of any other with His Name?

66.Aisha Bewley: Man says, ´When I am dead, will I then be brought out again alive?´

67.Aisha Bewley: Does not man recall that We created him before when he was not anything?

68.Aisha Bewley: By your Lord, We will collect them and the shaytans together. Then We will assemble them around Hell on their knees.

69.Aisha Bewley: Then We will drag out from every sect the one among them most insolent towards the All-Merciful.

70.Aisha Bewley: Then it is We who will know best those most deserving to roast in it.

71.Aisha Bewley: There is not one of you who will not come to it. That is the final decision of your Lord.

72.Aisha Bewley: Then We will rescue those who had taqwa and We will leave the wrongdoers in it on their knees.

73.Aisha Bewley: When Our Clear Signs are recited to them, those who are kafir say to those who have iman, ´Which of the two parties has the better position and the more illustrious gathering?´

74.Aisha Bewley: How many generations We have destroyed before them who had finer furnishings and a better outward show!

75.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´As for those who are astray, let the All-Merciful prolong their term until they see what they were promised, whether it be the punishment or the Hour. Then they will know who is in the worse position and has the weaker troops.´

76.Aisha Bewley: Allah augments those who are guided by giving them greater guidance. In your Lord´s sight, right actions which are lasting are better both in reward and end result.

77.Aisha Bewley: Have you seen him who rejects Our Signs and says, ´I will certainly be given wealth and children there.´

78.Aisha Bewley: Has he surveyed the Unseen or has he a contract with the All-Merciful?

79.Aisha Bewley: No indeed! We will write down what he says and prolong the punishment for him.

80.Aisha Bewley: We will inherit from him the things he is talking about and he will come to Us all alone.

81.Aisha Bewley: They have taken other gods besides Allah to be a source of power and strength for them!

82.Aisha Bewley: No indeed! They will reject their worship and will be opposed to them.

83.Aisha Bewley: Do you not see that We send the shaytans against those who are kafir to goad them on?

84.Aisha Bewley: So do not try to hasten their punishment. We are simply counting out the number of their days.

85.Aisha Bewley: On that Day We will gather those who have taqwa to the All-Merciful with due ceremony.

86.Aisha Bewley: But We will drive the evildoers to Hell, like cattle to a watering hole.

87.Aisha Bewley: They have no right of intercession. None do but those who have a contract with the All-Merciful.

88.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´The All-Merciful has a son.´

89.Aisha Bewley: They have devised a monstrous thing.

90.Aisha Bewley: The heavens are all but rent apart and the earth split open and the mountains brought crashing down,

91.Aisha Bewley: at their ascription of a son to the All-Merciful!

92.Aisha Bewley: It is not fitting for the All-Merciful to have a son.

93.Aisha Bewley: There is no one in the heavens and earth who will not come to the All-Merciful as a slave.

94.Aisha Bewley: He has counted them and numbered them precisely.

95.Aisha Bewley: Each of them will come to Him on the Day of Rising all alone.

96.Aisha Bewley: As for those who have iman and do right actions, the All-Merciful will bestow His love on them.

97.Aisha Bewley: We have made it easy on your tongue so that you can give good news to those who have taqwa and warn stubbornly hostile people by it.

98.Aisha Bewley: How many generations We have destroyed before them! Do you see a trace of any one of them or hear even a whisper of them?

1.Aisha Bewley: Ta Ha.

2.Aisha Bewley: We did not send down the Qur´an to you to make you miserable,

3.Aisha Bewley: but only as a reminder for those who have fear,

4.Aisha Bewley: a Revelation from Him who created the earth and the high heavens,

5.Aisha Bewley: the All-Merciful, established firmly upon the Throne.

6.Aisha Bewley: Everything in the heavens and everything on the earth and everything in between them and everything under the ground belongs to Him.

7.Aisha Bewley: Though you speak out loud, He knows your secrets and what is even more concealed.

8.Aisha Bewley: Allah, there is no god but Him. The Most Beautiful Names are His.

9.Aisha Bewley: Has the story of Musa not reached you?

10.Aisha Bewley: When he saw a fire and said to his family, ´Wait here. I can make out a fire. Maybe I will bring you a brand from it, or will find guidance there.´

11.Aisha Bewley: Then when he reached it, a voice called out, ´Musa!

12.Aisha Bewley: I am your Lord. Take off your sandals. You are in the holy valley of Tuwa.

13.Aisha Bewley: I have chosen you, so listen well to what is revealed.

14.Aisha Bewley: I am Allah. There is no god but Me, so worship Me and establish salat to remember Me.

15.Aisha Bewley: The Hour is coming but I have concealed it so that every self can be repaid for its efforts.

16.Aisha Bewley: Do not let those who have no iman in it and follow their whims and desires debar you from it or you will be destroyed.

17.Aisha Bewley: What is that in your right hand, Musa?´

18.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´It is my staff. I lean on it and beat down leaves for my sheep with it and have other uses for it.´

19.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Throw it down, Musa.´

20.Aisha Bewley: He threw it down and suddenly it was a slithering snake.

21.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Take hold of it and have no fear. We will return it to its original form.

22.Aisha Bewley: Put your hand under your arm and press it to your side. It will emerge pure white yet quite unharmed, another Sign.

23.Aisha Bewley: In this way We show you some of Our greatest Signs.

24.Aisha Bewley: Go to Pharaoh. He has overstepped the bounds.´

25.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´O Lord, expand my breast for me

26.Aisha Bewley: and make my task easy for me.

27.Aisha Bewley: Loosen the knot in my tongue

28.Aisha Bewley: so that they will understand my words.

29.Aisha Bewley: Assign me a helper from my family,

30.Aisha Bewley: my brother Harun.

31.Aisha Bewley: Strengthen my back by him

32.Aisha Bewley: and let him share in my task,

33.Aisha Bewley: so that we can glorify You much

34.Aisha Bewley: and remember You much,

35.Aisha Bewley: for You are watching us.´

36.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Your request has been granted, Musa.

37.Aisha Bewley: We were gracious to you another time

38.Aisha Bewley: when We revealed to your mother:

39.Aisha Bewley: "Place him into the box and throw it into the sea and the sea will wash it up on the shore, where an enemy of Mine and his will pick it up." I showered you with love from Me so that you would be brought up under My supervision.

40.Aisha Bewley: When your sister went and said, "Shall I direct you to someone who will take care of him?" that was how We returned you to your mother so that she might delight her eyes and not be grieved. You killed a man and We rescued you from trouble and tested you with many trials. You stayed some years among the people of Madyan. Then you arrived at the pre-ordained time, Musa!

41.Aisha Bewley: I have chosen you for Myself.

42.Aisha Bewley: Go, you and your brother, with My Signs and do not slacken in remembering Me.

43.Aisha Bewley: Go to Pharaoh; he has overstepped the bounds.

44.Aisha Bewley: But speak to him with gentle words so that hopefully he will pay heed or show some fear.´

45.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Our Lord, we are afraid that he might persecute us or overstep the bounds.´

46.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Have no fear. I will be with you, All-Hearing and All-Seeing.

47.Aisha Bewley: Go to him and say, "We are your Lord´s Messengers so send the tribe of Israel away with us and do not punish them. We have brought you a Sign from your Lord. Peace be upon those who follow the guidance.

48.Aisha Bewley: It has been revealed to us that punishment is for him who denies the truth and turns away."´

49.Aisha Bewley: Pharaoh said, ´Who then is your Lord, Musa?´

50.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Our Lord is He who gives each thing its created form and then guides it.´

51.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´What about the previous generations?´

52.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Knowledge of them is with my Lord in a Book. My Lord does not misplace nor does He forget.´

53.Aisha Bewley: It is He who made the earth a cradle for you and threaded pathways for you through it and sent down water from the sky by which We have brought forth various different types of plants.

54.Aisha Bewley: Eat and pasture your cattle. Certainly there are Signs in that for people of sound intellect.

55.Aisha Bewley: From it We created you, to it We will return you, and from it We will bring you forth a second time.

56.Aisha Bewley: We showed him all of Our Signs, but he denied and spurned them.

57.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Have you come to us to expel us from our land by means of your magic, Musa?

58.Aisha Bewley: We will bring you magic to match it. So fix a time between us and you which neither we nor you will fail to keep at a place where we can meet halfway.´

59.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Your time is the day of the Festival. The people should gather in the morning.´

60.Aisha Bewley: So Pharaoh went away and concocted his scheme and then he arrived.

61.Aisha Bewley: Musa said to them, ´Woe to you! Do not fabricate lies against Allah or He will annihilate you with His punishment. Fabricators of lies are bound to fail.´

62.Aisha Bewley: They argued among themselves about the matter and had a secret conference.

63.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´These two magicians desire by their magic to expel you from your land and abolish your most excellent way of life,

64.Aisha Bewley: so decide on your scheme and then arrive together in force. He who gains the upper hand today will definitely prosper.´

65.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Musa, will you throw or shall we be the first to throw?´

66.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´No, you throw!´ And suddenly their ropes and staffs appeared to him, by their magic, to be slithering about.

67.Aisha Bewley: Musa experienced in himself a feeling of alarm.

68.Aisha Bewley: We said, ´Have no fear. You will have the upper hand.

69.Aisha Bewley: Throw down what is in your right hand. It will swallow up their handiwork. Their handiwork is just a magician´s trick. Magicians do not prosper wherever they go.´

70.Aisha Bewley: The magicians threw themselves down in prostration. They said, ´We have iman in the Lord of Harun and Musa.´

71.Aisha Bewley: Pharaoh said, ´Do you have iman in him before I have authorised you? He is your chief, the one who taught you magic. I will cut off your hands and feet alternately and have you crucified on palm trunks. Then you will know for certain which of us has the harsher and longer lasting punishment.´

72.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´We will never prefer you to the Clear Signs which have come to us nor to Him who brought us into being. Decide on any judgment you like. Your jurisdiction only covers the life of the dunya.

73.Aisha Bewley: We have had iman in our Lord so that He may forgive us for our mistakes and for the magic which you forced us to perform. Allah is better and longer lasting.´

74.Aisha Bewley: As for those who come to their Lord as evildoers, they will have Hell where they will neither die nor stay alive.

75.Aisha Bewley: But as for those who come to Him as muminun, having done right actions, they will have the highest ranks:

76.Aisha Bewley: Gardens of Eden with rivers flowing under them, remaining in them timelessly, for ever. That is the reward of those who purify themselves.

77.Aisha Bewley: We revealed to Musa, ´Travel with My slaves by night. Strike a dry path for them through the sea. Have no fear of being overtaken and do not be afraid.´

78.Aisha Bewley: Pharaoh pursued them with his troops and the sea overwhelmed them utterly.

79.Aisha Bewley: Pharoah misguided his people. He was no guide.

80.Aisha Bewley: Tribe of Israel! We rescued you from your enemy and made an appointment with you on the right hand side of the Mount and sent down manna and quails for you.

81.Aisha Bewley: Eat of the good things We have provided for you but do not go to excess in it or My anger will be unleashed on you. Anyone who has My anger unleashed on him has plunged to his ruin.

82.Aisha Bewley: But I am Ever-Forgiving to anyone who makes tawba and has iman and acts rightly and then is guided.

83.Aisha Bewley: ´Why have you hurried on ahead of your people, Musa?´

84.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´They are following in my tracks. I have hurried on ahead to you, My Lord, to gain Your good pleasure.´

85.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´We tried your people after you left and the Samiri has misguided them.´

86.Aisha Bewley: Musa returned to his people in anger and great sorrow. He said, ´My people, did not your Lord make you a handsome promise? Did the fulfilment of the contract seem too long to you or did you want to unleash your Lord´s anger upon yourselves, so you broke your promise to me?´

87.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´We did not break our promise to you of our own volition. But we were weighed down with the heavy loads of the people´s jewelry and we threw them in, for that is what the Samari did.´

88.Aisha Bewley: Then he produced a calf for them, a physical form which made a lowing sound. So they said, ´This is your god — and Musa´s god as well, but he forgot.´

89.Aisha Bewley: Could they not see that it did not reply to them and that it possessed no power to either harm or benefit them?

90.Aisha Bewley: Harun had earlier said to them, ´My people! It is just a trial for you. Your Lord is the All-Merciful, so follow me and obey my command!´

91.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´We will not stop devoting ourselves to it until Musa returns to us.´

92.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´What prevented you following me, Harun, when you saw that they had gone astray?

93.Aisha Bewley: Did you too, then, disobey my command?´

94.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Son of my mother! Do not seize me by the beard or by the hair. I was afraid that you would say, "You have caused division in the tribe of Israel and taken no notice to anything I said."´

95.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´What do you think you were doing, Samiri?´

96.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´I saw what they did not see. So I gathered up a handful from the Messenger´s footprints and threw it in. That is what my inner self urged me to do.´

97.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Go! In the this world you will have to say, "Untouchable!" And you have an appointment which you will not fail to keep. Look at your god to which you devoted so much time. We will burn it up and then scatter it as dust into the sea.

98.Aisha Bewley: Your god is Allah alone, there is no god but Him. He encompasses all things in His knowledge.´

99.Aisha Bewley: In this way We give you news of what has gone before and We have given you a reminder direct from Us.

100.Aisha Bewley: Those who turn away from it will bear a heavy burden on the Day of Rising,

101.Aisha Bewley: remaining in it timelessly, for ever. What an evil load they will bear on the Day of Rising!

102.Aisha Bewley: On the Day the Trumpet is blown — and We will gather the evildoers sightless on that Day —

103.Aisha Bewley: they will whisper secretly to one other, ´You only stayed for ten.´

104.Aisha Bewley: We know best what they will say when the most correct of them will say, ´You only stayed a day.´

105.Aisha Bewley: They will ask you about the mountains. Say: ´My Lord will scatter them as dust.

106.Aisha Bewley: He will leave them as a barren, level plain

107.Aisha Bewley: on which you will see no dip or gradient.´

108.Aisha Bewley: On that day they will follow the Summoner who has no crookedness in him at all. Voices will be humbled before the All-Merciful and nothing but a whisper will be heard.

109.Aisha Bewley: On that Day intercession will not be of any use except for him whom the All-Merciful has authorised and with whose speech He is well-pleased.

110.Aisha Bewley: He knows what is in front of them and behind them. But their knowledge does not encompass Him.

111.Aisha Bewley: Faces will be humbled to the Living, the All-Sustaining. and anyone weighed down with wrongdoing will have failed.

112.Aisha Bewley: But anyone who does right actions, being a mumin, need fear no wrong or any belittlement.

113.Aisha Bewley: In this way We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur´an and We have made various threats in it so that hopefully they will have taqwa or it will spur them into remembrance.

114.Aisha Bewley: High exalted be Allah, the King, the Real! Do not rush ahead with the Qur´an before its revelation to you is complete, and say: ´My Lord, increase me in knowledge.´

115.Aisha Bewley: We made a contract with Adam before, but he forgot. We did not find that he had a firm resolve.

116.Aisha Bewley: When We said to the angels, ´Prostrate yourselves to Adam!´ they prostrated, with the exception of Iblis who disdained to do it.

117.Aisha Bewley: We said, ´Adam, this is an enemy for you and your wife, so do not let him expel you from the Garden and thus make you miserable.

118.Aisha Bewley: You will not go hungry in it or suffer from nakedness.

119.Aisha Bewley: You will not go thirsty in it or burn in the sun.´

120.Aisha Bewley: But Shaytan whispered to him, saying, ´Adam, shall I show you the way to the Tree of Everlasting Life and to a kingdom which will never fade away?´

121.Aisha Bewley: So the two of them ate from it and their private parts were disclosed to them and they started stitching together the leaves of the Garden to cover themselves. Adam disobeyed his Lord and became misled.

122.Aisha Bewley: But then his Lord chose him and turned to him and guided him.

123.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Go down from it, all of you, as enemies to one another! But when guidance comes to you from Me, all those who follow My guidance will not go astray and will not be miserable.

124.Aisha Bewley: But if anyone turns away from My reminder, his life will be a dark and narrow one and on the Day of Rising We will gather him blind.´

125.Aisha Bewley: He will say, ´My Lord, why have you gathered me blind when before I was able to see?´

126.Aisha Bewley: He will say, ´Just as Our Signs came to you and you forgot them, in the same way you too are forgotten today.´

127.Aisha Bewley: That is how We repay anyone who is profligate and does not have iman in the Signs of his Lord. And the punishment of the Next World is much harsher and longer lasting.

128.Aisha Bewley: Are they not guided by the many generations We have destroyed before them, among whose dwelling places they walk about? There are Signs in that for people of sound intellect.

129.Aisha Bewley: And were it not for a prior word from your Lord, and a specified term, it would inevitably have already taken place.

130.Aisha Bewley: So be steadfast in the face of what they say and glorify your Lord with praise before the rising of the sun and before its setting. And glorify Him during part of the night and at both ends of the day, so that hopefully you will be pleased.

131.Aisha Bewley: Do not direct your eyes longingly to what We have given certain of them to enjoy, the flower of the life of this world, so that We can test them by it. Your Lord´s provision is better and longer lasting.

132.Aisha Bewley: Instruct your family to do salat, and be constant in it. We do not ask you for provision. We provide for you. And the best end result is gained by taqwa.

133.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´If only he would bring us a Sign from his Lord!´ Have they not received the Clear Sign of what is written in the earlier texts?

134.Aisha Bewley: If We had destroyed them with a punishment before this, they would have said, ´Our Lord, why did You not send us a Messenger, so we could follow Your Signs before we were humbled and disgraced?´

135.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Everyone is waiting expectantly so wait expectantly. You will soon know who are the Companions of the Right Path and who is is guided.´

1.Aisha Bewley: Mankind´s Reckoning has drawn very close to them, yet they heedlessly turn away.

2.Aisha Bewley: No fresh reminder comes to them from their Lord without their listening to it as if it was a game.

3.Aisha Bewley: Their hearts are distracted. Those who do wrong confer together secretly, saying, ´Is this man anything but a human being like yourselves? Do you succumb to magic with your eyes wide open?´

4.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´My Lord knows what is said in heaven and earth. He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.´

5.Aisha Bewley: Furthermore they say, ´A muddled jumble of dreams!´ and, ´He has invented it!´ and, ´He is a poet!´ and, ´Let him bring us a Sign like those sent to previous peoples.´

6.Aisha Bewley: None of the cities which We destroyed before them had iman. So will they?

7.Aisha Bewley: We have only ever sent before you men who were given Revelation. Ask the People of the Reminder if you do not know.

8.Aisha Bewley: We did not give them bodies which did not eat food, nor were they immortal.

9.Aisha Bewley: But We kept Our promise to them and rescued them and those We willed, and destroyed the profligate.

10.Aisha Bewley: We have sent down to you a Book containing your Reminder. So will you not use your intellect?

11.Aisha Bewley: How many cities which did wrong have We utterly destroyed, raising up other people after them!

12.Aisha Bewley: When they perceived Our violent force they ran away from it.

13.Aisha Bewley: ´Do not run away! Return to the life of luxury you enjoyed and to the places where you lived, so that you can be interrogated!´

14.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Alas for us! We were indeed wrongdoers!´

15.Aisha Bewley: That cry of theirs went on until We made them stubble, silent, stamped out.

16.Aisha Bewley: We did not create heaven and earth and everything in between them as a game.

17.Aisha Bewley: If We had desired to have some amusement, We would have derived it from Our Presence, but We did not do that.

18.Aisha Bewley: Rather We hurl the truth against falsehood and it cuts right through it and it vanishes clean away! Woe without end for you for what you portray!

19.Aisha Bewley: Everyone in the heavens and the earth belongs to Him. Those in His presence do not consider themselves too great to worship Him and do not grow tired of it.

20.Aisha Bewley: They glorify Him by night and day, without ever flagging.

21.Aisha Bewley: Or have they taken gods out of the earth who can bring the dead to life?

22.Aisha Bewley: If there had been any gods besides Allah in heaven or earth, they would both be ruined. Glory be to Allah, Lord of the Throne, beyond what they describe!

23.Aisha Bewley: He will not be questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned.

24.Aisha Bewley: Or have they taken other gods besides Him? Say: ´Produce your proof! This is the message of those with me and the message of those before me.´ But most of them do not know the truth, so they turn away.

25.Aisha Bewley: We sent no Messenger before you without revealing to him: ´There is no god but Me, so worship Me.´

26.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´The All-Merciful has a son.´ Glory be to Him! No, they are honoured slaves!

27.Aisha Bewley: They do not precede Him in speech and they act on His command.

28.Aisha Bewley: He knows what is in front of them and what is behind them. They only intercede on behalf of those with whom He is pleased, and even they are apprehensive out of fear of Him.

29.Aisha Bewley: Were any of them to say, ´I am a god apart from Him,´ We would repay him with Hell. That is how We repay wrongdoers.

30.Aisha Bewley: Do those who are kafir not see that the heavens and the earth were sewn together and then We unstitched them and that We made from water every living thing? So will they not have iman?

31.Aisha Bewley: We placed firmly embedded mountains on the earth, so it would not move under them, and We put broad valleys as roadways in it, so that perhaps they might be guided.

32.Aisha Bewley: We made the sky a preserved and protected roof yet still they turn away from Our Signs.

33.Aisha Bewley: It is He who created night and day and the sun and moon, each one swimming in a sphere.

34.Aisha Bewley: We did not give any human being before you immortality. And if you die, will they then be immortal?

35.Aisha Bewley: Every self will taste death. We test you with both good and evil as a trial. And you will be returned to Us.

36.Aisha Bewley: When those who are kafir see you, they only make a mockery out of you: ´Is this the one who makes mention of your gods?´ Yet they are kuffar about the mention of the All-Merciful.

37.Aisha Bewley: Man was created hasty. I will show you My Signs so do not try to hasten Me.

38.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´When will this promise come about if you are telling the truth?´

39.Aisha Bewley: If those who are kafir only knew of the time when they will not be able to keep the Fire away from their faces or their backs! And they will receive no help!

40.Aisha Bewley: No, it will come upon them suddenly, confounding them, taking them completely by surprise, and they will not be able to ward it off. They will be granted no reprieve.

41.Aisha Bewley: Messengers before you were also mocked, but those who jeered were engulfed by what they mocked.

42.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Who will protect you night and day from the All-Merciful?´ Yet they turn away from the remembrance of their Lord.

43.Aisha Bewley: Or do they have gods besides Us who will protect them? They cannot even help themselves! They will not be safe from Us.

44.Aisha Bewley: No indeed! We have given these people enjoyment, as We did their fathers, until life seemed long and good to them. Do they not see how We come to the land eroding it from its extremities? Or are they the victors?

45.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´I can only warn you through the Revelation.´ But the deaf cannot hear the call when they are warned.

46.Aisha Bewley: If even a single waft of the punishment were to touch them, they would say, ´Alas for us! We were indeed wrongdoers.´

47.Aisha Bewley: We will set up the Just Balance on the Day of Rising and no self will be wronged in any way. Even if it is no more than the weight of a grain of mustard-seed, We will produce it. We are sufficient as a Reckoner.

48.Aisha Bewley: We gave to Musa and Harun the Discrimination and a Shining Light and a Reminder for those with taqwa:

49.Aisha Bewley: those who fear their Lord in the Unseen and are apprehensive about the Hour.

50.Aisha Bewley: This is a blessed Reminder which We have sent down. So are you going to ignore it?

51.Aisha Bewley: We gave Ibrahim his right guidance early on, and We had complete knowledge of him.

52.Aisha Bewley: When he said to his father and his people, ´What are these statues you are clinging to?´

53.Aisha Bewley: they said, ´We found our fathers worshipping them.´

54.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´You and your fathers are clearly misguided.´

55.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Have you brought us the truth or are you playing games?´

56.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Far from it! Your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, He who brought them into being. I am one of those who bear witness to that.

57.Aisha Bewley: By Allah, I will devise some scheme against your idols when your backs are turned.´

58.Aisha Bewley: He broke them in pieces, except for the biggest one, so that they would have it to consult!

59.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Who has done this to our gods? He is definitely one of the wrongdoers!´

60.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´We heard a young man mentioning them. They call him Ibrahim.´

61.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Bring him before the people´s eyes so they can be witnesses.´

62.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Did you do this to our gods, Ibrahim?´

63.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´No, this one, the biggest of them, did it. Ask them if they are able to speak!´

64.Aisha Bewley: They consulted among themselves and said, ´It is you yourselves who are wrongdoers.´

65.Aisha Bewley: But then they relapsed back into their kufr: ´You know full well these idols cannot talk.´

66.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Do you then worship, instead of Allah, what cannot help or harm you in any way?

67.Aisha Bewley: Shame on you and what you worship besides Allah! Will you not use your intellect?´

68.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Burn him and support your gods if you are resolved to do something.´

69.Aisha Bewley: We said, ´Fire, be coolness and peace for Ibrahim!´

70.Aisha Bewley: They desired to trap him but We made them the losers.

71.Aisha Bewley: We delivered both him and Lut to the land which We had blessed for all beings.

72.Aisha Bewley: And in addition to that We gave him Ishaq and Ya´qub and made both of them salihun.

73.Aisha Bewley: We made them leaders, guiding by Our command, and revealed to them how to do good actions and establish salat and pay zakat, and they worshipped Us.

74.Aisha Bewley: We gave right judgement and knowledge to Lut and rescued him from the city which committed disgusting acts. They were evil people who were deviators.

75.Aisha Bewley: We admitted him into Our mercy. He was one of the righteoys.

76.Aisha Bewley: And Nuh, when he called out before and We responded to him and rescued him and his family from the terrible plight.

77.Aisha Bewley: We helped him against the people who rejected Our Signs. They were an evil people and We drowned them, every one.

78.Aisha Bewley: And Dawud and Sulayman when they gave judgement about the field, when the people´s sheep strayed into it at night. We were Witness to their judgement.

79.Aisha Bewley: We gave Sulayman understanding of it. We gave each of them judgement and knowledge. We subjected the mountains to Dawud, glorifying, and the birds as well. This is something We are well able to do.

80.Aisha Bewley: We taught him the art of making garments for you to protect you against each others´ violence, But do you show any thanks?

81.Aisha Bewley: And to Sulayman We gave the fiercely blowing wind, speeding at his command towards the land which We had blessed. And We had full knowledge of everything.

82.Aisha Bewley: And some of the shaytans dived for him and did other things apart from that. And We were watching over them.

83.Aisha Bewley: And Ayyub when he called out to his Lord, ´Great harm has afflicted me and You are the Most Merciful of the merciful,´

84.Aisha Bewley: We responded to him and removed from him the harm which was afflicting him and restored his family to him, and the same again with them, as a mercy direct from Us and a Reminder to all worshippers.

85.Aisha Bewley: And Isma´il and Idris and Dhu´l-Kifl — each one was among the steadfast.

86.Aisha Bewley: We admitted them into Our mercy. They were among the righteous.

87.Aisha Bewley: And Dhu´n-Nun when he left in anger and thought We would not punish him. He called out in the pitch darkness: ´There is no god but You! Glory be to You! Truly I have been one of the wrongdoers.´

88.Aisha Bewley: We responded to him and rescued him from his grief. That is how We rescue the muminun.

89.Aisha Bewley: And Zakariyya when he called out to his Lord, ´My Lord, do not leave me on my own, though You are the Best of Inheritors.´

90.Aisha Bewley: We responded to him and gave him Yahya, restoring for him his wife´s fertility. They outdid one another in good actions, calling out to Us in yearning and in awe, and humbling themselves to Us.

91.Aisha Bewley: And she who protected her private parts. We breathed into her some of Our Ruh and made her and her son a Sign for all the worlds.

92.Aisha Bewley: This nation of yours is one nation and I am your Lord, so worship Me.

93.Aisha Bewley: But they disagreed and split into different sects. Each one will return to Us.

94.Aisha Bewley: As for anyone who does right actions and is a mumin, his striving certainly does not go unthanked. We are writing it down on his behalf.

95.Aisha Bewley: There is a ban on any city We have destroyed; they will not return.

96.Aisha Bewley: When Yajuj and Majuj are let loose and rush down from every slope,

97.Aisha Bewley: and the True Promise is very close, the eyes of those who were kafir will be transfixed: ´Alas for us! We were unmindful of this! No, rather we were definitely wrongdoers.´

98.Aisha Bewley: You and what you worship besides Allah are fuel for Hell. You will go down into it.
