99.Aisha Bewley: If those had really been gods, they would not have gone down into it. Each one will be in it timelessly, for ever.

100.Aisha Bewley: There will be sighing for them in it and they will not be able to hear.

101.Aisha Bewley: Those for whom the Best from Us was pre-ordained, will be far away from it.

102.Aisha Bewley: They will not hear the slightest hint of it and they will remain there timelessly, for ever, among everything their selves desire.

103.Aisha Bewley: The greatest terror will not upset them and the angels will welcome them: ´This is your Day, the one that you were promised.´

104.Aisha Bewley: That Day We will fold up heaven like folding up the pages of a book. As We originated the first creation so We will regenerate it. It is a promise binding on Us. That is what We will do.

105.Aisha Bewley: We wrote down in the Zabur, after the Reminder came: ´It is My slaves who are salihun who will inherit the righteous.´

106.Aisha Bewley: Certainly there is a transmission in this for people who worship.

107.Aisha Bewley: We have only sent you as a mercy to all the worlds.

108.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´It is revealed to me that your god is One God. So are you Muslims?´

109.Aisha Bewley: If they turn their backs, then say: ´I have informed all of you equally and I do not know if what you have been promised is near or far.

110.Aisha Bewley: He knows what is said openly and He knows what you hide.

111.Aisha Bewley: For all I know it might be a trial for you and you will have enjoyment for a time.´

112.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Lord, judge with truth! Our Lord is the All-Merciful, the One whose help is sought in the face of what you describe.´

1.Aisha Bewley: Mankind, have taqwa of your Lord! The quaking of the Hour is a terrible thing.

2.Aisha Bewley: On the day they see it, every nursing woman will be oblivious of the baby at her breast, and every pregnant woman will abort the contents of her womb, and you will think people drunk when they are not drunk; it is just that the punishment of Allah is so severe.

3.Aisha Bewley: Among people there is one who argues about Allah without knowledge, and follows every rebellious shaytan.

4.Aisha Bewley: It is written of him that if anyone takes him as a friend, he will mislead him and guide him to the punishment of the Searing Blaze.

5.Aisha Bewley: Mankind! if you are in any doubt about the Rising, know that We created you from dust then from a drop of sperm then from a clot of blood then from a lump of flesh, formed yet unformed, so We may make things clear to you. We make whatever We want stay in the womb until a specified time and then We bring you out as children so that you can reach your full maturity. Some of you die and some of you revert to the lowest form of life so that, after having knowledge, they then know nothing at all. And you see the earth dead and barren; then when We send down water onto it it quivers and swells and sprouts with luxuriant plants of every kind.

6.Aisha Bewley: That is because Allah is the Real and gives life to the dead and has power over all things

7.Aisha Bewley: and the Hour is coming without any doubt and Allah will raise up all those in the graves.

8.Aisha Bewley: Among people there is one who argues about Allah without knowledge or guidance or any light-giving Book,

9.Aisha Bewley: turning away arrogantly, to misguide people from the Way of Allah. He will be disgraced in this world and on the Day of Rising We will make him taste the punishment of the Burning:

10.Aisha Bewley: ´That is for what you did before. Allah does not wrong His slaves.´

11.Aisha Bewley: Among the people there is one who worships Allah right on the edge. If good befalls him, he is content with it, but if a trial befalls him, he reverts to his former ways, losing both this world and the Next World. That is indeed sheer loss.

12.Aisha Bewley: Instead of Allah, he calls on something which cannot harm him or help him. That is extreme misguidance.

13.Aisha Bewley: He calls on what is far more likely to harm than help. What an evil protector! What an evil associate!

14.Aisha Bewley: Allah will admit those who have iman and do right actions into Gardens with rivers flowing under them. Allah does whatever He wishes.

15.Aisha Bewley: Anyone who thinks that Allah will not help him in this world and the Next World should stretch a rope up to the ceiling and then hang himself. Let him see whether his stratagem gets rid of what enrages him!

16.Aisha Bewley: In this way We have sent it down as Clear Signs. Allah guides anyone He wills.

17.Aisha Bewley: As for those who have iman and those who are Jews and the Sabaeans and the Christians, Magians and idolaters, Allah will distinguish between them on the Day of Rising. Allah is witness of all things.

18.Aisha Bewley: Do you not see that everyone in the heavens and everyone on the earth prostrates to Allah, and the sun and moon and stars and the mountains, trees and beasts and many of mankind? But many of them inevitably merit punishment. Those Allah humiliates will have no one to honour them. Allah does whatever He wills.

19.Aisha Bewley: Here are two rival groups who disputed concerning their Lord. Those who are kafir will have garments of fire cut out for them, and boiling water poured over their heads,

20.Aisha Bewley: which will melt the contents of their bellies as well as their skin,

21.Aisha Bewley: and they will be beaten with cudgels made of iron.

22.Aisha Bewley: Every time they want to come out of it, because of their suffering, they will be driven back into it: ´Taste the punishment of the Burning!´

23.Aisha Bewley: But Allah will admit those who have iman and do right actions into Gardens with rivers flowing under them where they will be adorned with gold bracelets and pearls, and where their clothing will be of silk.

24.Aisha Bewley: They have been guided to speak good words and guided to the praiseworthy path.

25.Aisha Bewley: Those who are kafir and bar access to the Way of Allah and to the Masjid al-Haram which We have appointed for all mankind — equally for those who live near it and those who come from far away — those who desire to profane it with wrongdoing, We will let them taste a painful punishment.

26.Aisha Bewley: And We located the position of the House for Ibrahim: ´Do not associate anything with Me and purify My House for those who circle it, and those who stand and bow and prostrate.

27.Aisha Bewley: Announce the Hajj to mankind. They will come to you on foot and on every sort of lean animal, coming by every distant road

28.Aisha Bewley: so that they can be present at what will profit them and invoke Allah´s name on specific days over livestock He has provided for them. Eat of them and feed those who are poor and in need.

29.Aisha Bewley: Then they should end their state of self-neglect and fufil their vows and circle the Ancient House.´

30.Aisha Bewley: That is it. If someone honours Allah´s sacred things, that is better for him in his Lord´s sight. All livestock are permitted to you except what has already been recited to you. Have done with the defilement of idols and have done with telling lies.

31.Aisha Bewley: Be people of pure natural belief in Allah, not associating anything else with Him. As for anyone who associates others with Allah, it is as though he had fallen from the sky and the birds had seized him and carried him away or the wind had dropped him in a distant place.

32.Aisha Bewley: That is it. As for those who honour Allah´s sacred rites, that comes from the taqwa in their hearts.

33.Aisha Bewley: You can make use of the sacrificial animals until a specified time, and then their place of sacrifice is by the Ancient House.

34.Aisha Bewley: We have appointed a rite of sacrifice for every nation so that they may invoke Allah´s name over the livestock He has given them. Your God is One God so submit to Him. Give good news to the humble-hearted,

35.Aisha Bewley: whose hearts quake at the mention of Allah, and who are steadfast in the face of all that happens to them, those who establish salat and give of what We have provided for them.

36.Aisha Bewley: We have appointed the sacrificial animals for you as one of the sacred rites of Allah. There is good in them for you, so invoke Allah´s name over them, as they stand in rows. And then when they collapse on their sides, eat of them and feed both those who ask and those who are too shy to ask. In this way We have subjected them to you so that hopefully you will be thankful.

37.Aisha Bewley: Their flesh and blood does not reach Allah but your taqwa does reach Him. In this way He has subjected them to you so that you might proclaim Allah´s greatness for the way that He has guided you. Give good news to the good-doers.

38.Aisha Bewley: Allah will defend those who have iman. Allah does not love any thankless traitor.

39.Aisha Bewley: Permission to fight is given to those who are fought against because they have been wronged — truly Allah has the power to come to their support —

40.Aisha Bewley: those who were expelled from their homes without any right, merely for saying, ´Our Lord is Allah´ (if Allah had not driven some people back by means of others, monasteries, churches, synagogues and mosques, where Allah´s name is mentioned much, would have been pulled down and destroyed. Allah will certainly help those who help Him — Allah is All-Strong, Almighty),

41.Aisha Bewley: those who, if We establish them firmly on the earth, will establish salat and pay zakat, and command what is right and forbid what is wrong. The end result of all affairs is with Allah.

42.Aisha Bewley: If they deny you, the people of Nuh before them denied him and those of ´Ad and of Thamud

43.Aisha Bewley: and the people of Ibrahim and the people of Lut

44.Aisha Bewley: and the companions of Madyan; and Musa was denied as well. I allowed time to the kafirun but then I seized them. How terrible was My denial!

45.Aisha Bewley: How many wrongdoing cities We destroyed, and now all their roofs and walls are fallen in; how many abandoned wells and stuccoed palaces!

46.Aisha Bewley: Have they not travelled about the earth and do they not have hearts to understand with or ears to hear with? It is not their eyes which are blind but the hearts in their breasts which are blind.

47.Aisha Bewley: They ask you to hasten the punishment. Allah will not break His promise. A day with your Lord is equivalent to a thousand years in the way you count.

48.Aisha Bewley: How many wrongdoing cities I allowed time to and then I seized them. I am their final destination!

49.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Mankind, I am only a clear warner to you.´

50.Aisha Bewley: As for those who have iman and do right actions, they will have forgiveness and generous provision.

51.Aisha Bewley: But as for those who strive against My Signs and try to thwart them, they will be the Companions of the Blazing Fire.

52.Aisha Bewley: We did not send any Messenger or any Prophet before you without Shaytan insinuating something into his recitation while he was reciting. But Allah revokes whatever Shaytan insinuates and then Allah confirms His Signs — Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise —

53.Aisha Bewley: so that He can make what Shaytan insinuates a trial for those with sickness in their hearts and for those whose hearts are hard — the wrongdoers are entrenched in hostility —

54.Aisha Bewley: and so that those who have been given knowledge will know it is the truth from their Lord and have iman in it and their hearts will be humbled to Him. Allah guides those who have iman to a straight path.

55.Aisha Bewley: But those who are kafir will not cease to be in doubt of it until the Hour comes on them suddenly or the punishment of a desolate Day arrives.

56.Aisha Bewley: Sovereignty on that Day will be Allah´s. He will judge between them. Those who have iman and do right actions will be in Gardens of Delight.

57.Aisha Bewley: But those who are kafir and deny Our Signs will have a humiliating punishment.

58.Aisha Bewley: Those who make hijra in the Way of Allah and then are killed or die, Allah will provide for them handsomely. Truly Allah is the best Provider.

59.Aisha Bewley: He will admit them by an entrance which is pleasing to them. Allah is All-Knowing, All-Forbearing.

60.Aisha Bewley: That is so. And if anyone inflicts an injury the same as the one done to him and then is again oppressed, Allah will come to his aid. Allah is All-Pardoning, Ever-Forgiving.

61.Aisha Bewley: That is because Allah merges night into day and merges day into night and because Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

62.Aisha Bewley: That is because Allah is the Real and what you call on apart from Him is false. Allah is the All-High, the Most Great.

63.Aisha Bewley: Do you not see that Allah sends down water from the sky and then in the morning the earth is covered in green? Allah is All-Subtle, All-Aware.

64.Aisha Bewley: Everything in the heavens and everything in the earth belongs to Him. Allah is the Rich Beyond Need, the Praiseworthy.

65.Aisha Bewley: Do you not see that Allah has made everything on the earth subservient to you and the ships running upon the sea by His command? He holds back the heaven, preventing it from falling to the earth — except by His permission. Allah is All-Compassionate to mankind, Most Merciful.

66.Aisha Bewley: It is He who gave you life and then will cause you to die and then will give you life again. Man is truly ungrateful.

67.Aisha Bewley: We have appointed for every nation a rite that they observe, so let them not dispute with you about the matter. Call the people to your Lord. You are guided straight.

68.Aisha Bewley: If they do argue with you, say: ´Allah knows best what you are doing.´

69.Aisha Bewley: Allah will judge between you on the Day of Rising regarding everything about which you differed.

70.Aisha Bewley: Do you not know that Allah knows everything in heaven and earth? That is in a Book. That is easy for Allah.

71.Aisha Bewley: They worship besides Allah something for which no authority has come down, something about which they have no knowledge. There is no helper for the wrongdoers.

72.Aisha Bewley: When Our Signs are recited to them — Clear Signs — you can detect denial in the faces of those who are kafir. They all but assault those who recite Our Signs to them! Say: ´Shall I inform you of something worse than that? The Fire which Allah has promised those who are kafir. What an evil destination!´

73.Aisha Bewley: Mankind! an example has been made, so listen to it carefully. Those whom you call upon besides Allah are not even able to create a single fly, even if they were to join together to do it. And if a fly steals something from them, they cannot get it back. How feeble are both the seeker and the sought!

74.Aisha Bewley: They do not measure Allah with His true measure. Allah is All-Strong, Almighty.

75.Aisha Bewley: Allah chooses Messengers from the angels and from mankind. Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

76.Aisha Bewley: He knows what is before them and what is behind them. All matters return to Allah.

77.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! bow and prostrate and worship your Lord, and do good, so that hopefully you will be successful.

78.Aisha Bewley: Do jihad for Allah with the jihad due to Him. He has selected you and not placed any constraint upon you in the deen — the religion of your forefather Ibrahim. He named you Muslims before and also in this, so that the Messenger could be witness against you and you could be witnesses against all mankind. So establish salat and pay zakat and hold fast to Allah. He is your Protector — the Best Protector, the Best Helper.

1.Aisha Bewley: It is the muminun who are successful:

2.Aisha Bewley: those who are humble in their salat;

3.Aisha Bewley: those who turn away from worthless talk;

4.Aisha Bewley: those who pay zakat;

5.Aisha Bewley: those who guard their private parts —

6.Aisha Bewley: except from their wives or those they own as slaves, in which case they are not blameworthy;

7.Aisha Bewley: but those who desire anything more than that are people who have gone beyond the limits —

8.Aisha Bewley: those who honour their trusts and their contracts;

9.Aisha Bewley: those who safeguard their salat:

10.Aisha Bewley: such people are the inheritors

11.Aisha Bewley: who will inherit Firdaws, remaining in it timelessly, for ever.

12.Aisha Bewley: We created man from the purest kind of clay;

13.Aisha Bewley: then made him a drop in a secure receptacle;

14.Aisha Bewley: then formed the drop into a clot and formed the clot into a lump and formed the lump into bones and clothed the bones in flesh; and then brought him into being as another creature. Blessed be Allah, the Best of Creators!

15.Aisha Bewley: Then subsequently you will certainly die.

16.Aisha Bewley: Then on the Day of Rising you will be raised again.

17.Aisha Bewley: We created above you seven levels and We were not unaware of the creation.

18.Aisha Bewley: We sent down a measured amount of water from heaven and lodged it firmly in the earth; and We are well able to remove it.

19.Aisha Bewley: By means of it We produce gardens of dates and grapes for you, in which there are many fruits for you and from which you eat,

20.Aisha Bewley: and a tree springing forth from Mount Sinai yielding oil and a seasoning to those who eat.

21.Aisha Bewley: And there is certainly a lesson for you in your livestock. We give you to drink from what is in their bellies and there are many ways in which you benefit from them, and some of them you eat;

22.Aisha Bewley: and you are conveyed on them and on ships as well.

23.Aisha Bewley: We sent Nuh to his people and he said, ´My people, worship Allah. You have no god other than Him. So will you not have taqwa?´

24.Aisha Bewley: The ruling circle of those of his people who were kafir said, ´This is nothing but a human being like yourselves who simply wants to gain ascendancy over you. If Allah had wanted He would have sent angels down. We never heard of anything like this among our ancestors, the earlier peoples.

25.Aisha Bewley: He is nothing but a man possessed so wait a while and see what happens to him.´

26.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´My Lord, help me because of their calling me a liar!´

27.Aisha Bewley: We revealed to him: ´Build the Ship under Our supervision and as We reveal. When Our command comes and water bubbles up from the earth, load into it a pair of every species, and your family — except for those among them against whom the word has already gone ahead. And do not address Me concerning those who do wrong. They shall be drowned.

28.Aisha Bewley: When you and those with you are settled in the Ship, then say: "Praise be to Allah who has rescued us from the people of the wrongdoers!"

29.Aisha Bewley: And say: "My Lord, land me in a blessed landing-place. You are the best Bringer to Land."´

30.Aisha Bewley: There are Signs in that. We are always putting people to the test.

31.Aisha Bewley: Then We raised up another generation after them

32.Aisha Bewley: and sent a Messenger to them from themselves: ´Worship Allah. You have no god other than Him! So will you not have taqwa?´

33.Aisha Bewley: The ruling circle of his people — those who were kafir and denied the encounter of the Next World and whom We had given opulence in this world — said, ´This is nothing but a human being like yourselves. who eats what you eat and drinks what you drink.

34.Aisha Bewley: If you were to obey a human being like yourselves, you would, in that case, definitely be the losers.

35.Aisha Bewley: Does he promise you that when you have died and become dust and bones you will be brought forth again?

36.Aisha Bewley: What you have been promised is sheer nonsense!

37.Aisha Bewley: What is there but our life in this world? We die and we live and we will not be raised again.

38.Aisha Bewley: What is he but a man who has invented a lie against Allah? We do not have iman in him.´

39.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´My Lord, help me because of their calling me a liar!´

40.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´In a short while they will be full of regret.´

41.Aisha Bewley: The Great Blast seized hold of them inexorably and We turned them into dirty scum. Away with the people of the wrongdoers!

42.Aisha Bewley: Then We raised up other generations after them.

43.Aisha Bewley: No nation can advance its appointed time nor can they delay it.

44.Aisha Bewley: Then We sent Our Messengers one after another, at intervals. Each time its Messenger came to a community they called him a liar so We made them follow one another too and turned them into myths and legends. Away with the people who have no iman!

45.Aisha Bewley: Then We sent Musa and his brother Harun with Our Signs and clear authority

46.Aisha Bewley: to Pharaoh and his ruling circle. But they were proud and were a haughty people.

47.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´What! Should we have iman in two human beings like ourselves when their people are our slaves?´

48.Aisha Bewley: They denied them and so they were destroyed.

49.Aisha Bewley: We gave Musa the Book so that perhaps they would be guided.

50.Aisha Bewley: And We made the son of Maryam and his mother a Sign and gave them shelter on a mountainside where there was a meadow and a flowing spring.

51.Aisha Bewley: Messengers, eat of the good things and act rightly. I most certainly know what you do.

52.Aisha Bewley: This faith of yours is a single faith and I am your Lord, so have taqwa of Me.

53.Aisha Bewley: But they disagreed and split up, dividing into sects, each party exulting in what it had.

54.Aisha Bewley: So leave them in their glut of ignorance for a while.

55.Aisha Bewley: Do they imagine that, in the wealth and children We extend to them,

56.Aisha Bewley: We are hastening to them with good things? No indeed, but they have no awareness!

57.Aisha Bewley: Those who are filled with the fear of their Lord,

58.Aisha Bewley: those who have iman in the Signs of their Lord,

59.Aisha Bewley: those who do not associate anything with their Lord,

60.Aisha Bewley: those who give what they have given, their hearts fearful of their return to their Lord,

61.Aisha Bewley: such people are truly racing towards good things, and they are the first to reach them.

62.Aisha Bewley: We do not impose on any self any more than it can stand. With Us there is a Book which speaks the truth. They will not be wronged.

63.Aisha Bewley: However, their hearts are overwhelmed by ignorance about this matter and they do other things as well.

64.Aisha Bewley: But then when We seize the affluent among them with the punishment, they will suddenly start praying fervently.

65.Aisha Bewley: ´Do not pray fervently today. You will not get any help from Us.

66.Aisha Bewley: My Signs were recited to you and you turned round on your heels,

67.Aisha Bewley: arrogant towards it, talking arrant nonsense all night long.´

68.Aisha Bewley: Do they not ponder these words? Has anything come to them that did not come to their ancestors the previous peoples?

69.Aisha Bewley: Or is it that they do not recognise their Messenger and therefore do not acknowledge him?

70.Aisha Bewley: Or do they say, ´He is a man possessed,´ when he has brought the truth to them? But most of them hate the truth.

71.Aisha Bewley: If the truth were to follow their whims and desires, the heavens and the earth and everyone in them would have been brought to ruin. No indeed! We have given them their Reminder, but they have turned away from it.

72.Aisha Bewley: Are you asking them for payment? Your Lord´s payment is better. He is the Best of Providers.

73.Aisha Bewley: You are calling them to a straight path.

74.Aisha Bewley: But those who do not have iman in the akhira recoil from the path.

75.Aisha Bewley: If We did have mercy on them and removed the harm afflicting them, they would still obstinately persist in wandering blindly in their excessive insolence.

76.Aisha Bewley: We seized them with the punishment, but they did not go low before their Lord; nor will they humble themselves

77.Aisha Bewley: until We open to them a gate to a harsh punishment in which they will at once be crushed by despair.

78.Aisha Bewley: It is He who has created hearing, sight and hearts for you. What little thanks you show!

79.Aisha Bewley: It is He who dispersed you about the earth and you will be gathered to Him.

80.Aisha Bewley: It is He who gives life and causes to die and His is the alternation of the night and day. So will you not use your intellect?

81.Aisha Bewley: However, they say the same as previous peoples said.

82.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´When we are dead and turned to dust and bones, shall we then be raised again?

83.Aisha Bewley: We and our forefathers were promised this before. This is nothing but the myths of previous peoples!´

84.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´To whom does the earth belong, and everyone in it, if you have any knowledge?´

85.Aisha Bewley: They will say: ´To Allah.´ Say: ´So will you not pay heed?´

86.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Who is the Lord of the Seven Heavens and the Lord of the Mighty Throne?´

87.Aisha Bewley: They will say: ´Allah.´ Say: ´So will you not have taqwa?´

88.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´In whose hand is the dominion over everything, He who gives protection and from whom no protection can be given, if you have any knowledge?´

89.Aisha Bewley: They will say: ´Allah´s.´ Say: ´So how have you been bewitched?´

90.Aisha Bewley: The fact is that We have given them the truth and they are liars.

91.Aisha Bewley: Allah has no son and there is no other god accompanying Him, for then each god would have gone off with what he created and one of them would have been exalted above the other. Glory be to Allah above what they describe,

92.Aisha Bewley: Knower of the Unseen and the Visible! May He be exalted above all they associate with Him!

93.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´My Lord, if You let me see what they have been promised,

94.Aisha Bewley: do not then, my Lord, put me among the wrongdoing people!´

95.Aisha Bewley: We are certainly capable of letting you see what We have promised them.

96.Aisha Bewley: Ward off evil with what is better. We know very well what they express.

97.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´My Lord, I seek refuge with You from the goadings of the shaytans,

98.Aisha Bewley: and I seek refuge with You, my Lord, from their presence.´

99.Aisha Bewley: When death comes to one of them, he says, ´My Lord, send me back again.

100.Aisha Bewley: so that perhaps I may act rightly regarding the things I failed to do!´ No indeed! It is just words he utters. Before them there is an interspace until the Day they are raised up.

101.Aisha Bewley: Then when the Trumpet is blown, that Day there will be no family ties between them; they will not be able to question one another.

102.Aisha Bewley: Those whose scales are heavy, they are the successful.

103.Aisha Bewley: Those whose scales are light, they are the losers of their selves, remaining in Hell timelessly, for ever.

104.Aisha Bewley: The Fire will sear their faces, making them grimace horribly in it, their lips drawn back from their teeth.

105.Aisha Bewley: ´Were My Signs not recited to you and did you not deny them?´

106.Aisha Bewley: They will say, ´Our Lord, our miserable destiny overpowered us. We were misguided people.

107.Aisha Bewley: Our Lord, remove us from it! Then if we revert again, we will definitely be wrongdoers.´

108.Aisha Bewley: He will say, ´Slink away into it and do not speak to Me.

109.Aisha Bewley: There was a group of My slaves who said, "Our Lord, we have iman, so forgive us and have mercy on us. You are the Best of the Merciful."

110.Aisha Bewley: But you made a mockery of them so that they made you forget to remember Me while you were laughing at them.

111.Aisha Bewley: Today I have rewarded them for being steadfast. They are the ones who are victorious.´

112.Aisha Bewley: He will say, ´How many years did you tarry on the earth?´

113.Aisha Bewley: They will say, ´We tarried there for a day or part of a day. Ask those able to count!´

114.Aisha Bewley: He will say, ´You only tarried there for a little while if you did but know!

115.Aisha Bewley: Did you suppose that We created you for amusement and that you would not return to Us?´

116.Aisha Bewley: Exalted be Allah, the King, the Real. There is no god but Him, Lord of the Noble Throne.

117.Aisha Bewley: Whoever calls on another god together with Allah, has no grounds for doing so at all and his reckoning is with his Lord. Truly the kafirun have no success.

118.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´My Lord, forgive and be merciful! You are the Best of the Merciful.´

1.Aisha Bewley: A sura We have sent down and imposed. We have sent down Clear Signs in it so that hopefully you will pay heed.

2.Aisha Bewley: A woman and a man who commit fornication: flog both of them with one hundred lashes and do not let compassion for either of them possess you where Allah´s deen is concerned, if you have iman in Allah and the Last Day. A number of muminun should witness their punishment.

3.Aisha Bewley: A man who has fornicated may only marry a woman who has fornicated or a woman of the idolaters. A woman who has fornicated may only marry a man who has fornicated or a man of the idolaters. Doing such a thing is haram for the muminun.

4.Aisha Bewley: But those who make accusations against chaste women and then do not produce four witnesses: flog them with eighty lashes and never again accept them as witnesses. Such people are deviators —

5.Aisha Bewley: except for those who after that make tawba and put things right. Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

6.Aisha Bewley: Those who make an accusation against their wives and have no witnesses except themselves, such people should testify four times by Allah that they are telling the truth

7.Aisha Bewley: and a fifth time that Allah´s curse will be upon them if they are lying.

8.Aisha Bewley: And the punishment is removed from her if she testifies four times by Allah that he is lying

9.Aisha Bewley: and a fifth time that Allah´s anger will be upon her if he is telling the truth.

10.Aisha Bewley: Were it not for Allah´s favour to you and His mercy ...and that Allah is Ever-Returning, All-Wise.

11.Aisha Bewley: There is a group of you who propagated the lie. Do not suppose it to be bad for you; rather it is good for you. Every one of them will incur the evil he has earned and the one who took it on himself to amplify it will receive a terrible punishment.

12.Aisha Bewley: Why, when you heard it, did you not, as men and women of the muminun, instinctively think good thoughts and say, ´This is obviously a lie´?

13.Aisha Bewley: Why did they not produce four witnesses to it? Since they did not bring four witnesses, in Allah´s sight, they are liars.

14.Aisha Bewley: Were it not for Allah´s favour to you and His mercy, both in this world and the Next World, a terrible punishment would have afflicted you for your plunging headlong into it.

15.Aisha Bewley: You were bandying it about on your tongues, your mouths uttering something about which you had no knowledge. You considered it to be a trivial matter, but, in Allah´s sight, it is immense.

16.Aisha Bewley: Why, when you heard it, did you not say, ´We have no business speaking about this. Glory be to You! This is a terrible slander!´?

17.Aisha Bewley: Allah warns you never to repeat the like of it again if you are muminun.

18.Aisha Bewley: Allah makes the Signs clear to you and Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

19.Aisha Bewley: People who love to see filth being spread about concerning those who have iman will have a painful punishment both in this world and the Next World. Allah knows and you do not know.

20.Aisha Bewley: Were it not for Allah´s favour to you and His mercy . . . and that Allah is All-Gentle, Most Merciful.

21.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! do not follow in the footsteps of Shaytan. Anyone who follows in Shaytan´s footsteps should know that he commands indecency and wrongdoing. Were it not for Allah´s favour to you and His mercy, not one of you would ever have been purified. But Allah purifies whoever He wills. Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

22.Aisha Bewley: Those of you possessing affluence and ample wealth should not make oaths that they will not give to their relatives and the very poor and those who have made hijra in the way of Allah. They should rather pardon and overlook. Would you not love Allah to forgive you? Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

23.Aisha Bewley: Those who accuse women who are chaste, but who are careless and yet have iman, are cursed both in this world and the Next World, and they will have a terrible punishment

24.Aisha Bewley: on the Day when their tongues and hands and feet will testify against them about what they were doing.

25.Aisha Bewley: On that Day Allah will pay them in full what is due to them, and they will know that Allah is the Clear Truth.

26.Aisha Bewley: Corrupt women are for corrupt men and corrupt men are for corrupt women, Good women are for good men and good men are for good women. The latter are innocent of what they say. They will have forgiveness and generous provision.

27.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! do not enter houses other than your own until you have asked permission and greeted their inhabitants. That is better for you, so that hopefully you will pay heed.

28.Aisha Bewley: And if you find no one at home do not go in until permission has been granted you. And if you are told to go away then go away. That is purer for you. Allah knows what you do.

29.Aisha Bewley: There is nothing wrong in your entering houses where no one lives and where there is some service for you. Allah knows what you divulge and what you conceal.

30.Aisha Bewley: Say to the muminun that they should lower their eyes and guard their private parts. That is purer for them. Allah is aware of what they do.

31.Aisha Bewley: Say to the mumin women that they should lower their eyes and guard their private parts and not display their adornments — except for what normally shows — and draw their head-coverings across their breasts. They should only display their adornments to their husbands or their fathers or their husbands´ fathers, or their sons or their husbands´ sons or their brothers or their brothers´ sons or their sisters´ sons or other women or those they own as slaves or their male attendants who have no sexual desire or children who still have no awareness of women´s private parts. Nor should they stamp their feet so that their hidden ornaments are known. Turn to Allah every one of you, muminun, so that hopefully you will have success.

32.Aisha Bewley: Marry off those among you who are unmarried and those of your slaves and slavegirls who are righteous. If they are poor, Allah will enrich them from His bounty. Allah is All-Encompassing, All-Knowing.

33.Aisha Bewley: Those who cannot find the means to marry should be abstinent until Allah enriches them from His bounty. If any slaves you own want to make a contract to free themselves, write it for them if you know of good in them and give them some of the wealth Allah has given you. Do not force your slavegirls to prostitute themselves if they desire to be virtuous women out of your desire for the goods of this world. If anyone forces them, then after they have been forced, Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

34.Aisha Bewley: We have sent down Clear Signs to you and the example of those who passed away before you and an admonition for those who have taqwa.

35.Aisha Bewley: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The metaphor of His Light is that of a niche in which is a lamp, the lamp inside a glass, the glass like a brilliant star, lit from a blessed tree, an olive, neither of the east nor of the west, its oil all but giving off light even if no fire touches it. Light upon Light. Allah guides to His Light whoever He wills and Allah makes metaphors for mankind and Allah has knowledge of all things.

36.Aisha Bewley: In houses which Allah has permitted to be built and in which His name is remembered, there are men who proclaim His glory morning and evening,

37.Aisha Bewley: not distracted by trade or commerce from the remembrance of Allah and the establishment of salat and the payment of zakat; fearing a day when all hearts and eyes will be in turmoil —

38.Aisha Bewley: so that Allah can reward them for the best of what they did and give them more from His unbounded favour. Allah provides for anyone He wills without reckoning.

39.Aisha Bewley: But the actions of those who are kafir are like a mirage in the desert. A thirsty man thinks it is water but when he reaches it, he finds it to be nothing at all, but he finds Allah there. He will pay him his account in full. Allah is swift at reckoning.

40.Aisha Bewley: Or they are like the darkness of a fathomless sea which is covered by waves above which are waves above which are clouds, layers of darkness, one upon the other. If he puts out his hand, he can scarcely see it. Those Allah gives no light to, they have no light.

41.Aisha Bewley: Do you not see that everyone in the heavens and earth glorifies Allah, as do the birds with their outspread wings? Each one knows its prayer and glorification. Allah knows what they do.

42.Aisha Bewley: The kingdom of the heavens and earth belongs to Allah and Allah is the final destination.

43.Aisha Bewley: Do you not see that Allah propels the clouds then makes them coalesce then heaps them up, and then you see the rain come pouring out of the middle of them? And He sends down mountains from the sky with hail inside them, striking with it anyone He wills and averting it from anyone He wills. The brightness of His lightning almost blinds the sight.

44.Aisha Bewley: Allah revolves night and day. There is surely a lesson in that for people with inner sight.

45.Aisha Bewley: Allah created every animal from water. Some of them go on their bellies, some of them on two legs, and some on four. Allah creates whatever He wills. Allah has power over all things.

46.Aisha Bewley: We have sent down Signs making things clear. Allah guides whoever He wills to a straight path.

47.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´We have iman in Allah and in the Messenger and we obey.´ Then after that a group of them turn away. Such people are not muminun.

48.Aisha Bewley: When they are summoned to Allah and His Messenger, so that he can judge between them, a group of them immediately turn away.

49.Aisha Bewley: But if right is on their side, they come to him most submissively!

50.Aisha Bewley: Is there a sickness in their hearts or do they have misgivings or do they fear that Allah and His Messenger will be unjust to them? No, it is simply that they are wrongdoers.

51.Aisha Bewley: The reply of the muminun when they are summoned to Allah and His Messenger so that he can judge between them, is to say, ´We hear and we obey.´ They are ones who are successful.

52.Aisha Bewley: All who obey Allah and His Messenger and have awe of Allah and taqwa of Him, they are the ones who are victorious.

53.Aisha Bewley: They have sworn by Allah with their most earnest oaths that if you give them the command, they will go out. Say: ´Do not swear. Honourable obedience is enough. Allah is aware of what you do.´

54.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Obey Allah and obey the Messenger. Then if they turn away he is only responsible for what he is charged with and you are responsible for what you are charged with. If you obey him, you will be guided.´ The Messenger is only responsible for clear transmission.

55.Aisha Bewley: Allah has promised those of you who have iman and do right actions that He will make them successors in the land as He made those before them successors, and will firmly establish for them their deen with which He is pleased and give them, in place of their fear, security. ´They worship Me, not associating anything with Me.´ Any who are kafir after that, such people are deviators.

56.Aisha Bewley: Establish salat and pay zakat and obey the Messenger so that hopefully mercy will be shown to you.

57.Aisha Bewley: Do not imagine that those who are kafir are able to escape Allah on earth. Their shelter will be the Fire. What an evil destination!

58.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! those you own as slaves and those of you who have not yet reached puberty should ask your permission to enter at three times: before the Dawn Prayer, when you have undressed at noon, and after the Salat al-´Isha´ — three times of nakedness for you. There is nothing wrong for you or them at other times in moving around among yourselves from one to another. In this way Allah makes the Signs clear to you. Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

59.Aisha Bewley: Once your children have reached puberty, they should ask your permission to enter as those before them also asked permission. In this way Allah makes His Signs clear to you. Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

60.Aisha Bewley: As for women who are past child-bearing age and no longer have any hope of getting married, there is nothing wrong in their removing their outer clothes, provided they do not flaunt their adornments; but to refrain from doing so is better for them. Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

61.Aisha Bewley: There is no objection to the blind, no objection to the lame, no objection to the sick nor to yourselves if you eat in your own houses or your fathers´ houses or your mothers´ houses or your brothers´ houses or your sisters´ houses or the houses of your paternal uncles or paternal aunts or the houses of your maternal uncles or maternal aunts or places to which you own the keys or those of your friends. There is nothing wrong in your eating together or eating separately. And when you enter houses greet one another with a greeting from Allah, blessed and good. In this way Allah makes the Signs clear to you so that hopefully you will use your intellect.

62.Aisha Bewley: The muminun are those who have iman in Allah and His Messenger and who, when they are with him on a matter of common concern, do not leave until they have asked him for permission. Those people who ask you for permission are the ones who truly have iman in Allah and His Messenger. If they ask your permission to attend to their own affairs, give permission to any of them you please; and ask Allah´s forgiveness for them. Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

63.Aisha Bewley: Do not make your summoning of the Messenger the same as your summoning of one another. Allah knows those of you who sneak away. Those who oppose his command should beware of a testing trial coming to them or a painful punishment striking them.

64.Aisha Bewley: Everything in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah. He knows what you are engaged upon. On the Day when they are returned to Him, He will inform them of what they did. Allah has knowledge of all things.

1.Aisha Bewley: Blessed be He who has sent down the Furqan to His slave so that he can be a warner to all beings;

2.Aisha Bewley: He to whom the kingdom of the heavens and the earth belongs. He does not have a son and He has no partner in the Kingdom. He created everything and determined it most exactly.

3.Aisha Bewley: But they have adopted gods apart from Him which do not create anything but are themselves created. They have no power to harm or help themselves. They have no power over death or life or resurrection.

4.Aisha Bewley: Those who are kafir say, ´This is nothing but a lie he has invented and other people have helped him to do it. They have brought injustice and falsehood.´

5.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´It is myths of previous peoples which he has had transcribed and which are read out to him in the morning and the evening.´

6.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´The One Who sent it down is He Who knows all hidden secrets in the heavens and earth . He is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.´

7.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´What is the matter with this Messenger, that he eats food and walks in the market-place? Why has an angel not been sent down to him so that it can be a warner along with him?

8.Aisha Bewley: Why has treasure not been showered down on him? Why does he not have a garden to give him food?´ The wrongdoers say, ´You are merely following a man who is bewitched.´

9.Aisha Bewley: See how they make comparative judgements about you. They are misguided and cannot find the way.

10.Aisha Bewley: Blessed be He who, if He wishes, will grant you better than that: Gardens with rivers flowing under them; and He will grant you Palaces.

11.Aisha Bewley: But instead, they deny the Hour; and We have prepared a Searing Blaze for those who deny the Hour.

12.Aisha Bewley: When it sees them coming from a long way off, they will hear it seething and rasping.

13.Aisha Bewley: When they are flung into a narrow place in it, shackled together in chains, they will cry out there for destruction.

14.Aisha Bewley: ´Do not cry out today for just one destruction, cry out for many destructions!´

15.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Is that better, or the Garden of Eternal Life which has been promised to those who have taqwa? That is their recompense and destination.´

16.Aisha Bewley: They will have in it whatever they want timelessly, for ever. It is a binding promise of your Lord.

17.Aisha Bewley: On the Day We gather them together, and those they worship besides Allah, and say, ´Did you misguide these slaves of Mine or did they stray from the way of their own accord?´

18.Aisha Bewley: they will say, ´Glory be to You! It would not have been fitting for us to have taken any protectors apart from You. But You let them and their fathers enjoy themselves so that they forgot the Reminder. They were people devoid of good.´

19.Aisha Bewley: So now they have disowned you for what you said, and they cannot avert it or give you any help. As for anyone among you who has done wrong, We will make him suffer great punishment.

20.Aisha Bewley: We never sent any Messengers before you who did not eat food and walk in the market-place. But We have made some of you a trial for others to see if you will be steadfast? Your Lord sees everything.

21.Aisha Bewley: Those who do not expect to meet Us say, ´Why have angels not been sent down to us? Why do we not see our Lord?´ They have become arrogant about themselves and are excessively insolent.

22.Aisha Bewley: On the Day they see the angels, there will be no good news that Day for the evildoers. They will say, ´There is an absolute ban.´

23.Aisha Bewley: We will advance on the actions they have done and make them scattered specks of dust.

24.Aisha Bewley: The Companions of the Garden on that Day will have better lodging and a better resting-place,

25.Aisha Bewley: the Day when Heaven is split apart in clouds, and the angels are sent down rank upon rank.

26.Aisha Bewley: The Kingdom that Day will belong in truth to the All-Merciful. It will be a hard Day for the kafirun,

27.Aisha Bewley: the Day when a wrongdoer will bite his hands and say, ´Alas for me! If only I had gone the way of the Messenger!

28.Aisha Bewley: Alas for me! If only I had not taken so-and-so for a friend!

29.Aisha Bewley: He led me astray from the Reminder after it came to me.´ Shaytan always leaves man in the lurch.

30.Aisha Bewley: The Messenger says, ´My Lord, my people treat this Qur´an as something to be ignored.´

31.Aisha Bewley: In this way We have assigned to every Prophet an enemy from among the evildoers. But your Lord is a sufficient guide and helper.

32.Aisha Bewley: Those who are kafir say, ´Why was the Qur´an not sent down to him all in one go?´ It is so that We can fortify your heart by it. We have recited it distinctly, little by little.

33.Aisha Bewley: Every time they come to you with a difficult point, We bring you the truth and the best of explanations.

34.Aisha Bewley: Those who are herded headlong into Hell, such people are in the worst position. They are the most misguided from the way.

35.Aisha Bewley: We gave Musa the Book and appointed his brother Harun with him as a helper.

36.Aisha Bewley: We said, ´Go to the people who have denied Our Signs,´ and We annihilated them completely.

37.Aisha Bewley: And when the people of Nuh denied the Messengers, We drowned them and made them a Sign for all mankind. We have prepared a painful punishment for the wrongdoers.

38.Aisha Bewley: The same goes for ´Ad and Thamud and the Companions of the Well and many generations in between.

39.Aisha Bewley: We gave examples to each one of them and each one of them We utterly wiped out.

40.Aisha Bewley: They themselves have come across the city which was rained on by an evil rain. Did they not then see it? But they do not expect to rise again.

41.Aisha Bewley: When they see you they only make a mockery of you: ´Is this the one Allah has sent as a Messenger?

42.Aisha Bewley: He might almost have misled us from our gods had we not stuck to them steadfastly!´ They will soon know, when they see the punishment, whose way is the most misguided.

43.Aisha Bewley: Have you seen him who has taken his whims and desires to be his god? Will you then be his guardian?

44.Aisha Bewley: Do you suppose that most of them hear or understand? They are just like cattle. Indeed they are even more astray!

45.Aisha Bewley: Do you not see how your Lord stretches out shadows? If He had wished He could have made them stationary. Then We appoint the sun to be the pointer to them.

46.Aisha Bewley: Then We draw them back to Ourselves in gradual steps.

47.Aisha Bewley: It is He who made the night a cloak for you and sleep a rest, and He made the day a time for rising.

48.Aisha Bewley: It is He who sends out the winds, bringing advance news of His mercy. And We send down from heaven pure water

49.Aisha Bewley: so that by it We can bring a dead land to life and give drink to many of the animals and people We created.

50.Aisha Bewley: We have variegated it for them so they might pay heed but most people spurn anything else but kufr.

51.Aisha Bewley: If We had wished We could have sent a warner to every town.

52.Aisha Bewley: So do not obey the kafirun but use this to battle against them with all your might.

53.Aisha Bewley: It is He who has unloosed both seas — the one sweet and refreshing, the other salty and bitter — and put a dividing line between them, an uncrossable barrier.

54.Aisha Bewley: And it is He who created human beings from water and then gave them relations by blood and marriage. Your Lord is All-Powerful.

55.Aisha Bewley: Yet they worship instead of Allah what can neither help nor harm them. The kuffar are always biased against their Lord.

56.Aisha Bewley: We sent you only to bring good news and to give warning.

57.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´I do not ask you for any wage for it — only that anyone who wants to should make his way towards his Lord.´

58.Aisha Bewley: Put your trust in the Living who does not die and glorify Him with praise. He is well aware of the wrong actions of His slaves:

59.Aisha Bewley: He who created the heavens and the earth and everything in between them in six days, and then established Himself firmly on the Throne; the All-Merciful — ask anyone who is informed about Him.

60.Aisha Bewley: When they are told to prostrate to the All-Merciful, they say, ´And what is the All-Merciful? Are we to prostrate to something you command us to?´ And it merely makes them run away all the more.

61.Aisha Bewley: Blessed be He who placed constellations in the sky and put a blazing lamp and shining moon among them.

62.Aisha Bewley: It is He who made night and day succeed each other for those who want to pay heed or to give thanks.

63.Aisha Bewley: The slaves of the All-Merciful are those who walk lightly on the earth and, who, when the ignorant speak to them, say, ´Peace´;

64.Aisha Bewley: those who pass the night prostrating and standing before their Lord;

65.Aisha Bewley: those who say, ´Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell, its punishment is inescapable pain.

66.Aisha Bewley: It is indeed an evil lodging and abode´;

67.Aisha Bewley: those who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor mean, but take a stance mid way between the two;

68.Aisha Bewley: those who do not call on any other god together with Allah and do not kill anyone Allah has made inviolate, except with the right to do so, and do not fornicate; anyone who does that will receive an evil punishment

69.Aisha Bewley: and on the Day of Rising his punishment will be doubled and he will be humiliated in it timelessly, for ever,

70.Aisha Bewley: except for those who make tawba and have iman and act rightly: Allah will transform the wrong actions of such people into good — Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful —

71.Aisha Bewley: for certainly all who make tawba and act rightly have turned sincerely towards Allah;

72.Aisha Bewley: those who do not bear false witness and who, when they pass by worthless talk, pass by with dignity;

73.Aisha Bewley: those who, when they are reminded of the Signs of their Lord, do not turn their backs, deaf and blind to them;

74.Aisha Bewley: those who say, ´Our Lord, give us joy in our wives and children and make us a good example for those who have taqwa´;

75.Aisha Bewley: such people will be repaid for their steadfastness with the Highest Paradise, where they will meet with welcome and with ´Peace´.

76.Aisha Bewley: They will remain in it timelessly, for ever. What an excellent lodging and abode!

77.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´What has My Lord to do with you if you do not call on Him? But you have denied the truth, so punishment is bound to come.´

1.Aisha Bewley: Ta Sin Mim.

2.Aisha Bewley: Those are the Signs of the Clear Book.

3.Aisha Bewley: Perhaps you will destroy yourself with grief because they will not become muminun.

4.Aisha Bewley: If We wished We could send down a Sign to them from heaven, before which their heads would be bowed low in subjection.

5.Aisha Bewley: But no fresh reminder from the All-Merciful reaches them without their turning away from it.

6.Aisha Bewley: They have denied the truth, but the news of what they mocked will certainly come to them.

7.Aisha Bewley: Have they not looked at the earth and seen how We have made every sort of beneficial species grow in it?

8.Aisha Bewley: There is certainly a Sign in that, yet most of them are not muminun.

9.Aisha Bewley: Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

10.Aisha Bewley: When your Lord called out to Musa: ´Go to the wrongdoing people,

11.Aisha Bewley: the people of Pharaoh. Will they not have taqwa?´

12.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´My Lord, I fear they will deny me

13.Aisha Bewley: and that my breast will be constricted and that my tongue will not be free, so send Harun as a Messenger as well.

14.Aisha Bewley: They hold a wrong action against me and I fear that they may kill me.´

15.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´By no means! Go, both of you, with Our Signs. We will certainly be together with you, listening.

16.Aisha Bewley: Go to Pharaoh and say, "We are the Messenger of the Lord of all the worlds

17.Aisha Bewley: to tell you to send the tribe of Israel away with us."´

18.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Did we not bring you up among us as a child and did you not spend many years of your life among us?

19.Aisha Bewley: Yet you did the deed you did and were ungrateful.´

20.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´At the time I did it I was one of the misguided

21.Aisha Bewley: and so I fled from you when I was in fear of you but my Lord gave me right judgement and made me one of the Messengers.

22.Aisha Bewley: And anyway you can only reproach me with this favour because you made the tribe of Israel into slaves!´

23.Aisha Bewley: Pharaoh said, ´What is the Lord of all the worlds?´

24.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´The Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything between them if you knew for sure.´

25.Aisha Bewley: He said to those around him, ´Are you listening?´

26.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers, the previous peoples.´

27.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´This Messenger, who has been sent to you, is mad.´

28.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´The Lord of the East and the West and everything between them if you used your intellect.´

29.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´If you take any god other than me, I will certainly throw you into prison.´

30.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Even if I were to bring you something undeniable?´

31.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Produce it then if you are someone telling the truth.´

32.Aisha Bewley: So He threw down his staff and there it was, unmistakably a snake.

33.Aisha Bewley: And he drew out his hand and there it was, pure white to those who looked.

34.Aisha Bewley: He said to the High Council round about him, ´This certainly is a skilled magician

35.Aisha Bewley: who desires by his magic to expel you from your land, so what do you recommend?´

36.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Detain him and his brother and send out marshals to the cities,

37.Aisha Bewley: to bring you all the skilled magicians.´

38.Aisha Bewley: So the magicians were assembled for a meeting on a specified day.

39.Aisha Bewley: The people were asked, ´Are you all assembled?

40.Aisha Bewley: so we can follow the magicians if they are the winners?´

41.Aisha Bewley: When the magicians came, they said to Pharaoh, ´Will we be rewarded if we are the winners?´

42.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Yes, and in that case you will be among those brought near.´

43.Aisha Bewley: Musa said to them, ´Throw whatever it is you are going to throw!´

44.Aisha Bewley: They threw down their ropes and staffs and said, ´By the might of Pharaoh we are the winners.´

45.Aisha Bewley: But Musa threw down his staff and at once it swallowed up what they had fabricated.

46.Aisha Bewley: The magicians threw themselves down, prostrating.

47.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´We have iman in the Lord of all the worlds,

48.Aisha Bewley: the Lord of Musa and Harun.´

49.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Have you had iman in him before I authorised you? He is your chief who taught you magic. But you will soon know! I will cut off your alternate hands and feet and I will crucify every one of you.´

50.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´We do not care! We are returning to our Lord.

51.Aisha Bewley: We remain hopeful that our Lord will forgive us our mistakes for being the first of the muminun.´

52.Aisha Bewley: We revealed to Musa: ´Travel with Our slaves by night. You will certainly be pursued.´

53.Aisha Bewley: Pharaoh sent marshals into the cities:

54.Aisha Bewley: ´These people are a small group

55.Aisha Bewley: and we find them irritating

56.Aisha Bewley: and we constitute a vigilant majority.´

57.Aisha Bewley: We expelled them from gardens and springs,

58.Aisha Bewley: from treasures and a splendid situation.

59.Aisha Bewley: So it was! And We bequeathed them to the tribe of Israel.

60.Aisha Bewley: So they pursued them towards the east.

61.Aisha Bewley: And when the two hosts came into sight of one another Musa´s companions said, ´We will surely be overtaken!´

62.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Never! My Lord is with me and He will guide me.´

63.Aisha Bewley: So We revealed to Musa, ´Strike the sea with your staff.´ And it split in two, each part like a towering cliff.

64.Aisha Bewley: And We brought the others right up to it.

65.Aisha Bewley: We rescued Musa and all those who were with him.

66.Aisha Bewley: Then We drowned the rest.

67.Aisha Bewley: There is certainly a Sign in that yet most of them are not muminun.

68.Aisha Bewley: Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

69.Aisha Bewley: Recite to them the story of Ibrahim

70.Aisha Bewley: when he said to his father and his people, ´What do you worship?´

71.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´We worship idols and will continue to cling to them.´

72.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Do they hear you when you call

73.Aisha Bewley: or do they help you or do you harm?´

74.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´No, but this is what we found our fathers doing.´

75.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Have you really thought about what you worship,

76.Aisha Bewley: you and your fathers who came before?

77.Aisha Bewley: They are all my enemies — except for the Lord of all the worlds:

78.Aisha Bewley: He who created me and guides me;

79.Aisha Bewley: He who gives me food and gives me drink;

80.Aisha Bewley: and when I am ill, it is He who heals me;

81.Aisha Bewley: He who will cause my death, then give me life;

82.Aisha Bewley: He who I sincerely hope will forgive my mistakes on the Day of Reckoning.

83.Aisha Bewley: My Lord, give me right judgement and unite me with the righteous;

84.Aisha Bewley: and make me highly esteemed among the later peoples;

85.Aisha Bewley: and make me one of the inheritors of the Garden of Delight;

86.Aisha Bewley: and forgive my father — he was one of the misguided;

87.Aisha Bewley: and do not disgrace me on the Day they are raised up,

88.Aisha Bewley: the Day when neither wealth nor sons will be of any use —

89.Aisha Bewley: except to those who come to Allah with sound and flawless hearts.´

90.Aisha Bewley: The Garden will be brought near to those who have taqwa.

91.Aisha Bewley: The Blazing Fire will be displayed to the misled.

92.Aisha Bewley: They will be asked, ´Where are those you used to worship besides Allah?

93.Aisha Bewley: Can they help you or even help themselves?´

94.Aisha Bewley: They will be bundled into it head first, they and the misled,

95.Aisha Bewley: and every one of Iblis´s regiments.

96.Aisha Bewley: Arguing in it with one another, they will say,

97.Aisha Bewley: ´By Allah, we were plainly misguided

98.Aisha Bewley: when We equated you with the Lord of all the worlds.

99.Aisha Bewley: It was only the evildoers who misguided us

100.Aisha Bewley: and now we have no one to intercede for us;

101.Aisha Bewley: we do not have a single loyal friend.

102.Aisha Bewley: If only we could have another chance then we would be among the muminun!´

103.Aisha Bewley: There is certainly a Sign in that, yet most of them are not muminun.

104.Aisha Bewley: Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

105.Aisha Bewley: The people of Nuh denied the Messengers.

106.Aisha Bewley: When their brother Nuh said to them, ´Will you not have taqwa?

107.Aisha Bewley: I am a faithful Messenger to you

108.Aisha Bewley: so have taqwa of Allah and obey me.

109.Aisha Bewley: I do not ask you for any wage for it. My wage is the responsibility of no one but the Lord of all the worlds.

110.Aisha Bewley: so have taqwa of Allah and obey me.´

111.Aisha Bewley: they said, ´Why should we believe you when the vilest people follow you?´

112.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´What do I know about what they have been doing?

113.Aisha Bewley: Their reckoning is the concern of my Lord alone if you were but aware.

114.Aisha Bewley: I am not going to chase away the muminun.

115.Aisha Bewley: I am only a clear warner.´

116.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Nuh, if you do not desist you will be stoned.´

117.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´My Lord, my people have denied me

118.Aisha Bewley: so make a clear judgement between me and them and rescue me and the muminun who are with me.´

119.Aisha Bewley: So We rescued him and those with him in the loaded ship.

120.Aisha Bewley: Then afterwards We drowned the rest.

121.Aisha Bewley: There is certainly a Sign in that, yet most of them are not muminun.

122.Aisha Bewley: Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

124.Aisha Bewley: when their brother Hud said to them, ´Will you not have taqwa?

125.Aisha Bewley: I am a faithful Messenger to you

126.Aisha Bewley: so have taqwa of Allah and obey me.

127.Aisha Bewley: I do not ask you for any wage for it. My wage is the responsibility of no one but the Lord of all the worlds.

128.Aisha Bewley: Do you build a tower on every hilltop, just to amuse yourselves,

129.Aisha Bewley: and construct great fortresses, hoping to live for ever,

130.Aisha Bewley: and when you attack, attack as tyrants do?

131.Aisha Bewley: So have taqwa of Allah and obey me.

132.Aisha Bewley: Have taqwa of Him who has supplied you with what you know,

133.Aisha Bewley: supplied you with livestock and children

135.Aisha Bewley: I fear for you the punishment of a terrible Day.´

136.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´It makes no difference to us whether you preach or do not preach.

137.Aisha Bewley: This is only what the previous peoples did.

138.Aisha Bewley: We are not going to be punished.´

139.Aisha Bewley: So they denied him and We destroyed them. There is certainly a Sign in that, yet most of them are not muminun.

140.Aisha Bewley: Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

142.Aisha Bewley: when their brother Salih said to them, ´Will you not have taqwa?

143.Aisha Bewley: I am a faithful Messenger to you

144.Aisha Bewley: so have taqwa of Allah and obey me.

145.Aisha Bewley: I do not ask you for any wage for it. My wage is the responsibility of no one but the Lord of all the worlds.

146.Aisha Bewley: Are you going to be left secure amid what is here,

148.Aisha Bewley: and cultivated fields and palms with supple spathes?

149.Aisha Bewley: Will you continue hewing houses from the mountains with exultant skill?

150.Aisha Bewley: So have taqwa of Allah and obey me.

151.Aisha Bewley: Do not obey the orders of the profligate,

152.Aisha Bewley: those who corrupt the earth and do not put things right.´

153.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´You are merely someone bewitched.

154.Aisha Bewley: You are nothing but a human being like ourselves, so produce a Sign if you are telling the truth.´

155.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Here is a she-camel. She has a time for drinking and you have a time for drinking — on specified days.

156.Aisha Bewley: Do not do anything to harm her or the punishment of a terrible day will come down on you.´

157.Aisha Bewley: But they hamstrung her and woke up full of remorse,

158.Aisha Bewley: for the punishment did come down them. There is certainly a Sign in that, yet most of them are not muminun.

159.Aisha Bewley: Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

160.Aisha Bewley: The people of Lut denied the Messengers,

161.Aisha Bewley: when their brother Lut said to them, ´Will you not have taqwa?

162.Aisha Bewley: I am a faithful Messenger to you.

163.Aisha Bewley: so have taqwa of Allah and obey me.

164.Aisha Bewley: I do not ask you for any wage for it. My wage is the responsibility of no one but the Lord of all the worlds.

165.Aisha Bewley: Of all beings, do you lie with males,

166.Aisha Bewley: leaving the wives Allah has created for you? You are a people who have overstepped the limits.´

167.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Lut, if you do not desist you will be expelled.´

168.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´I am someone who detests the deed you perpetrate.

169.Aisha Bewley: My Lord, rescue me and my family from what they are doing.´

170.Aisha Bewley: Therefore We rescued him and all his family —

171.Aisha Bewley: except for an old woman who remained behind.

172.Aisha Bewley: Then We utterly destroyed the rest

173.Aisha Bewley: and made a Rain come pouring down upon them. How evil is the rain of those who are warned!

174.Aisha Bewley: There is certainly a Sign in that, yet most of them are not muminun.

175.Aisha Bewley: Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

176.Aisha Bewley: The Companions of the Thicket denied the Messengers,

177.Aisha Bewley: when Shu´ayb said to them, ´Will you not have taqwa?

178.Aisha Bewley: I am a faithful Messenger to you.

179.Aisha Bewley: so have taqwa of Allah and obey me.

180.Aisha Bewley: I do not ask you for any wage for it. My wage is the responsibility of no one but the Lord of all the worlds.

181.Aisha Bewley: Give full measure. Do not skimp.

183.Aisha Bewley: Do not diminish people´s goods and do not go about the earth, corrupting it.

184.Aisha Bewley: Have taqwa of Him who created you and the earlier creatures.´

185.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´You are merely someone bewitched.

186.Aisha Bewley: You are nothing but a human being like ourselves. We think you are a liar.

187.Aisha Bewley: So make lumps from heaven fall down on us if you are telling the truth.´

188.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´My Lord knows best what you are doing.´

189.Aisha Bewley: They denied him and the punishment of the Day of Shadow came down on them. It was indeed the punishment of a terrible Day.

190.Aisha Bewley: There is certainly a Sign in that, yet most of them are not muminun.

191.Aisha Bewley: Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

192.Aisha Bewley: Truly it is revelation sent down by the Lord of all the worlds.

193.Aisha Bewley: The Faithful Ruh brought it down

194.Aisha Bewley: to your heart so you would be one of the Warners

196.Aisha Bewley: It is certainly in the scriptures of the previous peoples.

197.Aisha Bewley: Is it not indeed a Sign for them that the scholars of the tribe of Israel have knowledge of it?

198.Aisha Bewley: If We had sent it down to a non-Arab

199.Aisha Bewley: who had then recited it to them, they still would not have iman in it.

200.Aisha Bewley: That is how We thread it into the hearts of the evildoers.

201.Aisha Bewley: They will not have iman in it until they see the painful punishment.

202.Aisha Bewley: It will come upon them suddenly when they are not expecting it.

203.Aisha Bewley: They will say, ´Can we be granted a reprieve?´

204.Aisha Bewley: Do they want to hasten Our punishment?

205.Aisha Bewley: Do you think, if We let them enjoy themselves for years

206.Aisha Bewley: and then what they were promised comes to them,

207.Aisha Bewley: that what they enjoyed will be of any use to them?

208.Aisha Bewley: We have never destroyed a city without giving it prior warning

209.Aisha Bewley: as a reminder. We were never unjust.

210.Aisha Bewley: The shaytans did not bring it down.

211.Aisha Bewley: It does not befit them and they are not capable of it.

212.Aisha Bewley: They are debarred from hearing it.

213.Aisha Bewley: So do not call on any other god along with Allah or you will be among those who will be punished.

215.Aisha Bewley: and take the muminun who follow you under your wing.

216.Aisha Bewley: If they disobey you, say, ´I am free of what you do.´

217.Aisha Bewley: Put your trust in the Almighty, the Most Merciful,

218.Aisha Bewley: He who sees you when you stand up to pray

219.Aisha Bewley: and your movements with those who prostrate.

220.Aisha Bewley: He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.

221.Aisha Bewley: Shall I tell you upon whom the shaytans descend?

222.Aisha Bewley: They descend on every evil liar.

223.Aisha Bewley: They give them a hearing and most of them are liars.

224.Aisha Bewley: And as for poets, it is the misled who follow them.

225.Aisha Bewley: Do you not see how they ramble on in every style

226.Aisha Bewley: and say things which they do not do,

227.Aisha Bewley: except those who have iman and do right actions and remember Allah repeatedly and defend themselves after they have been wronged? Those who do wrong will soon know the kind of reversal they will receive!

1.Aisha Bewley: Ta Sin. Those are the Signs of the Qur´an and a Clear Book.

2.Aisha Bewley: It is guidance and good news for the muminun,

3.Aisha Bewley: those who establish salat and pay zakat and are certain about the Next World.

4.Aisha Bewley: As for those who do not have iman in the Next World. We have made their actions appear good to them and they wander about blindly.

5.Aisha Bewley: Such people will receive an evil punishment and will be the greatest losers in the Next World.

6.Aisha Bewley: You receive the Qur´an directly from One who is All-Wise, All-Knowing.

7.Aisha Bewley: When Musa said to his people, ´I can make out a fire. I will bring you news from it or at least a burning brand so that hopefully you will be able to warm yourselves.´

8.Aisha Bewley: But when he reached it, a voice called out to him, ´Blessed be Him who is in the Fire and all who are around it. Glory be to Allah, the Lord of all the worlds!

9.Aisha Bewley: Musa, I am Allah, the Almighty, the All-Wise.

10.Aisha Bewley: Throw down your staff.´ Then when he saw it slithering like a snake he turned and fled and did not turn back again. ´Have no fear, Musa. In My Presence the Messengers have no fear —

11.Aisha Bewley: except for one who did wrong and then changed evil into good — for I am Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

12.Aisha Bewley: Put your hand inside your shirt front. It will emerge pure white, yet quite unharmed — one of nine Signs to Pharaoh and his people. They are a people of deviators.´

13.Aisha Bewley: When Our Signs came to them in all their clarity, they said, ´This is downright magic,´

14.Aisha Bewley: and they repudiated them wrongly and haughtily, in spite of their own certainty about them. See the final fate of the corrupters.

15.Aisha Bewley: We gave knowledge to Dawud and Sulayman who said, ´Praise be to Allah who has favoured us over many of His slaves who are muminun.´

16.Aisha Bewley: Sulayman was Dawud´s heir. He said, ´Mankind! we have been taught the speech of birds and we have been given everything. This is indeed clear favour.´

17.Aisha Bewley: Sulayman´s troops, made up of jinn and men and birds, were assembled for him, paraded in tight ranks.

18.Aisha Bewley: Then, when they reached the Valley of the Ants, an ant said, ´Ants! enter your dwellings so that Sulayman and his troops do not crush you unwittingly.´

19.Aisha Bewley: He smiled, laughing at its words, and said, ´My Lord, keep me thankful for the blessing You have bestowed on me and on my parents, and keep me acting rightly, pleasing You, and admit me, by Your mercy, among Your slaves who are righteous.´

20.Aisha Bewley: He inspected the birds and said, ´How is it that I do not see the hoopoe? Or is it absent without leave?

21.Aisha Bewley: I will certainly punish it most severely or slaughter it if it does not bring me clear authority.´

22.Aisha Bewley: However, it was not long delayed, and then it said, ´I have comprehended something you have not and bring you accurate intelligence from Sheba.

23.Aisha Bewley: I found a woman ruling over them who has been given everything. She possesses a mighty throne.

24.Aisha Bewley: I found both her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of Allah. Shaytan has made their actions seem good to them and debarred them from the Way so they are not guided

25.Aisha Bewley: and do not prostrate to Allah, Who brings out what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and knows what you conceal and what you divulge.

26.Aisha Bewley: Allah — there is no god but Him — the Lord of the Mighty Throne.´

27.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´We will soon see if you have told the truth or are a liar.

28.Aisha Bewley: Take this letter of mine and deliver it to them and then withdraw from them a little and see how they respond.´

29.Aisha Bewley: She said, ´Council! a noble letter has been delivered to me.

30.Aisha Bewley: It is from Sulayman and says: "In the name of Allah, All-Merciful, Most Merciful.

31.Aisha Bewley: Do not rise up against me, but come to me in submission."´

32.Aisha Bewley: She said, ´Council! give me your opinion about this matter. It is not my habit to make a final decision until I have heard what you have to say.´

33.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´We possess strength and we possess great force. But the matter is in your hands so consider what you command.´

34.Aisha Bewley: She said, ´When kings enter a city, they lay waste to it and make its mightiest inhabitants the most abased. That is what they too will do.

35.Aisha Bewley: I will send them a gift and then wait and see what the messengers bring back.´

36.Aisha Bewley: When it reached Sulayman he said, ´Would you give me wealth when what Allah has given me is better than what He has given you? No, rather it is you who delight in your gift.

37.Aisha Bewley: Return to them. We will come to them with troops they cannot face and we will expel them from it abased and humiliated.´

38.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Council! who among you will bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?´

39.Aisha Bewley: An ifreet of the jinn said, ´I will bring it to you before you get up from your seat. I am strong and trustworthy enough to do it.´

40.Aisha Bewley: He who possessed knowledge of the Book said, ´I will bring it to you before your glance returns to you.´ And when he saw it standing firmly in his presence, he said, ´This is part of my Lord´s favour to test me to see if I will give thanks or show ingratitude. Whoever gives thanks only does so to his own gain. Whoever is ungrateful, my Lord is Rich Beyond Need, Generous.´

41.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Disguise her throne. We shall see whether she is guided or someone who is not guided.´

42.Aisha Bewley: Then when she came, she was asked, ´Is your throne like this?´ She said, ´It is exactly like it.´ ´We were given knowledge before her and were already Muslims,

43.Aisha Bewley: but what she worshipped besides Allah impeded her. She was from an unbelieving people.´

44.Aisha Bewley: She was told: ´Enter the courtyard,´ but when she saw it she supposed it to be a pool and bared her legs. He said, ´It is a courtyard paved with glass.´ She said, ´My Lord, I have wronged myself but I have submitted with Sulayman to the Lord of all the worlds.´

45.Aisha Bewley: To Thamud We sent their brother Salih telling them to worship Allah, and straightaway they divided in two, arguing with one another.

46.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´My people, why are you so anxious to hasten the bad before the good? If only you would ask for forgiveness from Allah, so that mercy might perhaps be shown to you.´

47.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´We see you, and those with you, as an evil omen.´ He said, ´No, your evil omen is with Allah; you are merely a people undergoing a trial.´

48.Aisha Bewley: There was a group of nine men in the city causing corruption in the land and not putting things right.

49.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Let us make an oath to one another by Allah that we will fall on him and his family in the night and then say to his protector, "We did not witness the destruction of his family and we are telling the truth."´

50.Aisha Bewley: They hatched a plot and We hatched a plot while they were not aware.

51.Aisha Bewley: So look at the end result of all their plotting; We utterly destroyed them and their whole people!

52.Aisha Bewley: These are the ruins of their houses because of the wrong they did. There is certainly a Sign in that for people with knowledge.

53.Aisha Bewley: We rescued those who had iman and who had taqwa.

54.Aisha Bewley: And when Lut said to his people: ´Do you approach depravity with open eyes?

55.Aisha Bewley: Do you come with lust to men instead of women? You are a people who are deeply ignorant.´

56.Aisha Bewley: the only response of his people was to say: ´Drive the family of Lut out of your city! They are people who keep themselves pure!´

57.Aisha Bewley: So We rescued him and his family — except for his wife. We ordained her to be one of those who stayed behind.

58.Aisha Bewley: We rained down a rain upon them. How evil is the rain of those who are warned!

59.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Praise be to Allah and peace be upon His slaves whom He has chosen.´ Is Allah better, or what you associate with Him?
