28.Aisha Bewley: And mankind and beasts and livestock are likewise of varying colours. Only those of His slaves with knowledge have fear of Allah. Allah is Almighty, Ever-Forgiving.

29.Aisha Bewley: Those who recite the Book of Allah and establish salat and give of what We have provided for them, secretly and openly, hope for a transaction which will not prove profitless:

30.Aisha Bewley: that He will pay them their wages in full and give them more from His unbounded favour. He is Ever-Forgiving, Ever-Thankful.

31.Aisha Bewley: What We have revealed to you of the Book is the truth, confirming what came before it. Allah is aware of and sees His slaves.

32.Aisha Bewley: Then We made Our chosen slaves inherit the Book. But some of them wrong themselves; some are ambivalent; and some outdo each other in good by Allah´s permission. That is the great favour.

33.Aisha Bewley: They will enter Gardens of Eden where they will be adorned with gold bracelets and pearls, and where their clothing will be of silk.

34.Aisha Bewley: They will say, ´Praise be to Allah who has removed all sadness from us. Truly our Lord is Ever-Forgiving, Ever-Thankful:

35.Aisha Bewley: He who has lodged us, out of His favour, in the Abode of Permanence where no weariness or fatigue affects us.´

36.Aisha Bewley: Whereas for those who are kafir there will be the Fire of Hell. They will not be killed off so that they die and its punishment will not be lightened for them. That is how We repay every thankless man.

37.Aisha Bewley: They will shout out in it, ´Our Lord! take us out! We will act rightly, differently from the way we used to act!´ Did We not let you live long enough for anyone who was going to pay heed to pay heed? And did not the warner come to you? Taste it then! There is no helper for the wrongdoers.

38.Aisha Bewley: Allah knows the Unseen of the heavens and earth. Allah knows what the heart contains.

39.Aisha Bewley: It is He who made you khalifs on the earth. So whoever is kafir, his kufr is against himself. In Allah´s sight, the kufr of the kafirun only increases their loathsomeness; the kufr of the kafirun only increases their loss.

40.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Have you thought about your partner gods, those you call upon besides Allah? Show me what they have created of the earth; or do they have a partnership in the heavens?´ Have We given them a Book whose Clear Signs they follow? No indeed! The wrongdoers promise each other nothing but delusion.

41.Aisha Bewley: Allah keeps a firm hold on the heavens and earth, preventing them from vanishing away. And if they vanished no one could then keep hold of them. Certainly He is Most Forbearing, Ever-Forgiving.

42.Aisha Bewley: They swore by Allah with their most earnest oaths that if a warner came to them they would be better guided than any other community. But then when a warner did come to them, it only increased their aversion,

43.Aisha Bewley: shown by their arrogance in the land and evil plotting. But evil plotting envelops only those who do it. Do they expect anything but the pattern of previous peoples? You will not find any changing in the pattern of Allah. You will not find any alteration in the pattern of Allah.

44.Aisha Bewley: Have they not travelled in the land and seen the final fate of those before them? They were far greater than them in strength. Allah cannot be withstood in any way, either in the heavens or on earth. He is All-Knowing, All-Powerful.

45.Aisha Bewley: If Allah were to take mankind to task for what they have earned, He would not leave a single creature crawling on it, but He is deferring them until a specified time. Then, when their time comes, Allah sees His slaves!

1.Aisha Bewley: Ya Sin.

2.Aisha Bewley: By the Wise Qur´an.

3.Aisha Bewley: Truly you are one of the Messengers

4.Aisha Bewley: on a Straight Path.

5.Aisha Bewley: The revelation of the Almighty, the Most Merciful

6.Aisha Bewley: so that you may warn a people whose fathers were not warned and who are therefore unaware.

7.Aisha Bewley: The Word has been justly carried out against most of them so they have no iman.

8.Aisha Bewley: We have put iron collars round their necks reaching up to the chin, so that their heads are forced back.

9.Aisha Bewley: We have placed a barrier in front of them and a barrier behind them, blindfolding them so that they cannot see.

10.Aisha Bewley: It makes no difference to them whether you warn them or do not warn them: they will not have iman.

11.Aisha Bewley: You can only warn those who act on the Reminder and fear the All-Merciful in the Unseen. Give them the good news of forgiveness and a generous reward.

12.Aisha Bewley: We bring the dead to life and We record what they send ahead and what they leave behind. We have listed everything in a clear register.

13.Aisha Bewley: Make an example for them of the inhabitants of the city when the Messengers came to it.

14.Aisha Bewley: When We sent them two and they denied them both, so We reinforced them with a third. They said, ´Truly We have been sent to you as Messengers.´

15.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´You are nothing but human beings like ourselves. The All-Merciful has not sent down anything. You are simply lying.´

16.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Our Lord knows we have been sent as Messengers to you.

17.Aisha Bewley: We are only responsible for clear transmission.´

18.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´We see an evil omen in you. If you do not stop we will stone you and you will suffer a painful punishment at our hands.´

19.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Your evil omen is in yourselves. Is it not just that you have been reminded? No, you are an unbridled people!´

20.Aisha Bewley: A man came running from the far side of the city, saying, ´My people! follow the Messengers!

21.Aisha Bewley: Follow those who do not ask you for any wage and who have received guidance.

22.Aisha Bewley: Why indeed should I not worship Him Who brought me into being, Him to Whom you will be returned?

23.Aisha Bewley: Am I to take as gods instead of Him those whose intercession, if the All-Merciful desires harm for me, will not help me at all and cannot save me?

24.Aisha Bewley: In that case I would clearly be misguided.

25.Aisha Bewley: I have iman in your Lord so listen to me!´

26.Aisha Bewley: He was told, ´Enter the Garden!´ He said, ´If my people only knew

27.Aisha Bewley: how my Lord has forgiven me and placed me among the honoured ones!´

28.Aisha Bewley: We did not send down to his people any host from heaven after him nor would We send one down.

29.Aisha Bewley: It was but one Great Blast and they were extinct.

30.Aisha Bewley: Alas for My slaves! No Messenger comes to them without their mocking him.

31.Aisha Bewley: Do they not see how many generations before them We have destroyed and that they will not return to them?

32.Aisha Bewley: Each and every one will be summoned to Our presence.

33.Aisha Bewley: A Sign for them is the dead land which We bring to life and from which We bring forth grain of which they eat.

34.Aisha Bewley: We place in it gardens of dates and grapes, and cause springs to gush out in it,

35.Aisha Bewley: so they may eat its fruits — they did not do it themselves. So will they not be thankful?

36.Aisha Bewley: Glory be to Him who created all the pairs: from what the earth produces and from themselves and from things unknown to them.

37.Aisha Bewley: A Sign for them is the night: We peel the day away from it and there they are in darkness.

38.Aisha Bewley: And the sun runs to its resting place. That is the decree of the Almighty, the All-Knowing.

39.Aisha Bewley: And We have decreed set phases for the moon, until it ends up looking like an old palm spathe.

40.Aisha Bewley: It is not for the sun to overtake the moon nor for the night to outstrip the day; each one is swimming in a sphere.

41.Aisha Bewley: A Sign for them is that We carried their families in the laden ship.

42.Aisha Bewley: And We have created for them the like of it in which they sail.

43.Aisha Bewley: If We wished, We could drown them with no one to hear their cry, and then they would not be saved —

44.Aisha Bewley: except as an act of mercy from Us, to give them enjoyment for a time.

45.Aisha Bewley: They are told, ´Have taqwa of what is before you and behind you so that hopefully you will have mercy shown to you.´

46.Aisha Bewley: Not one of your Lord´s Signs comes to them without their turning away from it.

47.Aisha Bewley: And when they are told, ´Spend from the provision Allah has given you,´ those who are kafir say to those who have iman, ´Why should we feed someone whom, if He wished, Allah would feed Himself? You are clearly in error.´

48.Aisha Bewley: And they say, ´When will this promise come about if you are telling the truth?´

49.Aisha Bewley: What are they waiting for but one Great Blast to seize them while they are quibbling?

50.Aisha Bewley: They will not be able to make a will or return to their families.

51.Aisha Bewley: The Trumpet will be blown and at once they will be sliding from their graves towards their Lord.

52.Aisha Bewley: They will say, ´Alas for us! Who has raised us from our resting-place? This is what the All-Merciful promised us. The Messengers were telling the truth.´

53.Aisha Bewley: It will be but one Great Blast, and they will all be summoned to Our presence.

54.Aisha Bewley: Today no self will be wronged in any way. You will only be repaid for what you did.

55.Aisha Bewley: The Companions of the Garden are busy enjoying themselves today,

56.Aisha Bewley: they and their wives reclining on couches in the shade.

57.Aisha Bewley: They will have fruits there and whatever they request.

58.Aisha Bewley: ´Peace!´ A word from a Merciful Lord.

59.Aisha Bewley: ´Keep yourselves apart today, you evildoers!

60.Aisha Bewley: Did I not make a contract with you, tribe of Adam, not to worship Shaytan, who truly is an outright enemy to you,

61.Aisha Bewley: but to worship Me? That is a straight path.

62.Aisha Bewley: He has led huge numbers of you into error. Why did you not use your intellect?

63.Aisha Bewley: This is the Hell that you were promised.

64.Aisha Bewley: Roast in it today because you were kafirun.´

65.Aisha Bewley: Today We seal up their mouths and their hands speak to us, and their feet bear witness to what they have earned.

66.Aisha Bewley: If We wished, We could put out their eyes. Then, though they might race for the path, how would they see?

67.Aisha Bewley: If We wished, We could transform them where they stand so they would neither be able to go out nor return.

68.Aisha Bewley: When We grant long life to people, We return them to their primal state. So will you not use your intellect?

69.Aisha Bewley: We did not teach him poetry nor would it be right for him. It is simply a reminder and a clear Qur´an

70.Aisha Bewley: so that you may warn those who are truly alive and so that the Word may be carried out against the kafirun.

71.Aisha Bewley: Have they not seen how We created for them, by Our own handiwork, livestock which are under their control?

72.Aisha Bewley: We have made them tame for them and some they ride and some they eat.

73.Aisha Bewley: And they have other uses for them, and milk to drink. So will they not be thankful?

74.Aisha Bewley: They have taken gods besides Allah so that perhaps they may be helped.

75.Aisha Bewley: They cannot help them even though they are an army mobilised in their support.

76.Aisha Bewley: So do not let their words distress you. We know what they keep secret and what they divulge.

77.Aisha Bewley: Does not man see that We created him from a drop yet there he is, an open antagonist!

78.Aisha Bewley: He makes likenesses of Us and forgets his own creation, saying, ´Who will give life to bones when they are decayed?´

79.Aisha Bewley: Say ´He who made them in the first place will bring them back to life. He has total knowledge of each created thing;

80.Aisha Bewley: He Who produces fire for you from green trees so that you use them to light your fires.´

81.Aisha Bewley: Does He who created the heavens and earth not have the power to create the same again? Yes indeed! He is the Creator, the All-Knowing.

82.Aisha Bewley: His command when He desires a thing is just to say to it, ´Be!´ and it is.

83.Aisha Bewley: Glory be to Him Who has the Dominion of all things in His Hand. To Him you will be returned.

37.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Set The Ranks, Drawn up in Ranks, The Rangers

1.Aisha Bewley: By those drawn up in ranks,

2.Aisha Bewley: and by the warners crying warning,

3.Aisha Bewley: and by the reciters of the Reminder:

4.Aisha Bewley: your God is One:

5.Aisha Bewley: Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything between them; Lord of the Easts.

6.Aisha Bewley: We have adorned the lowest heaven with the beauty of the planets

7.Aisha Bewley: and guarded it against every defiant shaytan.

8.Aisha Bewley: They cannot eavesdrop on the Highest Assembly and they are stoned from every side,

9.Aisha Bewley: repelled with harshness — they will suffer eternal punishment —

10.Aisha Bewley: except for him who snatches a snippet and then is pursued by a piercing flame.

11.Aisha Bewley: Ask them for a fatwa: is it they who are stronger in structure or other things We have created? We created them from sticky clay.

12.Aisha Bewley: No wonder you are surprised as they laugh with scorn!

13.Aisha Bewley: When they are reminded they do not pay heed.

14.Aisha Bewley: When they see a Sign they only laugh with scorn.

15.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´This is just downright magic.

16.Aisha Bewley: When we are dead and turned to dust and bones will we then be raised up again alive?

17.Aisha Bewley: And our earlier ancestors as well?´

18.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Yes, and you will be in a despicable state.´

19.Aisha Bewley: There will be but one Great Blast and then their eyes will open.

20.Aisha Bewley: They will say, ´Alas for us! This is the Day of Reckoning!´

21.Aisha Bewley: This is the Day of Decision you used to deny.

22.Aisha Bewley: Assemble those who did wrong together with their associates and what they worshipped

23.Aisha Bewley: besides Allah, and guide them to the Path of the Blazing Fire!

24.Aisha Bewley: And call them to a halt. They will be asked:

25.Aisha Bewley: ´Why are you not helping one another?´

26.Aisha Bewley: No, today they come in absolute submission.

27.Aisha Bewley: They will confront each other, questioning one another.

28.Aisha Bewley: One group will say, ´You used to come at us from a position of power.´

29.Aisha Bewley: The others will say, ´The truth is that you were not muminun.

30.Aisha Bewley: We had no authority over you. Rather you were unbridled people.

31.Aisha Bewley: Our Lord´s Word has been carried out against us, that we would taste it.

32.Aisha Bewley: We misled you and we were ourselves misled.´

33.Aisha Bewley: On that Day they will be partners in the punishment.

34.Aisha Bewley: That is how We deal with evildoers.

35.Aisha Bewley: When they were told, ´There is no god but Allah,´ they were arrogant.

36.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Are we to forsake our gods for a mad poet?´

37.Aisha Bewley: Rather he has brought the truth and confirmed the Messengers.

38.Aisha Bewley: You will definitely taste the painful punishment

39.Aisha Bewley: and you will only be repaid for what you did —

40.Aisha Bewley: except for Allah´s chosen slaves.

41.Aisha Bewley: They will have preordained provision:

42.Aisha Bewley: sweet fruits and high honour

43.Aisha Bewley: in Gardens of Delight

44.Aisha Bewley: on couches face to face;

45.Aisha Bewley: a cup from a flowing spring passing round among them,

46.Aisha Bewley: as white as driven snow, delicious to those who drink,

47.Aisha Bewley: which has no headache in it and does not leave them stupefied.

48.Aisha Bewley: There will be dark-eyed maidens with them, with eyes reserved for them alone,

49.Aisha Bewley: just like closely guarded pearls.

50.Aisha Bewley: They will confront each other, questioning one another.

51.Aisha Bewley: One of them will say, ´I used to have a friend

52.Aisha Bewley: who would say to me, "Are you one of those who say that it is true:

53.Aisha Bewley: that when we have died and are turned to dust and bones, we will face a Reckoning?"´

54.Aisha Bewley: He will say, ´Are you looking down?´

55.Aisha Bewley: So he will look down and see him in the midst of the Blazing Fire

56.Aisha Bewley: and say, ´By Allah, you almost ruined me!

57.Aisha Bewley: If it were not for the blessing of my Lord, I would have been among those arraigned.

58.Aisha Bewley: Are we not going to die,

59.Aisha Bewley: except for our first death? Are we not going to be punished?

60.Aisha Bewley: Truly this is the Great Victory!

61.Aisha Bewley: It is for the like of this that all workers should work!´

62.Aisha Bewley: Is that better by way of hospitality or the tree of Zaqqum

63.Aisha Bewley: which We have made to be an ordeal for the wrongdoers?

64.Aisha Bewley: It is a tree that emerges in the depths of the Blazing Fire.

65.Aisha Bewley: Its fruits are just like the heads of shaytans.

66.Aisha Bewley: They will eat from it and fill their bellies with it.

67.Aisha Bewley: Then they will have a boiling brew to drink on top of it.

68.Aisha Bewley: Then their destination will be the Blazing Fire.

69.Aisha Bewley: They found their fathers misguided

70.Aisha Bewley: and they are following hard upon their heels.

71.Aisha Bewley: Most of the earlier peoples went astray before them

72.Aisha Bewley: though We sent warners to them.

73.Aisha Bewley: See the final fate of those who were warned —

74.Aisha Bewley: except for Allah´s chosen slaves.

75.Aisha Bewley: Nuh called out to Us and what an excellent Responder We are!

76.Aisha Bewley: We rescued him and his family from the terrible plight

77.Aisha Bewley: and made his descendants the survivors;

78.Aisha Bewley: and We left the later people to say of him:

79.Aisha Bewley: ´Peace be upon Nuh among all beings!´

80.Aisha Bewley: That is how we recompense the good-doers.

81.Aisha Bewley: He truly was one of Our slaves who are muminun.

82.Aisha Bewley: Then We drowned the rest.

83.Aisha Bewley: One of his followers in iman was Ibrahim

84.Aisha Bewley: when he came to his Lord with an unblemished heart,

85.Aisha Bewley: and said to his father and his people, ´What are you worshipping?

86.Aisha Bewley: Is it falsehood — gods besides Allah — that you desire?

87.Aisha Bewley: So what are your thoughts about the Lord of all the worlds?´

88.Aisha Bewley: He took a look at the stars

89.Aisha Bewley: and said, ´I am sick.´

90.Aisha Bewley: So they turned their backs on him.

91.Aisha Bewley: He turned surreptitiously to their gods and said, ´Do you not eat?

92.Aisha Bewley: What is the matter with you that you do not speak?´

93.Aisha Bewley: He turned on them, striking out with his right hand.

94.Aisha Bewley: They came rushing back to him.

95.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Do you worship something you have carved

96.Aisha Bewley: when Allah created both you and what you do?´

97.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Build a pyre for him and fling him into the blaze!´

98.Aisha Bewley: They tried to outwit him but We made them the lowest.

99.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´I am going towards my Lord; He will be my guide.

100.Aisha Bewley: My Lord, bestow on me a right-acting child!´

101.Aisha Bewley: And We gave him the good news of a forbearing boy.

102.Aisha Bewley: When he was of an age to work with him, he said, ´My son, I saw in a dream that I must sacrifice you. What do you think about this?´ He said, ´Do as you are ordered, father. Allah willing, you will find me resolute.´

103.Aisha Bewley: Then when they had both submitted and he had lain him face down on the ground,

105.Aisha Bewley: you have discharged your vision.´ That is how We recompense good-doers.

106.Aisha Bewley: This was indeed a most manifest trial.

107.Aisha Bewley: We ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice

108.Aisha Bewley: and left the later people saying of him:

110.Aisha Bewley: That is how We recompense good-doers.

111.Aisha Bewley: He truly was one of Our mumin slaves.

112.Aisha Bewley: We gave him the good news of Ishaq, a Prophet, one of the righteous.

113.Aisha Bewley: We showered blessings upon him and upon Ishaq. Among their descendants are good-doers and also people who clearly wrong themselves.

114.Aisha Bewley: We showed great kindness to Musa and Harun.

115.Aisha Bewley: We rescued them and their people from their terrible plight.

116.Aisha Bewley: We supported them and so they were the victors.

117.Aisha Bewley: We gave them the clarifying Book

118.Aisha Bewley: and guided them on the Straight Path,

119.Aisha Bewley: and left the later people saying of them,

121.Aisha Bewley: That is how We recompense good-doers.

122.Aisha Bewley: They truly were among Our slaves who are muminun.

123.Aisha Bewley: Ilyas was one of the Messengers.

124.Aisha Bewley: When he said to his people, ´Will you not have taqwa?

125.Aisha Bewley: Do you call on Baal and abandon the Best of Creators?

126.Aisha Bewley: Allah is your Lord and Lord of your forefathers, the previous peoples,´

127.Aisha Bewley: they denied him and so they will be among those arraigned —

129.Aisha Bewley: We left the later people saying of him,

130.Aisha Bewley: ´Peace be upon the family of Yasin!´

131.Aisha Bewley: That is how We recompense good-doers.

132.Aisha Bewley: He truly was one of Our slaves who are muminun.

133.Aisha Bewley: And Lut was one of the Messengers.

134.Aisha Bewley: When We rescued him and all his family —

135.Aisha Bewley: except an old woman among those who stayed behind.

136.Aisha Bewley: Then We utterly destroyed the rest.

137.Aisha Bewley: And you pass by them in the daytime and at night.

138.Aisha Bewley: So will you not use your intellect?

139.Aisha Bewley: Yunus too was one of the Messengers.

140.Aisha Bewley: When he ran away to the fully laden ship

142.Aisha Bewley: Then the fish devoured him and he was to blame.

143.Aisha Bewley: Had it not been that he was a man who glorified Allah,

144.Aisha Bewley: he would have remained inside its belly until the Day they are raised again.

145.Aisha Bewley: So We cast him up onto the beach and he was sick;

146.Aisha Bewley: and We caused a gourd tree to grow over him.

147.Aisha Bewley: We sent him to a hundred thousand or even more.

148.Aisha Bewley: They had iman and so We gave them enjoyment for a time.

149.Aisha Bewley: Ask them for a fatwa: does your Lord have daughters while they themselves have sons?

150.Aisha Bewley: Or did We create the angels female, with them as witnesses?

151.Aisha Bewley: No indeed, it is one of their blatant lies to say,

152.Aisha Bewley: ´Allah has given birth´. They are truly liars.

153.Aisha Bewley: Has He chosen daughters over sons?

154.Aisha Bewley: What is the matter with you? How do you reach your judgement?

156.Aisha Bewley: Or do you have some clear authority?

157.Aisha Bewley: Bring your Book, then, if you are telling the truth!

158.Aisha Bewley: They claim there is a blood-tie between Him and the jinn but the jinn know very well that they will be arraigned.

159.Aisha Bewley: Glory be to Allah above what they describe —

162.Aisha Bewley: you will entice no one to them

163.Aisha Bewley: except for him who is to roast in the Blazing Fire.

164.Aisha Bewley: ´There is not one of us who does not have a known station.

165.Aisha Bewley: We are those drawn up in ranks.

168.Aisha Bewley: ´If we had only had a Reminder from the previous peoples,

169.Aisha Bewley: we would certainly have been sincere slaves of Allah!´

170.Aisha Bewley: But they have rejected it and they will soon know!

171.Aisha Bewley: Our Word was given before to Our slaves, the Messengers,

172.Aisha Bewley: that they would certainly be helped.

173.Aisha Bewley: It is Our army which will be victorious.

174.Aisha Bewley: Therefore turn from them for a time.

175.Aisha Bewley: And watch them, for they will soon see!

176.Aisha Bewley: Are they trying to hasten Our punishment?

177.Aisha Bewley: When it descends in their courtyard — how evil will be the morning of those who were warned!

178.Aisha Bewley: Therefore turn from them for a time.

179.Aisha Bewley: And watch, for they will soon see!

180.Aisha Bewley: Glory be to your Lord, the Lord of Might, beyond anything they describe.

181.Aisha Bewley: And peace be upon the Messengers.

182.Aisha Bewley: And praise be to Allah, the Lord of all the worlds!

1.Aisha Bewley: Sâd By the Qur´an holding the Remembrance.

2.Aisha Bewley: But those who are kafir are full of vainglory and entrenched in hostility.

3.Aisha Bewley: How many generations We have destroyed before them! And they cried out when it was too late to escape.

4.Aisha Bewley: They are surprised that a warner should come to them from among themselves. The kuffar say, ´This is a lying magician.

5.Aisha Bewley: Has he turned all the gods into One God? That is truly astonishing!´

6.Aisha Bewley: Their leaders went off saying, ´Carry on as you are! Hold fast to your gods. This is clearly something planned.

7.Aisha Bewley: We have not heard of this in the old religion. This is merely something contrived.

8.Aisha Bewley: Has the Reminder been sent down to him out of all of us?´ They are in doubt about My Reminder. They have yet to taste My punishment.

9.Aisha Bewley: Or do they possess the treasuries of your Lord´s mercy, the Almighty, the Ever-Giving?

10.Aisha Bewley: Or does the kingdom of the heavens and earth and everything between them belong to them? Let them, in that case, climb the ropes to heaven!

11.Aisha Bewley: Even a whole army of Confederates will be routed there!

12.Aisha Bewley: Before them the people of Nuh denied the truth, as did ´Ad and Pharaoh of the Stakes,

13.Aisha Bewley: and Thamud and the people of Lut and the Companions of the Thicket.* Those too were Confederates.

14.Aisha Bewley: Each one of them denied the Messengers and so My punishment was justly carried out.

15.Aisha Bewley: These people too are only awaiting a single Blast and it will not be repeated.

16.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´Our Lord, advance our share to us before the Day of Reckoning.´

17.Aisha Bewley: Be steadfast in the face of what they say and remember Our slave Dawud, who possessed true strength. He truly turned to his Lord.

18.Aisha Bewley: We subjected the mountains to glorify with him in the evening and at sunrise.

19.Aisha Bewley: And also the birds, flocking together, all of them turned to Him.

20.Aisha Bewley: We made his kingdom strong and gave him wisdom and decisive speech.

21.Aisha Bewley: Has the story of the litigants reached you? How they climbed up to the Upper Room

22.Aisha Bewley: and came in on Dawud who was alarmed by them. They said, ´Do not be afraid. We are two litigants, one of whom has acted unjustly towards the other, so judge between us with truth and do not be unjust and guide us to the Right Path.

23.Aisha Bewley: This brother of mine has ninety-nine ewes and I have only one. He said, "Let me have charge of it," and got the better of me with his words.´

24.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´He has wronged you by asking for your ewe to add to his ewes. Truly many partners are unjust to one another — except those who have iman and do right actions, and how few they are!´ Dawud realised that We had put him to the test. He begged forgiveness from his Lord and fell down prone, prostrating, and repented.

25.Aisha Bewley: So We forgave him for that and he has nearness to Us and a good Homecoming.

26.Aisha Bewley: ´Dawud! We have made you a khalif on the earth, so judge between people with truth and do not follow your own desires, letting them misguide you from the Way of Allah. Those who are misguided from the Way of Allah will receive a harsh punishment because they forgot the Day of Reckoning.´

27.Aisha Bewley: We did not create heaven and earth and everything between them to no purpose. That is the opinion of those who are kafir. Woe to those who are kafir, because of the Fire!

28.Aisha Bewley: Would We make those who have iman and do right actions the same as those who cause corruption on the earth? Would We make those who have taqwa the same as the dissolute?

29.Aisha Bewley: It is a Book We have sent down to you, full of blessing, so let people of intelligence ponder its Signs and take heed.

30.Aisha Bewley: We gave Dawud Sulayman. What an excellent slave! He truly turned to his Lord.

31.Aisha Bewley: When swift horses, champing at the bit, were displayed before him in the afternoon,

32.Aisha Bewley: he said, ´I have put the love of good things above the remembrance of my Lord until the sun disappeared behind its veil.

33.Aisha Bewley: Return them to me!´ And he set about slashing through their shanks and necks.

34.Aisha Bewley: We tested Sulayman and placed a lifeless body on his throne. Then he made tawba.

35.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´My Lord, forgive me and give me a kingdom the like of which will never be granted to anyone after me. Truly You are the Ever-Giving.´

36.Aisha Bewley: So We subjected the wind to him to blow at his command, softly, wherever he directed.

37.Aisha Bewley: And the shaytans, every builder and diver,

38.Aisha Bewley: and others of them, yoked together in chains.

39.Aisha Bewley: ´This is Our gift: so bestow it or withhold it without reckoning.´

40.Aisha Bewley: He will have nearness to Us and a good Homecoming.

41.Aisha Bewley: Remember Our slave Ayyub when he called on his Lord: ´Shaytan has afflicted me with exhaustion and suffering.´

42.Aisha Bewley: ´Stamp your foot! Here is a cool bath and water to drink.´

43.Aisha Bewley: We gave him back his family and the same again with them as a mercy from Us and a reminder for people of intellect.

44.Aisha Bewley: ´Take a bundle of rushes in your hand and strike with that but do not break your oath.´ We found him steadfast. What an excellent slave! He truly turned to his Lord.

45.Aisha Bewley: And remember Our slaves Ibrahim, Ishaq and Ya´qub, men of true strength and inner sight.

46.Aisha Bewley: We purified their sincerity through sincere remembrance of the Abode.

47.Aisha Bewley: In Our eyes they are among the best of chosen men.

48.Aisha Bewley: Remember Our slaves Isma´il, Al-Yasa´ and Dhu´l-Kifl; each of them was among the best of men.

49.Aisha Bewley: This is a Reminder. Those who have taqwa will have a good Homecoming:

50.Aisha Bewley: Gardens of Eden, whose gates will be open to them,

51.Aisha Bewley: where they will recline, calling for plentiful fruit and drink;

52.Aisha Bewley: and there will be dark-eyed maidens with them with eyes reserved for them alone.

53.Aisha Bewley: This is what you are promised on the Day of Reckoning.

54.Aisha Bewley: This is Our provision which will never run out.

55.Aisha Bewley: This! Whereas for the profligate there is an evil Homecoming:

56.Aisha Bewley: Hell, where they will roast. What an evil resting-place!

57.Aisha Bewley: This! So let them taste it — boiling water and scalding pus,

58.Aisha Bewley: and other such torments.

59.Aisha Bewley: This! A crowd hurtling in with you. There is no welcome for them. They will certainly roast in the Fire.

60.Aisha Bewley: They will say, ´No, it is you who have no welcome. It is you who brought it upon us. What an evil place to settle!´

61.Aisha Bewley: They will say, ´Our Lord, give him who brought this on us double the punishment in the Fire!´

62.Aisha Bewley: They will say, ´How is it that we do not see some men whom we used to count among the worst of people?

63.Aisha Bewley: Did we turn them into figures of fun? Did our eyes disdain to look at them?´

64.Aisha Bewley: All this is certainly true — the bickering of the people of the Fire.

65.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´I am only a warner. There is no god except Allah, the One, the All-Conquering,

66.Aisha Bewley: Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything between them, the Almighty, the Endlessly Forgiving.´

67.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´This is momentous news

68.Aisha Bewley: yet you ignore it!

69.Aisha Bewley: I knew nothing of the Highest Assembly when they debated.

70.Aisha Bewley: It is only revealed to me that I am a clear warner.´

71.Aisha Bewley: Your Lord said to the angels, ´I am going to create a human being out of clay.

72.Aisha Bewley: When I have formed him and breathed My Ruh into him, fall down in prostration to him!´

73.Aisha Bewley: So the angels prostrated, all of them together,

74.Aisha Bewley: except for Iblis who was arrogant and was one of the kafirun.

75.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Iblis, what prevented you prostrating to what I created with My own Hands? Were you overcome by arrogance or are you one of the exalted?´

76.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´I am better than him. You created me from fire but You created him from clay.´

77.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´Get out! you are accursed!

78.Aisha Bewley: My curse is upon you until the Day of Reckoning.´

79.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´My Lord, grant me a reprieve until the Day they are raised again.´

80.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´You are among the reprieved

81.Aisha Bewley: until the Day whose time is known.´

82.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´By Your might, I will mislead all of them

83.Aisha Bewley: except for Your chosen slaves among them.´

84.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´By the truth — and I speak the truth —

85.Aisha Bewley: I will fill up Hell with you and every one of them who follows you.´

86.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´I do not ask you for any wage for it, nor am I a man of false pretensions.

87.Aisha Bewley: It is simply a reminder to all the worlds.

88.Aisha Bewley: You will come to know what it is talking about after a while.´

1.Aisha Bewley: The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Almighty, the All-Wise.

2.Aisha Bewley: We have sent down the Book to you with truth. So worship Allah, making your deen sincerely His.

3.Aisha Bewley: Indeed is the sincere deen not Allah´s alone? If people take protectors besides Him — ´We only worship them so that they may bring us nearer to Allah´ — Allah will judge between them regarding the things about which they differed. Allah does not guide anyone who is an ungrateful liar.

4.Aisha Bewley: If Allah had desired to have a son He would have chosen whatever He wished from what He has created. Glory be to Him! He is Allah, the One, the All-Conquering.

5.Aisha Bewley: He created the heavens and the earth with truth. He wraps the night around the day and wraps the day around the night, and has made the sun and moon subservient, each one running for a specified term. Is He not indeed the Almighty, the Endlessly Forgiving?

6.Aisha Bewley: He created you from a single self, then produced its mate from it, and sent down livestock to you — eight kinds in pairs. He creates you stage by stage in your mothers´ wombs in a threefold darkness. That is Allah, your Lord. Sovereignty is His. There is no god but Him. So what has made you deviate?

7.Aisha Bewley: If you are ungrateful, Allah is rich beyond need of any of you and He is not pleased with ingratitude in His slaves. But if you are grateful, He is pleased with you for that. No burden-bearer can bear another´s burden. Then you will return to your Lord and He will inform you of what you did. He knows what the heart contains.

8.Aisha Bewley: When harm touches man he calls upon his Lord, making tawba to Him. Then when He grants him a blessing from Him, he forgets what he was calling for before and ascribes rivals to Allah, so as to misguide others from His Way. Say: ´Enjoy your kufr for a little while. You are among the Companions of the Fire.´

9.Aisha Bewley: What of him who spends the night hours in prayer, prostrating and standing up, mindful of the Next World, hoping for the mercy of his Lord? Say: ´Are they the same — those who know and those who do not know?´ It is only people of intelligence who pay heed.

10.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Slaves of Mine who have iman! have taqwa of your Lord. For those who do good in this world there is good and Allah´s earth is spacious. The steadfast will be paid their wages in full without any reckoning.´

11.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´I am commanded to worship Allah, making my deen sincerely His.

12.Aisha Bewley: And I am commanded to be the first of the Muslims.´

13.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´I fear, were I to disobey my Lord, the punishment of a Terrible Day.´

14.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´It is Allah I worship, making my deen sincerely His,

15.Aisha Bewley: so worship anything you will apart from Him!´ Say: ´The real losers are those who lose themselves and their families on the Day of Rising.´ Is not that clear loss?

16.Aisha Bewley: They will have awnings of Fire above them and awnings below them. By that Allah strikes fear into His slaves: ´So have taqwa, My slaves, of Me!´

17.Aisha Bewley: Those who shun the worship of false gods and turn towards Allah will have good news. So give good news to My slaves.

18.Aisha Bewley: Those who listen well to what is said and follow the best of it, they are the ones whom Allah has guided, they are the people of intelligence.

19.Aisha Bewley: But as for those against whom the decree of Punishment is justly carried out, can you rescue those who are in the Fire?

20.Aisha Bewley: But those who have taqwa of their Lord will have high-ceilinged Halls, and more such Halls built one above the other, and rivers flowing under them. That is Allah´s promise. Allah does not break His promise.

21.Aisha Bewley: Do you not see that Allah sends down water from the sky and threads it through the earth to emerge as springs and then by it brings forth crops of varying colours, which then wither and you see them turning yellow and then He makes them into broken stubble? There is a reminder in that for people of intelligence.

22.Aisha Bewley: Is he whose breast is opened to Islam, and who is therefore illuminated by his Lord . . . ? Woe to those whose hearts are hardened against the remembrance of Allah! Such people are clearly misguided.

23.Aisha Bewley: Allah has sent down the Supreme Discourse, a Book consistent in its frequent repetitions. The skins of those who fear their Lord tremble at it and then their skins and hearts yield softly to the remembrance of Allah. That is Allah´s guidance by which He guides whoever He wills. And no one can guide those whom Allah misguides.

24.Aisha Bewley: Is someone who tries to shield himself with his face from the worst of the torment on the Day of Rising . . . ? The wrongdoers will be told, ´Taste what you have earned.´

25.Aisha Bewley: Those before them also denied the truth and the punishment came upon them from where they did not expect.

26.Aisha Bewley: So Allah made them taste disgrace in the life of this world and the punishment of the Next World is far worse if they only knew.

27.Aisha Bewley: We have given all kinds of examples to people in this Qur´an, so that hopefully they will pay heed —

28.Aisha Bewley: an Arabic Qur´an with no distortion in it, so that hopefully they will have taqwa.

29.Aisha Bewley: Allah has made a metaphor for them of a man owned by several partners in dispute with one another and another man wholly owned by a single man. Are they the same? Praise be to Allah! The fact is that most of them do not know.

30.Aisha Bewley: You will die and they too will die.

31.Aisha Bewley: Then on the Day of Rising you will argue in the presence of your Lord.

32.Aisha Bewley: Who could do greater wrong than those who lie about Allah and deny the truth when it comes to them? Do the kuffar not have a dwelling place in Hell?

33.Aisha Bewley: He who brings the truth and those who confirm it — those are the people who have taqwa.

34.Aisha Bewley: They will have anything they wish for with their Lord. That is the recompense of the good-doers.

35.Aisha Bewley: So that Allah may erase from them the worst of what they did and pay them their wages for the best of what they did.

36.Aisha Bewley: Is Allah not enough for His slave? Yet they try to scare you with others apart from Him. If Allah misguides someone, he has no guide

37.Aisha Bewley: and if Allah guides someone, he cannot be misguided. Is Allah not Almighty, Exactor of Revenge?

38.Aisha Bewley: If you ask them, ´Who created the heavens and the earth?´ they will say, ´Allah.´ Say: ´So what do you think? If Allah desires harm for me, can those you call upon besides Allah remove His harm? Or if He desires mercy for me, can they withhold His mercy?´ Say: ´Allah is enough for me. All those who truly trust put their trust in Him.´

39.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´My people, do as you think best; that is what I am doing. You will soon know

40.Aisha Bewley: who will receive a punishment which disgraces him and will unleash against himself an everlasting punishment.´

41.Aisha Bewley: We have sent down to you the Book for mankind with truth. So whoever is guided is guided to his own good and whoever is misguided, it is to his detriment. You are not set over them as a guardian.

42.Aisha Bewley: Allah takes back people´s souls when their death arrives and those who have not yet died, while they are asleep. He keeps hold of those whose death has been decreed and sends the others back for a specified term. There are certainly Signs in that for people who reflect.

43.Aisha Bewley: Or have they adopted intercessors besides Allah? Say: ´Even though they do not control a thing and have no awareness?´

44.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Intercession is entirely Allah´s affair. The kingdom of the heavens and earth is His. Then you will be returned to Him.´

45.Aisha Bewley: When Allah is mentioned on His own, the hearts of those who do not believe in the akhira shrink back shuddering, but when others apart from Him are mentioned, they jump for joy.

46.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´O Allah, Originator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of the Unseen and the Visible, You will judge between Your slaves regarding what they differed about.´

47.Aisha Bewley: If those who did wrong owned everything on earth, and the same again with it, they would offer it as a ransom to save themselves from the evil of the punishment on the Day of Rising. What confronts them from Allah will be something they did not reckon with.

48.Aisha Bewley: What confronts them will be the evil actions which they earned and what they used to mock at will engulf them.

49.Aisha Bewley: When harm touches man he calls on Us. Then when We grant him a blessing from Us he says, ´I have only been given this because of my knowledge.´ In fact it is a trial but most of them do not know it.

50.Aisha Bewley: Those who came before them also said that, but what they earned did not avail them.

51.Aisha Bewley: The evil deeds they earned caught up with them. And the evil deeds which the wrongdoers among these people earn will also catch up with them and they can do nothing to prevent it.

52.Aisha Bewley: Do they not know that Allah expands the provision of anyone He wills and restricts it? There are certainly Signs in that for people who have iman.

53.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´My slaves, you who have transgressed against yourselves, do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Truly Allah forgives all wrong actions. He is the Ever-Forgiving, the Most Merciful.´

54.Aisha Bewley: Turn in repentance to your Lord and submit to Him before punishment comes upon you, for then you cannot be helped.

55.Aisha Bewley: Follow the best that has been sent down to you from your Lord before the punishment comes upon you suddenly when you are not expecting it;

56.Aisha Bewley: lest anyone should say, ´Alas for me for neglecting what Allah was due, and being one of the scoffers!´

57.Aisha Bewley: or lest they should say, ´If only Allah had guided me, I would have had taqwa,´

58.Aisha Bewley: or lest he should say, when he sees the punishment, ´If only I could have another chance so that I could be a good-doer!´

59.Aisha Bewley: ´No, the fact is that My Signs came to you but you denied them and were arrogant and were one of the kafirun.´

60.Aisha Bewley: On the Day of Rising you will see those who lied against Allah with their faces blackened. Do not the arrogant have a dwelling place in Hell?

61.Aisha Bewley: Allah will give security those who had taqwa in their victorious Safe Haven. No evil will touch them and they will know no sorrow.

62.Aisha Bewley: Allah is the Creator of everything and He is Guardian over everything.

63.Aisha Bewley: The keys of the heavens and earth belong to Him. It is those who reject Allah´s Signs who are the losers.

64.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Do you order me to worship something other than Allah, you ignorant people?´

65.Aisha Bewley: It has been revealed to you and those before you: ´If you associate others with Allah, your actions will come to nothing and you will be among the losers.´

66.Aisha Bewley: No! Worship Allah and be among the thankful.

67.Aisha Bewley: They do not measure Allah with His true measure. The whole earth will be a mere handful for Him on the Day of Rising, the heavens folded up in His right hand. Glory be to Him! He is exalted above the partners they ascribe!

68.Aisha Bewley: The Trumpet will be blown and those in the heavens and those in the earth will all lose consciousness, except those Allah wills. Then it will be blown a second time and at once they will be standing upright, looking on.

69.Aisha Bewley: And the earth will shine with the Pure Light of its Lord; the Book will be put in place; the Prophets and witnesses will be brought; it will be decided between them with the truth; and they will not be wronged.

70.Aisha Bewley: Every self will be repaid in full for what it did. He knows best what they are doing.

71.Aisha Bewley: Those who are kafir will be driven to Hell in companies and when they arrive there and its gates are opened its custodians will say to them, ´Did Messengers from yourselves not come to you, reciting your Lord´s Signs to you and warning you of the meeting on this Day of yours?´ They will say, ´Indeed they did, but the decree of punishment is justly carried out against the kafirun.´

72.Aisha Bewley: They will be told, ´Enter the gates of Hell and stay there timelessly, for ever. How evil is the abode of the arrogant!´

73.Aisha Bewley: And those who have taqwa of their Lord will be driven to the Garden in companies and when they arrive there, finding its gates open, its custodians will say to them, ´Peace be upon you! You have done well so enter it timelessly, for ever.´

74.Aisha Bewley: They will say, ´Praise be to Allah Who has fulfilled His promise to us and made us the inheritors of this land, letting us settle in the Garden wherever we want. How excellent is the wage of those who work!´

75.Aisha Bewley: You will see the angels circling round the Throne, glorifying their Lord with praise. It will be decided between them with truth. And it will be said: ´Praise be to Allah, the Lord of all the worlds.´

1.Aisha Bewley: Ha Mim.

2.Aisha Bewley: The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Almighty, the All-Knowing.

3.Aisha Bewley: The Forgiver of wrong action, the Accepter of tawba, the Severe in retribution, the Possessor of abundance. There is no god but Him. He is the final destination.

4.Aisha Bewley: No one disputes Allah´s Signs except those who are kafir. Do not let their free movement about the earth deceive you.

5.Aisha Bewley: The people of Nuh denied the truth before them, and the Confederates after them. Every nation planned to seize its Messenger and used false arguments to rebut the truth. So I seized them, and how was My retribution!

6.Aisha Bewley: So your Lord´s Words about those who are kafir proved true, that they are indeed the Companions of the Fire.

7.Aisha Bewley: Those who bear the Throne, and all those around it, glorify their Lord with praise and believe in Him and ask forgiveness for those who have iman: ´Our Lord, You encompass everything in mercy and knowledge! Forgive those who turn to You and who follow Your Way and safeguard them from the punishment of the Blazing Fire.

8.Aisha Bewley: Our Lord, admit them to the Gardens of Eden You have promised them, and all of their parents, wives and children who acted rightly. Truly You are the Almighty, the All-Wise.

9.Aisha Bewley: And safeguard them from evil acts. Those You safeguard from evil acts are truly the recipients of Your mercy on that Day. That is the Mighty Victory.´

10.Aisha Bewley: Those who were kafir will be addressed: ´Allah´s hatred of you, when you were called to iman but then chose kufr, is even greater than your hatred of yourselves.´

11.Aisha Bewley: They will say, ´Our Lord, twice You caused us to die and twice You gave us life. We admit our wrong actions. Is there no way out?´

12.Aisha Bewley: That is because when Allah alone is called upon you are kafir, but if others are associated with Him, you have iman. Judgement belongs to Allah, the All-High, the All-Great.

13.Aisha Bewley: It is He who shows you His Signs and sends down provision to you out of heaven. But none pay heed save those who make tawba.

14.Aisha Bewley: So call upon Allah, making your deen sincerely His, even though the kafirun detest it.

15.Aisha Bewley: He is the Raiser of ranks, the Possessor of the Throne, He sends the Ruh by His command to whichever of His slaves He wills so that he may warn mankind about the Day of Meeting:

16.Aisha Bewley: the Day when they will issue forth and when not one thing about them will be hidden from Allah. ´To whom does the kingdom belong today? To Allah, the One, the Conqueror!

17.Aisha Bewley: Every self will be repaid today for what it earned. Today there will be no injustice. Allah is swift at reckoning.´

18.Aisha Bewley: And warn them of the Day of Immediacy when hearts rise choking to the throat. The wrongdoers will have no close friend nor any intercessor who might be heard.

19.Aisha Bewley: He knows the eyes´ deceit and what people´s breasts conceal.

20.Aisha Bewley: Allah will judge with truth; and those you call upon apart from Him will not judge with anything at all. It is Allah who is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing.

21.Aisha Bewley: Have they not travelled in the earth and seen the final fate of those before them? They were greater than them in strength and left far deeper traces on the earth, yet Allah seized them for their wrong actions and they had no one to protect them from Allah.

22.Aisha Bewley: That was because their Messengers brought them the Clear Signs but they remained kafir. So Allah seized them. He is Most Strong, Severe in Retribution.

23.Aisha Bewley: We sent Musa with Our Signs and clear authority

24.Aisha Bewley: to Pharaoh, Haman and Qarun. But they said, ´A lying magician.´

25.Aisha Bewley: When he brought them the truth from Us they said, ´Slaughter the sons of those who have iman with him but let their women live.´ The stratagems of the kafirun are nothing but errors.

26.Aisha Bewley: Pharaoh said, ´Let me kill Musa and let him call upon his Lord! I am afraid that he may change your deen and bring about corruption in the land.´

27.Aisha Bewley: Musa said, ´I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every proud man who does not have iman in the Day of Reckoning.´

28.Aisha Bewley: A man among Pharaoh´s people who had iman, but kept his iman concealed, said, ´Are you going to kill a man for saying "My Lord is Allah" when he has brought you Clear Signs from your Lord? If he is telling a lie, be it on his own head. But if he is telling the truth, then some of what he is promising you will certainly happen to you. Allah does not guide any unbridled inveterate liar.

29.Aisha Bewley: My people! the kingdom is yours today, as masters in the land, but who will help us against Allah´s violent force, if it comes upon us?´ Pharoah said, ´I only show you what I see myself and I only guide you to the path of rectitude.´

30.Aisha Bewley: The man who had iman said, ´My people! I fear for you a day like that of the Confederates,

31.Aisha Bewley: the same as happened to the people of Nuh and ´Ad and Thamud and those who followed after them. Allah does not want any injustice for His slaves.

32.Aisha Bewley: My people! I fear for you the Day of Calling Out,

33.Aisha Bewley: the Day when you will turn your backs in flight, having no one to protect you from Allah. Whoever Allah misguides will have no guide.

34.Aisha Bewley: Yusuf brought you the Clear Signs before, but you never stopped doubting what he brought to you to the extent that when he died, you said, "Allah will never send another Messenger after him." That is how Allah misguides those who are unbridled and full of doubt.´

35.Aisha Bewley: Those who argue about the Signs of Allah without any authority coming to them do something hateful in the sight of Allah and in the sight of the people who have iman. That is how Allah seals up the heart of every arrogant oppressor.

36.Aisha Bewley: Pharaoh said, ´Haman, build me a tower so that perhaps I may gain means of access,

37.Aisha Bewley: access to the heavens, so that I can look on Musa´s God. Truly I think he is a liar.´ That is how Pharaoh´s evil actions were made attractive to him and he debarred others from the Path. Pharaoh´s scheming led to nothing but ruin.

38.Aisha Bewley: The man who had iman said, ´My people! follow me and I will guide you to the path of rectitude.

39.Aisha Bewley: My people! the life of this world is only fleeting enjoyment. It is the Next World which is the abode of permanence.

40.Aisha Bewley: Whoever does an evil act will only be repaid with its equivalent. But whoever acts rightly, male or female, being a mumin, such a person will enter the Garden, provided for in it without any reckoning.

41.Aisha Bewley: My people! how is it that I call you to salvation while you call me to the Fire?

42.Aisha Bewley: You call me to reject Allah and to associate something with Him about which I have no knowledge, while I call you to the Almighty, the Endlessly Forgiving.

43.Aisha Bewley: There is no question that what you call me to has no foundation either in this world or the Next World, that our return is to Allah, and that the profligate will be Companions of the Fire.

44.Aisha Bewley: You will remember what I say to you. I consign my affair completely to Allah. Truly Allah sees His slaves.´

45.Aisha Bewley: So Allah safeguarded him from the evil things they plotted and a most evil torment engulfed Pharaoh´s people —

46.Aisha Bewley: the Fire, morning and night, to which they are exposed; and on the Day the Hour takes place: ´Admit Pharaoh´s people to the harshest punishment!´

47.Aisha Bewley: When they are squabbling with one another in the Fire, the weak will say to those deemed great, ´We were your followers, so why do you not relieve us of a portion of the Fire?´

48.Aisha Bewley: Those deemed great will say, ´All of us are in it. Allah has clearly judged between His slaves.´

49.Aisha Bewley: Those in the Fire will say to the custodians of Hell, ´Call on your Lord to make the punishment less for us for just one day.´

50.Aisha Bewley: They will ask, ´Did your Messengers not bring you the Clear Signs?´ They will answer, ´Yes.´ They will say, ´Then you call!´ But the calling of the kafirun only goes astray.

51.Aisha Bewley: We will certainly help Our Messengers and those who have iman both in the life of this world and on the Day the witnesses appear,

52.Aisha Bewley: the Day when the excuses of the wrongdoers will not help them. The curse will be on them and they will have the most evil Home.

53.Aisha Bewley: We gave Musa the guidance and bequeathed the Book to the tribe of Israel,

54.Aisha Bewley: as guidance and a reminder for people of intelligence.

55.Aisha Bewley: So remain steadfast. Allah´s promise is true. Ask forgiveness for your wrong action and glorify your Lord with praise in the evening and the early morning.

56.Aisha Bewley: Certainly those who argue about the Signs of Allah without any authority having come to them have nothing in their breasts except for pride which they will never be able to vindicate. Therefore seek refuge with Allah. He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing.

57.Aisha Bewley: The creation of the heavens and earth is far greater than the creation of mankind. But most of mankind do not know it.

58.Aisha Bewley: The blind and the seeing are not the same. Nor are those who have iman and do right actions the same as evildoers. What little heed they pay!

59.Aisha Bewley: The Hour is coming — there is no doubt about it. But most of mankind have no iman.

60.Aisha Bewley: Your Lord says, ´Call on Me and I will answer you. Those who who are too proud to worship Me will enter Hell abject.´

61.Aisha Bewley: Allah is He who appointed the night for you so that you might rest in it, and the day for seeing. Allah pours out His favour on mankind but most people do not show thanks.

62.Aisha Bewley: That is Allah, your Lord, the Creator of everything. There is no god but Him — so how have you been perverted?

63.Aisha Bewley: That is how those who deny Allah´s Signs have been perverted.

64.Aisha Bewley: It is Allah who made the earth a stable home for you and the sky a dome, and formed you, giving you the best of forms, and provided you with good and wholesome things. That is Allah, your Lord. Blessed be Allah, the Lord of all the worlds.

65.Aisha Bewley: He is the Living — there is no god but Him — so call on Him, making your deen sincerely His. Praise be to Allah, the Lord of all the worlds.

66.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´I was forbidden to worship those you call upon besides Allah when the Clear Signs came to me from my Lord and I was commanded to submit to the Lord of all the worlds.´

67.Aisha Bewley: It is He who created you from earth, then from a drop of sperm, then from a clot of blood, then He brings you out as infants, then so you may achieve full strength, then so you may become old men — though some of you may die before that time — so that you may reach a predetermined age and so that hopefully you will use your intellect.

68.Aisha Bewley: It is He who gives life and causes to die. When He decides on something, He just says to it, ´Be!´ and it is.

69.Aisha Bewley: Do you not see those who argue about Allah´s Signs? How have they been turned around?

70.Aisha Bewley: Those who deny the Book and that with which We sent Our Messengers will certainly come to know

71.Aisha Bewley: when they have shackles and chains around their necks and are dragged along the ground

72.Aisha Bewley: into the boiling water and then are thrown into the Fire!

73.Aisha Bewley: Then they will be asked, ´Where are those besides Allah you associated with Him?´

74.Aisha Bewley: and they will reply, ´They have forsaken us. Or rather we were not calling to anything at all before.´ That is how Allah misguides the kafirun.

75.Aisha Bewley: ´That is because you exulted on the earth, without any right to do so; and strutted about.

76.Aisha Bewley: Enter the gates of Hell, remaining in it timelessly, for ever. How evil is the abode of the arrogant!´

77.Aisha Bewley: So be steadfast, Allah´s promise is true. Whether We show you some of what We have promised them, or take you back to Us, they will in any case be returned to Us.

78.Aisha Bewley: We sent Messengers before you. Some of them We have told you about and others We have not told you about. No Messenger can bring a Sign except with Allah´s permission. But when Allah´s command comes the matter will be decided with truth and then and there the liars will be lost.

79.Aisha Bewley: It is Allah who has given you livestock, some for you to ride and some to eat.

80.Aisha Bewley: You gain various benefits from them, and on them you can obtain what your hearts desire, and on them and on the ships you are transported.

81.Aisha Bewley: He shows you His Signs, so which of Allah´s Signs do you deny?

82.Aisha Bewley: Have they not travelled in the land and seen the final fate of those before them? They were more numerous than them and greater in strength and left more and deeper traces on earth, but what they earned was of no use to them.

83.Aisha Bewley: When their Messengers brought them the Clear Signs, they exulted in the knowledge they had and then were engulfed by the very things they mocked.

84.Aisha Bewley: When they saw Our violent force, they said, ´We have iman in Allah alone and reject what we associated with Him.´

85.Aisha Bewley: But when they saw Our violent force their iman was of no use to them. That is the pattern Allah has always followed with His slaves. Then and there the kafirun were lost.

41.SurahEnglishNames: Explained in Detail, Revelations Well Expounded

1.Aisha Bewley: Ha Mim.

2.Aisha Bewley: A revelation from the All-Merciful, the Most Merciful.

3.Aisha Bewley: A Book whose verses have been demarcated for people who know as an Arabic Qur´an,

4.Aisha Bewley: bringing good news and giving warning; but most of them have turned away and do not hear.

5.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´Our hearts are covered up against what you call us to and there is a heaviness in our ears. There is a screen between us and you. So act — we are certainly acting.´

6.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´I am only a human being like yourselves. It is revealed to me that your god is One God. So be straight with Him and ask His forgiveness.´ Woe to those who associate others with Him:

7.Aisha Bewley: those who do not pay zakat and reject the Next World.

8.Aisha Bewley: Those who have iman and do right actions will have a wage which never fails.

9.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Do you reject Him who created the earth in two days, and make others equal to Him? That is the Lord of all the worlds.´

10.Aisha Bewley: He placed firmly embedded mountains on it, towering over it, and blessed it and measured out its nourishment in it, laid out for those who seek it — all in four days.

11.Aisha Bewley: Then He turned to heaven when it was smoke and said to it and to the earth, ´Come willingly or unwillingly.´ They both said, ´We come willingly.´

12.Aisha Bewley: In two days He determined them as seven heavens and revealed, in every heaven, its own mandate. We adorned the lowest heaven with lamps and guarded it. That is the decree of the Almighty, the All-Knowing.

13.Aisha Bewley: If they turn away, then say, ´I warn you of a lightning-bolt like the lightning-bolt of ´Ad and of Thamud.´

14.Aisha Bewley: When the Messengers came to them from in front and from behind, saying, ´Do not worship anyone but Allah.´ they said, ´If our Lord had willed, He could have sent angels down, so we reject the Message you have been sent with.´

15.Aisha Bewley: ´Ad were arrogant in the land, without any right, saying, ´Who has greater strength than us?´ Did they not see that Allah, who created them, had greater strength than them? But they renounced Our Signs.

16.Aisha Bewley: So We sent a howling wind against them on disastrous ill-fated days to make them taste the punishment of degradation in this world. And the punishment of the Next World is even more degrading. And they will not be helped.

17.Aisha Bewley: As for Thamud, We guided them, but they preferred blindness to guidance. So the lightning-bolt of the punishment of humiliation seized them on account of what they earned.

18.Aisha Bewley: And We rescued those who had iman and taqwa.

19.Aisha Bewley: On the Day We crowd the enemies of Allah into the Fire and they are driven in close-packed ranks,

20.Aisha Bewley: when they reach it, their hearing, sight and skin will testify against them concerning what they did.

21.Aisha Bewley: They will ask their skins, ´Why did you testify against us?´ and they will reply, ´Allah gave us speech as He has given speech to everything. He created you in the first place and you will be returned to Him.

22.Aisha Bewley: You did not think to shield yourselves from your hearing, sight and skin testifying against you and you thought that Allah would never know much of what you did.

23.Aisha Bewley: It is that thought you had about your Lord that has destroyed you so now you find yourselves among the lost.´

24.Aisha Bewley: If they are steadfast, the Fire will still be their residence! If they ask for favour, no favour will be given.

25.Aisha Bewley: We have assigned close comrades to them who have made what is before them and behind them seem good to them. And the statement about the nations, both of jinn and men, who passed away before them has proved true of them as well. Certainly they were lost.

26.Aisha Bewley: Those who are kafir say, ´Do not listen to this Qur´an. Drown it out so that hopefully you will gain the upper hand.´

27.Aisha Bewley: We will make those who are kafir suffer a severe punishment and repay them for the worst of what they did.

28.Aisha Bewley: That is the repayment of the enemies of Allah — the Fire. They will have it for their Eternal Home as repayment for their renunciation of Our Signs.

29.Aisha Bewley: Those who are kafir say, ´Our Lord, show us those jinn and men who misguided us and we will place them beneath our feet so that they will be among the lowest of the low.´

30.Aisha Bewley: The angels descend on those who say, ´Our Lord is Allah,´ and then go straight: ´Do not fear and do not grieve but rejoice in the Garden you have been promised.

31.Aisha Bewley: We are your protectors in the life of this world and the Next World. You will have there all that your selves could wish for. You will have there everything you demand.

32.Aisha Bewley: Hospitality from One who is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.´

33.Aisha Bewley: Who could say anything better than someone who summons to Allah and acts rightly and says, ´I am one of the Muslims´?

34.Aisha Bewley: A good action and a bad action are not the same. Repel the bad with something better and, if there is enmity between you and someone else, he will be like a bosom friend.

35.Aisha Bewley: None will obtain it but those who are truly steadfast. None will obtain it but those who have great good fortune.

36.Aisha Bewley: If an evil urge from Shaytan eggs you on, seek refuge in Allah. He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.

37.Aisha Bewley: Among His Signs are the night and day and the sun and moon. Do not prostrate to the sun nor to the moon. Prostrate to Allah who created them, if you worship Him.

38.Aisha Bewley: If they grow arrogant, those who are with your Lord glorify Him night and day and never grow tired.

39.Aisha Bewley: Among His Signs is that you see the earth laid bare and then when We send down water on it it quivers and swells. He who gives it life is He who gives life to the dead. Certainly He has power over all things.

40.Aisha Bewley: Those who adulterate Our Signs are not concealed from Us. Who is better — someone who will be thrown into the fire or someone who will arrive in safety on the Day of Rising? Do what you like. He sees whatever you do.

41.Aisha Bewley: Those who reject the Remembrance when it comes to them — truly it is a Mighty Book;

42.Aisha Bewley: falsehood cannot reach it from before it or behind it — it is a revelation from One who is All-Wise, Praiseworthy.

43.Aisha Bewley: Nothing has been said to you that was not said to the Messengers before you. Your Lord is the Possessor of forgiveness but also of painful retribution.

44.Aisha Bewley: If We had made it a Qur´an in a foreign tongue they would have said, ´Why have its Signs not been made plain? What! A foreign language for an Arab?´ Say: ´It is guidance and healing for people who have iman. Those who do not have iman have heaviness in their ears and for them it is blindness. Such people are being called from a very distant place.´

45.Aisha Bewley: We gave Musa the Book but there was disagreement about it. And had it not been for a prior Word from your Lord, the judgement between them would already have been made. They are indeed in grave doubt about it.

46.Aisha Bewley: Whoever acts rightly, it is to his own good. Whoever does evil, it is to his detriment. Your Lord does not wrong His slaves.

47.Aisha Bewley: Knowledge of the Hour is referred to Him. And no fruit emerges from its husk, nor does any female get pregnant or give birth, without His knowledge. On the Day He calls out to them: ´Where are My associates?´ they will say, ´We declare to you that none of us is a witness.´

48.Aisha Bewley: What they called upon before will have forsaken them and they will realise they have no way of escape.

49.Aisha Bewley: Man never tires of praying for the good and if evil touches him, he despairs and loses hope.

50.Aisha Bewley: But if We let him taste mercy from Us after he has suffered hardship, then he says, ´This is my due. I do not think that the Hour is going to come. And if am returned to my Lord, I will definitely find the best reward with Him.´ But We will inform those who are kafir of what they did and make them suffer a ruthless punishment.

51.Aisha Bewley: When We grant blessing to a man, he turns away and draws aside but when any evil touches him, he is full of endless prayers!

52.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´What do you think? If it is from Allah and you reject it, who could be more misguided than someone entrenched in hostility to it?´

53.Aisha Bewley: We will show them Our Signs on the horizon and within themselves until it is clear to them that it is the truth. Is it not enough for your Lord that He is a witness of everything?

54.Aisha Bewley: What! Are they in doubt about the meeting with their Lord? What! Does He not encompass all things?

1.Aisha Bewley: Ha Mim

2.Aisha Bewley: ´Ayn Sin Qaf

3.Aisha Bewley: That is how He sends revelation to you and those before you. Allah is the Almighty, the All-Wise.

4.Aisha Bewley: Everything in the heavens and everything in the earth belongs to Him. He is the Most High, the Magnificent.

5.Aisha Bewley: The heavens are all but rent asunder from above when the angels glorify their Lord with praise and ask forgiveness for those who are on the earth. Allah is the Ever-Forgiving, the Most Merciful.

6.Aisha Bewley: As for those who take others besides Him as protectors, Allah takes care of them. You are not set over them as a guardian.

7.Aisha Bewley: Accordingly We have revealed to you an Arabic Qur´an so that you may warn the Mother of Cities* and those around it, and give warning of the Day of Gathering about which there is no doubt: one group in the Garden, the other in the Blazing Fire.

8.Aisha Bewley: If Allah had willed, He would have made them a single nation. But He admits whoever He wills into His mercy and the wrongdoers have no protector and no helper.

9.Aisha Bewley: Have they then taken others besides Him as protectors? But Allah is the Protector. He gives life to the dead. He has power over all things.

10.Aisha Bewley: The judgement concerning anything you differ about is Allah´s concern. That is Allah, my Lord — I have put my trust in Him and to Him I turn —

11.Aisha Bewley: the Bringer into Being of the heavens and the earth: He has given you mates from among yourselves, and given mates to the livestock, in that way multiplying you. Nothing is like Him. He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing.

12.Aisha Bewley: The Keys of the heavens and earth belong to Him. He expands the provision of anyone He wills or restricts it. He has knowledge of all things.

13.Aisha Bewley: He has laid down the same deen for you as He enjoined on Nuh: that which We have revealed to you and which We enjoined on Ibrahim, Musa and ´Isa: ´Establish the deen and do not make divisions in it.´ What you call the idolaters to follow is very hard for them. Allah chooses for Himself anyone He wills and guides to Himself those who turn to Him.

14.Aisha Bewley: They only split up after knowledge came to them, tyrannising one another. And were it not for a prior decree from your Lord for a specified term, the judgement between them would already have been made. Those who inherited the Book after them are indeed in grave doubt about it.

15.Aisha Bewley: So call and go straight as you have been ordered to. Do not follow their whims and desires but say, ´I have iman in a Book sent down by Allah and I am ordered to be just between you. Allah is our Lord and your Lord. We have our actions and you have your actions. There is no debate between us and you. Allah will gather us all together. He is our final destination.´

16.Aisha Bewley: The argument of those who argue about Allah, once He has been acknowledged, has no basis whatsoever with their Lord. There is anger upon them and they will have a harsh punishment.

17.Aisha Bewley: It is Allah who has sent down the Book with truth and with the Just Balance. What will make you realise? Perhaps the Hour is close.

18.Aisha Bewley: Those who do not have iman in it try to hasten it. But those who have iman in it are afraid of it. They know it is the truth. Those who doubt the Hour are greatly misguided.

19.Aisha Bewley: Allah is very gentle with His slaves. He provides for anyone He wills. He is the Most Strong, the Almighty.

20.Aisha Bewley: If anyone desires to cultivate the Next World, We will increase him in his cultivation. If anyone desires to cultivate this world, We will give him some of it but he will have no share in the Next World.

21.Aisha Bewley: Or do they have partners who have laid down a deen for them for which Allah has not given any authority? Were it not for the prior Word of Decision, the judgement between them would already have been made. The wrongdoers will have a painful punishment.

22.Aisha Bewley: You will see the wrongdoers afraid of what they have earned, when it is about to land right on top of them, whereas those who have iman and do right actions will be in the lush Meadows of the Gardens. They will have whatever they wish for with their Lord. That is the great favour.

23.Aisha Bewley: That is the good news which Allah gives to His slaves who have iman and do right actions. Say: ´I do not ask you for any wage for this — except for you to love your near of kin. If anyone does a good action, We will increase the good of it for him. Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Ever-Thankful.´

24.Aisha Bewley: Or do they ask, ´Has he invented a lie about Allah?´ If Allah willed, He could seal up your heart. By His Words Allah wipes out the false and confirms the truth. He knows what the heart contains.

25.Aisha Bewley: It is He who accepts tawba from His slaves and pardons evil acts and knows what they do.

26.Aisha Bewley: He responds to those who have iman and do right actions and gives them increase from His favour. But the kafirun will have a harsh punishment.

27.Aisha Bewley: Were Allah to expand the provision of His slaves, they would act as tyrants on the earth. But He sends down whatever He wills in a measured way. He is aware of and He sees His slaves.

28.Aisha Bewley: It is He who sends down abundant rain, after they have lost all hope, and unfolds His mercy. He is the Protector, the Praiseworthy.

29.Aisha Bewley: Among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and earth and all the creatures He has spread about in them. And He has the power to gather them together whenever He wills.

30.Aisha Bewley: Any disaster that strikes you is through what your own hands have earned and He pardons much.

31.Aisha Bewley: You will not be able to thwart Him on the earth and you have no protector or helper besides Allah.

32.Aisha Bewley: Among His Signs are the tall ships sailing like mountains through the sea.

33.Aisha Bewley: If He wills He makes the wind stop blowing and then they lie motionless on its back. There are certainly Signs in that for everyone who is steadfast and thankful.

34.Aisha Bewley: Or He wrecks them for what they have earned though He pardons much.

35.Aisha Bewley: Those who argue about Our Signs should know that they have no way of escape.

36.Aisha Bewley: Whatever you have been given is only the enjoyment of the life of this world. What is with Allah is better and longer lasting for those who have iman and trust in their Lord:

37.Aisha Bewley: those who avoid major wrong actions and indecencies and who, when they are angered, then forgive;

38.Aisha Bewley: those who respond to their Lord and establish salat, and manage their affairs by mutual consultation and give of what We have provided for them;

39.Aisha Bewley: those who, when they are wronged, defend themselves.

40.Aisha Bewley: The repayment of a bad action is one equivalent to it. But if someone pardons and puts things right, his reward is with Allah. Certainly He does not love wrongdoers.

41.Aisha Bewley: But if people do defend themselves when they are wronged, nothing can be held against them for doing that.

42.Aisha Bewley: There are only grounds against those who wrong people and act as tyrants in the earth without any right to do so. Such people will have a painful punishment.

43.Aisha Bewley: But if someone is steadfast and forgives, that is the most resolute course to follow.

44.Aisha Bewley: Whoever Allah misguides has no one to protect them after that. You will see the wrongdoers saying, when they see the punishment, ´Is there no way back?´

45.Aisha Bewley: You will see them as they are exposed to it, abject in their abasement, glancing around them furtively. Those who have iman will say, ´Truly the losers are those who lose themselves and their families on the Day of Rising.´ The wrongdoers are in an everlasting punishment.

46.Aisha Bewley: They have no one to protect or help them apart from Allah. There is no way out for anyone Allah misguides.

47.Aisha Bewley: Respond to your Lord before a Day comes from Allah which cannot be turned back. On that Day you will have no hiding-place and no means of denial.

48.Aisha Bewley: But if they turn away, We have not sent you to be their guardian. You are only responsible for transmission. When We let a man taste mercy from Us he exults in it. But if something bad strikes him for what he has done he is ungrateful.

49.Aisha Bewley: The kingdom of the heavens and earth belongs to Allah. He creates whatever He wills. He gives daughters to whoever He wishes; and He gives sons to whoever He wishes;

50.Aisha Bewley: or He gives them both sons and daughters; and He makes whoever He wishes barren. Truly He is All-Knowing, All-Powerful.

51.Aisha Bewley: It does not befit Allah to address any human being except by inspiration, or from behind a veil, or He sends a messenger who then reveals by His permission whatever He wills. He is indeed Most High, All-Wise.

52.Aisha Bewley: Accordingly We have revealed to you a Ruh by Our command. You had no idea of what the Book was, nor faith. Nonetheless We have made it a Light by which We guide those of Our slaves We will. Truly you are guiding to a Straight Path:

53.Aisha Bewley: the Path of Allah to Whom everything in the heavens and everything on the earth belongs. Indeed all matters return eventually to Allah.

43.SurahEnglishNames: Ornaments of Gold, Luxury, The Embellishment

1.Aisha Bewley: Ha Mim.

2.Aisha Bewley: By the Book which makes things clear.

3.Aisha Bewley: We have made it an Arabic Qur´an so that hopefully you will use your intellect.

4.Aisha Bewley: It is in the Source Book with Us, high-exalted, full of wisdom.

5.Aisha Bewley: Shall We then deprive you of the Reminder for being a profligate people?

6.Aisha Bewley: How many Prophets We sent to the previous peoples!

7.Aisha Bewley: But no Prophet came to them without their mocking him;

8.Aisha Bewley: and so We destroyed people with greater power than they have and the pattern of the previous peoples has gone before.
