9.Aisha Bewley: If you were to ask them, ´Who created the heavens and the earth?´ they would reply, ´The Almighty, the All-Knowing created them.´

10.Aisha Bewley: It is He who made the earth a cradle for you and made pathways for you in it so that hopefully you would be guided.

11.Aisha Bewley: It is He who sends down water in due measure from the sky by which We bring a dead land back to life. That is how you too will be brought forth.

12.Aisha Bewley: It is He who created all the species and gave you ships and livestock for you to ride,

13.Aisha Bewley: so that you might sit firmly on their backs and remember your Lord´s blessing while you are seated on them, saying, ´Glory be to Him who has subjected this to us. We could never have done it by ourselves.

14.Aisha Bewley: Indeed we are returning to our Lord!´

15.Aisha Bewley: They have assigned to Him a portion of His creatures! Truly man is openly ungrateful.

16.Aisha Bewley: Has He then taken daughters from what He has created and chosen sons for you?

17.Aisha Bewley: When any of them is given the good news of the very thing which he himself has ascribed to the All-Merciful his face darkens and he is furious.

18.Aisha Bewley: ´What! Someone brought up among pretty trinkets who cannot produce a cogent argument!´

19.Aisha Bewley: They have designated the angels as female, those who are in the presence of the All-Merciful! Were they present to witness their creation? Their testimony will be recorded and they will be asked about it!

20.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´If the All-Merciful had so willed, we would not have worshipped them.´ They have no knowledge of that. They are only conjecturing.

21.Aisha Bewley: Or did We give them a Book before, which they are holding to?

22.Aisha Bewley: No, in fact they say, ´We found our fathers following a religion and we are simply guided in their footsteps.´

23.Aisha Bewley: Similarly We never sent any warner before you to any city without the affluent among them saying, ´We found our fathers following a religion and we are simply following in their footsteps.´

24.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´What if I have come with better guidance than what you found your fathers following?´ They say, ´We reject what you have been sent with.´

25.Aisha Bewley: So We took revenge on them. And see the final fate of the deniers!

26.Aisha Bewley: When Ibrahim said to his father and his people, ´I am free of everything you worship,

27.Aisha Bewley: except for Him who brought me into being, Who will certainly guide me,´

28.Aisha Bewley: he made it an on-going word among his descendants so that perhaps they might turn back.

29.Aisha Bewley: I let those people and their forefathers enjoy themselves until the truth came to them and a Messenger to make it clear.

30.Aisha Bewley: But when the truth came to them they said, ´This is magic and we reject it.´

31.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´Why was this Qur´an not sent down to one of the great men of the two cities?´

32.Aisha Bewley: Is it, then, they who allocate the mercy of your Lord? We have allocated their livelihood among them in the life of the dunya and raised some of them above others in rank so that some of them are subservient to others. But the mercy of your Lord is better than anything they amass.

33.Aisha Bewley: Were it not that mankind might all become one community, We would have given those who reject the All-Merciful silver roofs to their houses and silver stairways to ascend

34.Aisha Bewley: and silver doors to their houses and silver couches on which to recline,

35.Aisha Bewley: and gold ornaments. All that is merely the trappings of the life of this world. But the Next World with your Lord is for those who have taqwa.

36.Aisha Bewley: If someone shuts his eyes to the remembrance of the All-Merciful, We assign him a shaytan who becomes his bosom friend —

37.Aisha Bewley: they debar them from the path, yet they still think they are guided —

38.Aisha Bewley: so that, when he reaches Us, he says, ´If only there was the distance of the two Easts between you and me!´ What an evil companion!

39.Aisha Bewley: It will not benefit you today, since you did wrong, that you share equally in the punishment.

40.Aisha Bewley: Can you make the dead hear or guide the blind and those who are patently misguided?

41.Aisha Bewley: Either We will extricate you and take revenge on them

42.Aisha Bewley: or let you see what We have promised them. They are completely in Our power.

43.Aisha Bewley: So hold fast to what has been revealed to you. You are on a straight path.

44.Aisha Bewley: It is certainly a reminder to you and to your people and you will be questioned.

45.Aisha Bewley: Ask those We sent before you as Our Messengers: Have We ever designated any gods to be worshipped besides the All-Merciful?

46.Aisha Bewley: We sent Musa with Our Signs to Pharaoh and his nobles. He said, ´I am the Messenger of the Lord of the worlds.´

47.Aisha Bewley: But when he came to them with Our Signs, they merely laughed at them.

48.Aisha Bewley: We showed them no Sign which was not greater than the one before it. We seized them with punishment so that hopefully they would turn back.

49.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Magician, invoke your Lord for us by the contract He has made with you and we shall certainly follow the guidance.´

50.Aisha Bewley: But when We removed the punishment from them, they immediately broke their word.

51.Aisha Bewley: Pharaoh called to his people, saying, ´My people, does the kingdom of Egypt not belong to me? Do not all these rivers flow under my control? Do you not then see?

52.Aisha Bewley: Am I not better than this man who is contemptible and can scarcely make anything clear?

53.Aisha Bewley: Why have gold bracelets not been put upon his arms and why is there not a train of angels accompanying him?´

54.Aisha Bewley: In that way he swayed his people and they succumbed to him. They were a people of deviators.

55.Aisha Bewley: Then when they had provoked Our wrath, We took revenge on them and drowned every one of them.

56.Aisha Bewley: We made them a thing of the past, an example for later peoples.

57.Aisha Bewley: When an example is made of the son of Maryam your people laugh uproariously.

58.Aisha Bewley: They retort, ´Who is better then, our gods or him?´ They only say this to you for argument´s sake. They are indeed a disputatious people.

59.Aisha Bewley: He is only a slave on whom We bestowed Our blessing and whom We made an example for the tribe of Israel.

60.Aisha Bewley: If We wished We could appoint angels in exchange for you to succeed you on the earth.

61.Aisha Bewley: He is a Sign of the Hour. Have no doubt about it. But follow me. This is a straight path.

62.Aisha Bewley: Do not let Shaytan bar your way. He truly is an outright enemy to you.

63.Aisha Bewley: And when ´Isa came with the Clear Signs, he said, ´I have come to you with Wisdom and to clarify for you some of the things about which you have differed. Therefore have taqwa of Allah and obey me.

64.Aisha Bewley: Allah is my Lord and your Lord so worship Him. This is a straight path.´

65.Aisha Bewley: The various factions among them differed. Woe then to those who did wrong on account of the punishment of a painful Day!

66.Aisha Bewley: What are they waiting for, but the Hour to come upon them suddenly when they are not expecting it?

67.Aisha Bewley: On that Day the closest friends will be enemies to one another — except for those who have taqwa.

68.Aisha Bewley: ´My slaves, you will feel no fear today; you will know no sorrow.´

69.Aisha Bewley: As for those who had iman in Our Signs and became Muslims:

70.Aisha Bewley: ´Enter the Garden, you and your wives, delighting in your joy.´

71.Aisha Bewley: Platters and cups of gold will passed around among them and they will have there all that their hearts desire and their eyes find delight in. You will remain in it timelessly, for ever.

72.Aisha Bewley: That is the Garden you will inherit for what you did.

73.Aisha Bewley: There will be many fruits in it for you to eat.

74.Aisha Bewley: The evildoers will remain timelessly, for ever, in the punishment of Hell.

75.Aisha Bewley: It will not be eased for them. They will be crushed there by despair.

76.Aisha Bewley: We have not wronged them; it was they who were wrongdoers.

77.Aisha Bewley: They will call out, ´Malik, let your Lord put an end to us!´ He will say, ´You will stay the way you are.´

78.Aisha Bewley: We brought you the truth but most of you hated the truth.

79.Aisha Bewley: Or have they hatched a plot? It is We who are the Hatcher!

80.Aisha Bewley: Or do they imagine that We do not hear their secrets and their private talk? On the contrary Our messengers are right there with them writing it down!

81.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´If the All-Merciful had a son, I would be the first to worship him.´

82.Aisha Bewley: Glory be to the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne, beyond what they describe.

83.Aisha Bewley: So leave them to plunge and play around until they meet their Day which they are promised.

84.Aisha Bewley: It is He who is God in heaven and God on earth. He is the All-Wise, the All-Knowing.

85.Aisha Bewley: Blessed be Him to whom belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth and everything in between them. The knowledge of the Hour is with Him. You will be returned to Him.

86.Aisha Bewley: Those you call upon apart from Him possess no power of intercession — only those who bore witness to the truth and have full knowledge.

87.Aisha Bewley: If you asked them who created them, they would say, ´Allah!´ So how have they been perverted?

88.Aisha Bewley: And as for his words, ´My Lord, these are people who have no iman!´

89.Aisha Bewley: turn from them and say, ´Peace! You will soon come to know.´

1.Aisha Bewley: Ha Mim.

2.Aisha Bewley: By the Book which makes things clear.

3.Aisha Bewley: We sent it down on a blessed night; We are constantly giving warning.

4.Aisha Bewley: During it every wise decree is specified

5.Aisha Bewley: by a command from Our presence. We are constantly sending out

6.Aisha Bewley: as a mercy from your Lord. He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing:

7.Aisha Bewley: the Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything in between them, if you are people with certainty.

8.Aisha Bewley: There is no god but Him — He gives life and causes to die — your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers, the previous peoples.

9.Aisha Bewley: Yet they play around in doubt.

10.Aisha Bewley: So be on the watch for a day when heaven brings forth a distinctive smoke,

11.Aisha Bewley: which enshrouds mankind. ´This is a painful punishment!

12.Aisha Bewley: Our Lord, remove the punishment from us. We are really muminun.´

13.Aisha Bewley: How can they expect a Reminder when a clear Messenger has already come to them?

14.Aisha Bewley: But then they turned away from him and said, ´He is an instructed madman!´

15.Aisha Bewley: We remove the punishment a little, and you revert!

16.Aisha Bewley: On the day We launch the Great Assault We will certainly take Our revenge.

17.Aisha Bewley: Before them We put Pharaoh´s people to the test when a noble Messenger came to them, saying

18.Aisha Bewley: ´Hand over to me the slaves of Allah. I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.´

19.Aisha Bewley: And: ´Do not exalt yourselves above Allah. I come to you with clear authority.

20.Aisha Bewley: I have sought refuge with my Lord and your Lord against your stoning me.

21.Aisha Bewley: If you do not have iman in me, then at least leave me alone.´

22.Aisha Bewley: He called out to his Lord, ´These are evildoing people.´

23.Aisha Bewley: ´Set out with My slaves by night. You will certainly be pursued.

24.Aisha Bewley: Leave the sea divided as it is. They are an army who will be drowned.´

25.Aisha Bewley: How many gardens and fountains they left behind,

26.Aisha Bewley: and ripe crops and noble residences.

27.Aisha Bewley: What comfort and ease they had delighted in!

28.Aisha Bewley: So it was. Yet We bequeathed these things to another people.

29.Aisha Bewley: Neither heaven nor earth shed any tears for them and they were granted no reprieve.

30.Aisha Bewley: We rescued the tribe of Israel from the humiliating punishment,

31.Aisha Bewley: from Pharaoh — he was haughty, one of the profligate.

32.Aisha Bewley: We chose them knowingly above all other people

33.Aisha Bewley: and We gave them Signs containing a clear trial.

34.Aisha Bewley: These people say,

35.Aisha Bewley: ´There is nothing more than our first death. We will not be raised up a second time.

36.Aisha Bewley: Bring us our fathers if you are telling the truth.´

37.Aisha Bewley: Are they better or the people of Tubba´ and those before them whom We destroyed? They were certainly evildoers.

38.Aisha Bewley: We did not create the heavens and the earth and everything between them as a game.

39.Aisha Bewley: We did not create them except with truth but most of them do not know it.

40.Aisha Bewley: The Day of Decision will be their appointment all together:

41.Aisha Bewley: the Day when friends will be of no use at all to one another, and they will not be helped —

42.Aisha Bewley: except for those Allah has mercy on. He is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

43.Aisha Bewley: The Tree of az-Zaqqum

44.Aisha Bewley: is the food of the wicked,

45.Aisha Bewley: seething in the belly like molten brass,

46.Aisha Bewley: as boiling water bubbles and seethes.

47.Aisha Bewley: ´Seize him and drag him bodily into the middle of the Blazing Fire.

48.Aisha Bewley: Then pour the punishment of boiling water on his head.´

49.Aisha Bewley: ´Taste that! You are the mighty one, the noble one!

50.Aisha Bewley: This is the very thing you used to doubt.´

51.Aisha Bewley: The people who have taqwa will be in a safe place

52.Aisha Bewley: amid gardens and fountains,

53.Aisha Bewley: wearing fine silk and rich brocade, face to face with one another.

54.Aisha Bewley: So it will be. We will marry them to dark-eyed maidens.

55.Aisha Bewley: They will call there for fruit of every kind, in complete security.

56.Aisha Bewley: They will not taste any death there — except for the first one. He will safeguard them from the punishment of the Blazing Fire.

57.Aisha Bewley: A favour from your Lord. That is the Great Victory.

58.Aisha Bewley: We have made it easy in your own tongue so that hopefully they will pay heed.

59.Aisha Bewley: So watch and wait. They too are waiting.

1.Aisha Bewley: Ha Mim.

2.Aisha Bewley: The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Almighty, the All-Wise.

3.Aisha Bewley: In the heavens and earth there are certainly Signs for the muminun.

4.Aisha Bewley: And in your creation and all the creatures He has spread about there are Signs for people with certainty.

5.Aisha Bewley: And in the alternation of night and day and the provision Allah sends down from the sky, bringing the earth to life by it after it has died, and the varying direction of the winds, there are Signs for people who use their intellect.

6.Aisha Bewley: Those are Allah´s Signs We recite to you with truth. In what discourse, then, after Allah and His Signs, will they have iman?

7.Aisha Bewley: Woe to every wicked liar

8.Aisha Bewley: who hears the Signs of Allah recited to him and then persists in his arrogance just as if he had never heard them. Give him the news of a painful punishment.

9.Aisha Bewley: When he does learn something of Our Signs, he makes a mockery of them. Such people will have a humiliating punishment.

10.Aisha Bewley: Hell is right at their heels. Nothing they have earned will be of any use to them, nor will those they took as protectors besides Allah. They will have a terrible punishment.

11.Aisha Bewley: This is guidance. And those who reject the Signs of their Lord will have a punishment of agonising pain.

12.Aisha Bewley: It is Allah who has made the sea subservient to you so that the ships sail on it at His command, enabling you to seek His bounty, so that hopefully you will be thankful.

13.Aisha Bewley: And He has made everything in the heavens and everything on the earth subservient to you. It is all from Him. There are certainly Signs in that for people who reflect.

14.Aisha Bewley: Tell those who have iman that they should forgive those who feel no fear about the Days of Allah, when He will repay people according to what they earned.

15.Aisha Bewley: Whoever acts rightly, it is to his own good. Whoever does evil, it is to his detriment. Then you will be returned to your Lord.

16.Aisha Bewley: We gave the Book and Judgement and Prophethood to the tribe of Israel and provided them with good things and favoured them over all other people.

17.Aisha Bewley: We made the Commandments very clear to them and they only differed after knowledge came to them, tyrannising one other. Your Lord will decide between them on the Day of Rising regarding the things they differed about.

18.Aisha Bewley: Then We placed you on the right road of Our Command, so follow it. Do not follow the whims and desires of those who do not know.

19.Aisha Bewley: They will not help you in any way against Allah. The wrongdoers are protectors of one another but Allah is the Protector of those who have taqwa.

20.Aisha Bewley: This is clear insight for mankind and guidance and mercy for people with certainty.

21.Aisha Bewley: Or do those who perpetrate evil deeds suppose that We will make them like those who have iman and do right actions, so that their lives and deaths will be the same? How bad their judgement is!

22.Aisha Bewley: Allah created the heavens and earth with truth so that every self might be repaid for what it earned and they will not be wronged.

23.Aisha Bewley: Have you seen him who takes his whims and desires to be his god — whom Allah has misguided knowingly, sealing up his hearing and his heart and placing a blindfold over his eyes? Who then will guide him after Allah? So will you not pay heed?

24.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´There is nothing but our existence in this world. We die and we live and nothing destroys us except for time.´ They have no knowledge of that. They are only conjecturing.

25.Aisha Bewley: When Our Clear Signs are recited to them their only argument is to say, ´Bring us our fathers if you are telling the truth.´

26.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Allah gives you life, then causes you to die, and then will gather you together for the Day of Rising about which there is no doubt. But most people do not know it.´

27.Aisha Bewley: The kingdom of the heavens and earth belongs to Allah and, on the Day that the Hour arrives, that Day the liars will be lost.

28.Aisha Bewley: You will see every nation on its knees, every nation summoned to its Book: ´Today you will be repaid for what you did.

29.Aisha Bewley: This is Our Book speaking against you with the truth. We have been recording everything you did.´

30.Aisha Bewley: As for those who had iman and did right actions, their Lord will admit them into His mercy. That is the Clear Victory.

31.Aisha Bewley: But as for those who were kafir: ´Were My Signs not recited to you and yet you proved arrogant; you were a people of evildoers?

32.Aisha Bewley: When you were told, "Allah´s promise is true and so is the Hour, of which there is no doubt," you said, "We have no idea what the Hour is. We have only been conjecturing. We are by no means certain."´

33.Aisha Bewley: The evil deeds they did will appear before them and the things they mocked at will engulf them.

34.Aisha Bewley: They will be told, ´Today We have forgotten you as you forgot the meeting of this your Day. Your refuge is the Fire and you have no helpers.

35.Aisha Bewley: That is because you made a mockery of Allah´s Signs and the life of the dunya deluded you.´ Therefore, today they will not get out of it. They will not be able to appease Allah.

36.Aisha Bewley: All praise belongs to Allah, the Lord of the heavens and the Lord of the earth, Lord of all the worlds.

37.Aisha Bewley: All greatness belongs to Him in the heavens and earth He is the Almighty, the All-Wise.

46.SurahEnglishNames: The Wind-curved Sandhills, The Dunes, The Sandhills

1.Aisha Bewley: Ha Mim.

2.Aisha Bewley: The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Almighty, the All-Wise.

3.Aisha Bewley: We have not created the heavens and earth and everything between them except with truth and for a set term. But those who are kafir turn away from what they have been warned about.

4.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Have you thought about those you call upon apart from Allah? Show me what they have created on the earth. Or do they have a partnership in the heavens? Produce a Book for me before this one or a shred of knowledge if you are telling the truth.´

5.Aisha Bewley: Who could be further astray than those who call on other things besides Allah, which will not respond to them until the Day of Rising and which are unaware of their prayers?

6.Aisha Bewley: When mankind is gathered together, they will be their enemies and will reject their worship.

7.Aisha Bewley: When Our Clear Signs are recited to them, those who reject say to the truth when it comes to them, ´This is downright magic.´

8.Aisha Bewley: Or do they say, ´He has invented it´? Say: ´If I have invented it, then you possess no power to help me against Allah in any way. He knows best what you hold forth about. He is witness enough between me and you. He is the Ever-Forgiving, the Most Merciful.´

9.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´I am nothing new among the Messengers. I have no idea what will be done with me or you. I only follow what has been revealed to me. I am only a clear warner.´

10.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´What do you think? If it is from Allah and you reject it, when a witness from the tribe of Israel testifies to its similarity and has iman while you are arrogant . . . ! Allah certainly does not guide wrongdoing people.´

11.Aisha Bewley: Those who are kafir say of those who have iman, ´If there was any good in it, they would not have beaten us to it.´ And since they have not been guided by it, they are bound to say, ´This is an antiquated falsehood.´

12.Aisha Bewley: But before it there was the Book of Musa as a model and a mercy. And this is a corroborating Book in the Arabic tongue so that you may warn those who do wrong, and as good news for the good-doers.

13.Aisha Bewley: Those who say, ´Our Lord is Allah,´ and then go straight will feel no fear and will know no sorrow.

14.Aisha Bewley: Such people are the Companions of the Garden, remaining in it timelessly, for ever, as repayment for what they did.

15.Aisha Bewley: We have instructed man to be good to his parents. His mother bore him with difficulty and with difficulty gave birth to him; and his bearing and weaning take thirty months. Then when he achieves his full strength and reaches forty, he says, ´My Lord, keep me thankful for the blessing You bestowed on me and on my parents, and keep me acting rightly, pleasing You. And make my descendants righteous. I have made tawba to You and I am truly one of the Muslims.´

16.Aisha Bewley: Those are people whose best deeds will be accepted and whose wrong deeds will be overlooked. They are among the Companions of the Garden, in fulfilment of the true promise made to them.

17.Aisha Bewley: But what of him who says to his parents, ´Fie on you! Do you promise me that I will be resurrected when generations before me have passed away?´ They both call on Allah for help: ´Woe to you! Have iman! Allah´s promise is true.´ But he says, ´This is nothing but the myths of previous peoples.´

18.Aisha Bewley: Those are people of whom the statement about the nations, both of jinn and men, who passed away before them, has also proved true; truly they were the lost.

19.Aisha Bewley: Everyone will be ranked according to what they did. We will pay them in full for their actions and they will not be wronged.

20.Aisha Bewley: On the Day when those who were kafir are exposed to the Fire: ´You dissipated the good things you had in your worldly life and enjoyed yourself in it. So today you are being repaid with the punishment of humiliation for being arrogant in the earth without any right and for being deviators.´

21.Aisha Bewley: Remember the brother of ´Ad when he warned his people by the sand-dunes — and warners passed away before and after him — ´Worship no one but Allah. I fear for you the punishment of a terrible Day.´

22.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Have you come to us to divert us from our gods? Bring us what you have promised us if you are telling the truth.´

23.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´All knowledge is with Allah. I only transmit to you what I have been sent with. But I see that you are a people who are ignorant.´

24.Aisha Bewley: When they saw it as a storm cloud advancing on their valleys they said, ´This is a storm cloud which will give us rain.´ No, rather it is what you desired to hasten — a wind containing painful punishment,

25.Aisha Bewley: destroying everything at its Lord´s command! When morning came you could see nothing but their dwellings. That is how We repay the people of the evildoers.

26.Aisha Bewley: We established them far more firmly than We have established you and gave them hearing, sight and hearts. But their hearing, sight and hearts were of no use to them at all when they renounced Allah´s Signs and what they mocked at engulfed them.

27.Aisha Bewley: We destroyed the cities round about you and have variegated the Signs so that hopefully they will turn back.

28.Aisha Bewley: Why have those they took as gods besides Allah, to bring them near to Him, not come to their aid? No, in fact they have forsaken them! That was a fiction, something they invented.

29.Aisha Bewley: And We diverted a group of jinn towards you to listen to the Qur´an. When they were in earshot of it they said, ´Be quiet and listen.´ When it was over they went back to their people, warning them.

30.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Our people, we have heard a Book which was sent down after Musa, confirming what came before it, guiding to the truth and to a straight path.

31.Aisha Bewley: Our people, respond to Allah´s caller and believe in Him. He will forgive you some of your wrong actions and save you from a painful punishment.

32.Aisha Bewley: Those who do not respond to Allah´s caller cannot thwart Allah on earth and have no protectors apart from Him. Such people are clearly misguided.´

33.Aisha Bewley: Do they not see that Allah — He who created the heavens and the earth and was not wearied by creating them — has the power to bring the dead to life? Yes indeed! He has power over all things.

34.Aisha Bewley: On the Day when those who were kafir are exposed to the Fire, they will be asked, ´Is this not the truth?´ They will say, ´Yes, by our Lord.´ He will say, ´Then taste the punishment for having been kafir.´

35.Aisha Bewley: So be steadfast as the Messengers with firm resolve were also steadfast. And do not seek to hasten it for them. On the Day they see what they were promised, it will be as if they had only tarried for just one hour of a single day. It has been transmitted! Will any be destroyed except for deviant people?

1.Aisha Bewley: As for those who are kafir and bar others from the Way of Allah, Allah will make their actions go astray.

2.Aisha Bewley: But as for those who have iman and do right actions and have iman in what has been sent down to Muhammad — and it is the truth from their Lord — He will erase their bad actions from them and better their condition.

3.Aisha Bewley: That is because those who are kafir follow falsehood whereas those who have iman follow the truth from their Lord. In that way Allah makes comparisons for mankind.

4.Aisha Bewley: Therefore when you meet those who are kafir strike their necks. Then when you have decimated them, tie their bonds tightly and set them free or ransom them, until the war is finally over. That is how it is to be. If Allah willed, He could avenge Himself on them. But it is so that He can test some of you by means of others. As for those who fight in the Way of Allah, He will not let their actions go astray.

5.Aisha Bewley: He will guide them and better their condition

6.Aisha Bewley: and He will admit them into the Garden which He has made known to them.

7.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! if you help Allah, He will help you and make your feet firm.

8.Aisha Bewley: But those who are kafir will have utter ruin and He will make their actions go astray.

9.Aisha Bewley: That is because they hate what Allah has sent down, so He has made their actions come to nothing.

10.Aisha Bewley: Have they not travelled about the earth and seen the final fate of those before them? Allah destroyed them utterly. And those who are kafir will suffer the same fate.

11.Aisha Bewley: That is because Allah is the Protector of those who have iman and because those who are kafir have no protector.

12.Aisha Bewley: Allah will admit those who have iman to Gardens with rivers flowing under them. Those who are kafir have their enjoyment, eating as cattle eat, but the Fire will be their final residence.

13.Aisha Bewley: How many cities We have destroyed, greater in strength than your city which has driven you out, and there was no one to help them.

14.Aisha Bewley: Is someone on a clear path from his Lord like those whose bad actions have been made to seem good to them and who follow their own desires?

15.Aisha Bewley: An image of the Garden which is promised to those who have taqwa: in it there are rivers of water which will never spoil and rivers of milk whose taste will never change and rivers of wine, delightful to all who drink it, and rivers of honey of undiluted purity; in it they will have fruit of every kind and forgiveness from their Lord. Is that like those who will be in the Fire timelessly, for ever, with boiling water to drink which lacerates their bowels?

16.Aisha Bewley: Among them are those who listen to you and then, when they leave your presence, say to those who have been given knowledge, ´What was that he just said?´ They are those whose hearts Allah has sealed up and who follow their own desires.

17.Aisha Bewley: He increases in guidance those who are already guided and gives them their taqwa.

18.Aisha Bewley: What are they awaiting but for the Hour to come upon them suddenly? Its Signs have already come. What good will their Reminder be to them when it does arrive?

19.Aisha Bewley: Know then that there is no god except Allah and ask forgiveness for your wrongdoing, and for the men and women who have iman. Allah knows both your activity and your repose.

20.Aisha Bewley: Those who have iman say, ´If only a sura could be sent down.´ But when a straightforward sura is sent down and fighting is mentioned in it, you see those with sickness in their hearts looking at you with the look of someone about to faint from fear of death. More fitting for them

21.Aisha Bewley: would be obedience and honourable words. Once the matter is resolved upon, being true to Allah would be better for them.

22.Aisha Bewley: Is it not likely that, if you did turn away, you would cause corruption in the earth and sever your ties of kinship?

23.Aisha Bewley: Such are the people Allah has cursed, making them deaf and blinding their eyes.

24.Aisha Bewley: Will they not then ponder the Qur´an or are there locks upon their hearts?

25.Aisha Bewley: Those who have turned back in their tracks after the guidance became clear to them, it was Shaytan who talked them into it and filled them with false hopes.

26.Aisha Bewley: That is because they said to those who hate what Allah has sent down, ´We will obey you in part of the affair.´ But Allah knows their secrets.

27.Aisha Bewley: How will it be when the angels take them in death, beating their faces and their backs?

28.Aisha Bewley: That is because they followed what angers Allah and hated what is pleasing to Him. So He made their actions come to nothing.

29.Aisha Bewley: Or did those with sickness in their hearts imagine that Allah would not expose their malevolence?

30.Aisha Bewley: If We wished, We would show them to you and you would know them by their mark and know them by their ambivalent speech. Allah knows your actions.

31.Aisha Bewley: We will test you until We know the true fighters among you and those who are steadfast and test what is reported of you.

32.Aisha Bewley: Those who are kafir and obstruct the Way of Allah, and are entrenched in hostility towards the Messenger after the guidance has become clear to them, do not harm Allah in any way and He makes their actions come to nothing.

33.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! obey Allah and obey the Messenger. Do not make your actions of no worth.

34.Aisha Bewley: Those who are kafir and obstruct the Way of Allah, and then die kafir, Allah will not forgive them.

35.Aisha Bewley: Do not become faint-hearted and call for peace when you are uppermost and Allah is with you — He would never cheat you of your deeds.

36.Aisha Bewley: The life of this world is merely a game and a diversion. If you have iman and taqwa, He will pay you your wages and not ask you for all your wealth.

37.Aisha Bewley: If He did ask you for it and put you under pressure, you would be tight-fisted and it would bring out your malevolence.

38.Aisha Bewley: Here you are then: people who are called upon to spend in the Way of Allah and then some of you are tight-fisted! But whoever is tight-fisted is only tight-fisted to himself. Allah is Rich and you are poor. If you turn away, He will replace you with a people other than yourselves and they will not be like you.

1.Aisha Bewley: Truly We have granted you a clear victory,

2.Aisha Bewley: so that Allah may forgive you your earlier errors and any later ones and complete His blessing upon you, and guide you on a Straight Path.

3.Aisha Bewley: and so that Allah may help you with a mighty help.

4.Aisha Bewley: It is He who sent down serenity into the hearts of the muminun thereby increasing their iman with more iman — the legions of the heavens and the earth belong to Allah. Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise —

5.Aisha Bewley: so that He may admit the men and women of the muminun into Gardens with rivers flowing under them, remaining in them timelessly, for ever, and erase their bad actions from them; and in Allah´s sight that is a mighty victory.

6.Aisha Bewley: And so that He might punish the men and women of the hypocrites and the men and women of the idolaters — those who think bad thoughts about Allah. They will suffer an evil turn of fate. Allah is angry with them, and has cursed them and prepared Hell for them. What an evil destination!

7.Aisha Bewley: The legions of the heavens and the earth belong to Allah. Allah is Almighty, All-Wise.

8.Aisha Bewley: We have sent you bearing witness, bringing good news and giving warning

9.Aisha Bewley: so that you might all have iman in Allah and His Messenger and honour Him and respect Him and glorify Him in the morning and the evening.

10.Aisha Bewley: Those who pledge you their allegiance pledge allegiance to Allah. Allah´s hand is over their hands. He who breaks his pledge only breaks it against himself. But as for him who fulfils the contract he has made with Allah, We will pay him an immense reward.

11.Aisha Bewley: Those Arabs who remained behind will say to you, ´Our wealth and families kept us occupied, so ask forgiveness for us.´ They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say: ´Who can control Allah for you in any way whether He wants harm for you or wants benefit for you?´ Allah is aware of what you do.

12.Aisha Bewley: No, you thought that the Messenger and the muminun were not going to return to their families, and that seemed pleasing to your hearts and you thought evil thoughts and you were a blighted people.

13.Aisha Bewley: Whoever does not have iman in Allah and His Messenger — We have prepared a Blazing Fire for the kafirun.

14.Aisha Bewley: The kingdom of the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah. He forgives those He wills and punishes those He wills. Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

15.Aisha Bewley: When you go out to get the booty, those who remained behind will say, ´Allow us to follow you,´ desiring to alter Allah´s words. Say: ´You may not follow us. That is what Allah said before.´ They will say, ´It is only because you envy us.´ No indeed! How little they have understood!

16.Aisha Bewley: Say to the Arabs who remained behind: ´You will be called up against a people who possess great force whom you must fight unless they submit. If you obey, Allah will give you an excellent reward. But if you turn your backs as you did before, He will punish you with a painful punishment.´

17.Aisha Bewley: There is no constraint on the blind, nor on the lame, nor on the sick. We will admit all who obey Allah and His Messenger into Gardens with rivers flowing under them. But We will punish with a painful punishment anyone who turns his back.

18.Aisha Bewley: Allah was pleased with the muminun when they pledged allegiance to you under the tree. He knew what was in their hearts, and sent down serenity to them and has rewarded them with an imminent victory,

19.Aisha Bewley: and with much booty which they will take. Allah is Almighty, All-Wise.

20.Aisha Bewley: Allah has promised you much booty which you will take, and has hastened this for you and held people´s hands back from you, so that it might be a Sign to the muminun, and so that He might guide you to a straight path.

21.Aisha Bewley: And other booty you do not yet have the power to take — Allah has already encompassed it. Allah has power over all things.

22.Aisha Bewley: If those who are kafir should fight you, they would turn their backs and then find no one to protect or help them.

23.Aisha Bewley: That is Allah´s pattern which has passed away before. You will not find any changing in the pattern of Allah.

24.Aisha Bewley: It is He who held their hands back from you, and your hands from them in the valley of Makka, after giving you the upper hand over them. Allah sees what you do.

25.Aisha Bewley: They are those who were kafir and debarred you from the Masjid al-Haram and prevented the sacrifice from reaching its proper place, and had it not been for some men and women who are muminun, whom you did not know and might trample underfoot, and so unknowingly incur blame on their account — so that Allah might admit into His mercy those He wills — and had those among them who are kafir been clearly distinguishable, We would have punished them with a painful punishment.

26.Aisha Bewley: Those who are kafir filled their hearts with fanatical rage — the fanatical rage of the Time of Ignorance and Allah sent down serenity to His Messenger and to the muminun, and bound them to the expression of taqwa which they had most right to and were most entitled to. Allah has knowledge of all things.

27.Aisha Bewley: Allah has confirmed His Messenger´s vision with truth: ´You will enter the Masjid al-Haram in safety, Allah willing, shaving your heads and cutting your hair without any fear.´ He knew what you did not know and ordained, in place of this, an imminent victory.

28.Aisha Bewley: It is He who sent His Messenger with the Guidance and the Deen of Truth to exalt it over every other deen and Allah suffices as a witness.

29.Aisha Bewley: Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, and those who are with him are fierce to the kafirun, merciful to one another. You see them bowing and prostrating, seeking Allah´s good favour and His pleasure. Their mark is on their faces, the traces of prostration. That is their likeness in the Torah. And their likeness in the Injil is that of a seed which puts up a shoot and makes it strong so that it thickens and grows up straight upon its stalk, filling the sowers with delight — so that by them He may infuriate the kuffar. Allah has promised those of them who have iman and do right actions forgiveness and an immense reward.

49.SurahEnglishNames: The Private Apartments, The Inner Apartments, The Chambers

1.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! do not put yourselves forward in front of Allah and of His Messenger; and have taqwa of Allah. Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

2.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet and do not be as loud when speaking to him as you are when speaking to one another, lest your actions should come to nothing without your realising it.

3.Aisha Bewley: Those who lower their voices when they are with the Messenger of Allah are people whose hearts Allah has tested for taqwa. They will have forgiveness and an immense reward.

4.Aisha Bewley: As for those who call out to you from outside your private quarters, most of them do not use their intellect.

5.Aisha Bewley: If they had only been patient until you came out to them, it would have been better for them. But Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

6.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! if a deviator brings you a report, scrutinize it carefully in case you attack people in ignorance and so come to greatly regret what you have done.

7.Aisha Bewley: Know that the Messenger of Allah is among you. If he were to obey you in many things, you would suffer for it. However, Allah has given you love of iman and made it pleasing to your hearts, and has made kufr, deviance and disobedience hateful to you. People such as these are rightly guided.

8.Aisha Bewley: It is a great favour from Allah and a blessing. Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

9.Aisha Bewley: If two parties of the muminun fight, make peace between them. But if one of them attacks the other unjustly, fight the attackers until they revert to Allah´s command. If they revert, make peace between them with justice, and be even-handed. Allah loves those who are even-handed.

10.Aisha Bewley: The muminun are brothers, so make peace between your brothers and have taqwa of Allah so that hopefully you will gain mercy.

11.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! people should not ridicule others who may be better than themselves; nor should any women ridicule other women who may be better than themselves. And do not find fault with one another or insult each other with derogatory nicknames. How evil it is to have a name for evil conduct after coming to iman! Those people who do not turn from it are wrongdoers.

12.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! avoid most suspicion. Indeed some suspicion is a crime. And do not spy and do not backbite one another. Would any of you like to eat his brother´s dead flesh? No, you would hate it. And have taqwa of Allah. Allah is Ever-Returning, Most Merciful.

13.Aisha Bewley: Mankind! We created you from a male and female, and made you into peoples and tribes so that you might come to know each other. The noblest among you in Allah´s sight is the one with the most taqwa. Allah is All-Knowing, All-Aware.

14.Aisha Bewley: The desert Arabs say, ´We have iman.´ Say: ´You do not have iman. Say rather, "We have become Muslim," for iman has not yet entered into your hearts. If you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not undervalue your actions in any way. Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.´

15.Aisha Bewley: The muminun are only those who have had iman in Allah and His Messenger and then have had no doubt and have done jihad with their wealth and themselves in the Way of Allah. They are the ones who are true to their word.

16.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Do you presume to teach Allah your deen when Allah knows everything in the heavens and everything in the earth? Allah has knowledge of all things.´

17.Aisha Bewley: They think they have done you a favour by becoming Muslims! Say: ´Do not consider your Islam a favour to me. No indeed! It is Allah who has favoured you by guiding you to iman if you are telling the truth.´

18.Aisha Bewley: Allah knows the unseen things of the heavens and the earth. Allah sees what you do.

1.Aisha Bewley: Qaf By the Glorious Qur´an!

2.Aisha Bewley: Nonetheless they are amazed that a warner should have come to them from among themselves and those who are kafir say, ´What an extraordinary thing!

3.Aisha Bewley: When we are dead and turned to dust . . . ? That would be a most unlikely return!´

4.Aisha Bewley: We know exactly how the earth eats them away. We possess an all-preserving Book.

5.Aisha Bewley: But they denied the truth when it came to them. They are, therefore, in a very muddled state.

6.Aisha Bewley: Have they not looked at the sky above them: how We structured it and made it beautiful and how there are no fissures in it?

7.Aisha Bewley: And the earth: how We stretched it out and cast firmly embedded mountains onto it and caused luxuriant plants of every kind to grow in it,

8.Aisha Bewley: an instruction and a reminder for every penitent human being.

9.Aisha Bewley: And We sent down blessed water from the sky and made gardens grow by it and grain for harvesting

10.Aisha Bewley: and soaring date-palms with layered spathes,

11.Aisha Bewley: as provision for Our slaves; by it We brought a dead land to life. That is how the Emergence will take place.

12.Aisha Bewley: Before them the people of Nuh also denied the truth and the Companions of Rass and Thamud,

13.Aisha Bewley: and ´Ad and Pharaoh and the brothers of Lut

14.Aisha Bewley: and the Companions of the Thicket and the people of Tubba´. Each one denied the Messengers and My promise proved true.

15.Aisha Bewley: Were We exhausted by the first creation? Yet they are dubious about the new creation.

16.Aisha Bewley: We created man and We know what his own self whispers to him. We are nearer to him than his jugular vein.

17.Aisha Bewley: And the two recording angels are recording, sitting on the right and on the left.

18.Aisha Bewley: He does not utter a single word, without a watcher by him, pen in hand!

19.Aisha Bewley: The throes of death come revealing the truth. That is what you were trying to evade!

20.Aisha Bewley: The Trumpet will be blown. That is the Day of the Threat.

21.Aisha Bewley: Every self will come together with a driver and a witness:

22.Aisha Bewley: ´You were heedless of this so We have stripped you of your covering and today your sight is sharp.´

23.Aisha Bewley: His inseparable comrade will say, ´This is what I have ready for you.´

24.Aisha Bewley: ´Hurl into Hell every obdurate kafir,

25.Aisha Bewley: impeder of good, doubt-causing aggressor,

26.Aisha Bewley: who set up another god together with Allah. Hurl him into the terrible punishment.´

27.Aisha Bewley: His inseparable comrade will say, ´Our Lord, I did not make him overstep the limits. He was, in any case, far astray.´

28.Aisha Bewley: He will say, ´Do not argue in My presence when I gave you advance warning of the Threat.

29.Aisha Bewley: My Word, once given, is not subject to change and I do not wrong My slaves.´

30.Aisha Bewley: On the Day He says to Hell, ´Are you full?´ it will ask, ´Are there no more to come?´

31.Aisha Bewley: And the Garden will be brought up close to those with taqwa, not far away:

32.Aisha Bewley: ´This is what you were promised. It is for every careful penitent:

33.Aisha Bewley: those who fear the All-Merciful in the Unseen and come with a contrite heart.

34.Aisha Bewley: Enter it in peace. This is the Day of Timeless Eternity.´

35.Aisha Bewley: They will have there everything they want and with Us there is still more.

36.Aisha Bewley: How many generations before them We destroyed who had greater force than them and scoured many lands! Did they find any way of escape?

37.Aisha Bewley: There is a reminder in that for anyone who has a heart, or who listens well, having seen the evidence.

38.Aisha Bewley: We created the heavens and the earth, and everything between them, in six days and We were not affected by fatigue.

39.Aisha Bewley: So be patient in the face of what they say and glorify your Lord with praise before the rising of the sun and before it sets.

40.Aisha Bewley: And glorify Him during the night and after you have prostrated.

41.Aisha Bewley: Listen out for the Day when the Summoner shall call out from a nearby place.

42.Aisha Bewley: The Day they hear the Blast in truth, that is the Day of Emergence.

43.Aisha Bewley: It is We who give life and cause to die and We are their final destination.

44.Aisha Bewley: The Day the earth splits open all around them as they come rushing forth, that is a gathering, easy for Us to accomplish.

45.Aisha Bewley: We know best what they say. You are not a dictator over them. So remind, with the Qur´an, whoever fears My Threat.

1.Aisha Bewley: By the scatterers scattering,

2.Aisha Bewley: and those bearing weighty loads,

3.Aisha Bewley: and those speeding along with ease,

4.Aisha Bewley: and those apportioning the command:

5.Aisha Bewley: what you are promised is certainly true —

32.Aisha Bewley: and fruits in abundance
