34.Aisha Bewley: And on elevated couches

35.Aisha Bewley: We have brought maidens into being

36.Aisha Bewley: and made them purest virgins,

37.Aisha Bewley: devoted, passionate, of like age,

38.Aisha Bewley: for the Companions of the Right.

39.Aisha Bewley: A large group of the earlier people

40.Aisha Bewley: and a large group of the later ones.

41.Aisha Bewley: And the Companions of the Left: what of the Companions of the Left?

42.Aisha Bewley: Amid searing blasts and scalding water

43.Aisha Bewley: and the murk of thick black smoke,

44.Aisha Bewley: providing no coolness and no pleasure.

45.Aisha Bewley: Before that they were living in luxury,

46.Aisha Bewley: persisting in immense wrongdoing

47.Aisha Bewley: and saying, ´When we are dead and turned to dust and bones, shall we then be raised again

48.Aisha Bewley: or our forefathers, the earlier peoples?´

49.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´The earlier and the later peoples will certainly all be gathered

50.Aisha Bewley: to the appointment of a specified Day.

51.Aisha Bewley: Then you, you misguided, you deniers

52.Aisha Bewley: will eat from the tree of Zaqqum,

53.Aisha Bewley: filling your stomachs with it

54.Aisha Bewley: and drink scalding water on top of it,

55.Aisha Bewley: slurping like thirst-crazed camels.

56.Aisha Bewley: This will be their hospitality on the Day of Judgment!´

57.Aisha Bewley: We created you so why do you not confirm the truth?

58.Aisha Bewley: Have you thought about the sperm that you ejaculate?

59.Aisha Bewley: Is it you who create it or are We the Creator?

60.Aisha Bewley: We have decreed death for you and We will not be forestalled

61.Aisha Bewley: in replacing you with others the same as you and re-forming you in a way you know nothing about.

62.Aisha Bewley: You have known the first formation, so will you not pay heed?

63.Aisha Bewley: Have you thought about what you cultivate?

64.Aisha Bewley: Is it you who make it germinate or are We the Germinator?

65.Aisha Bewley: If We wished We could have made it broken stubble. You would then be left devoid of crops, distraught:

66.Aisha Bewley: ´We are ruined,

67.Aisha Bewley: in fact we are destitute!´

68.Aisha Bewley: Have you thought about the water that you drink?

69.Aisha Bewley: Is it you who sent it down from the clouds or are We the Sender?

70.Aisha Bewley: If We wished We could have made it bitter, so will you not give thanks?

71.Aisha Bewley: Have you thought about the fire that you light?

72.Aisha Bewley: Is it you who make the trees that fuel it grow or are We the Grower?

73.Aisha Bewley: We have made it to be a reminder and a comfort for travellers in the wild.

74.Aisha Bewley: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Magnificent!

75.Aisha Bewley: And I swear by the falling of the stars —

76.Aisha Bewley: and that is a mighty oath if you only knew —

77.Aisha Bewley: it truly is a Noble Qur´an

78.Aisha Bewley: in a well protected Book.

79.Aisha Bewley: No one may touch it except the purified.

80.Aisha Bewley: Revelation sent down from the Lord of all the worlds.

81.Aisha Bewley: Do you nonetheless regard this discourse with scorn

82.Aisha Bewley: and think your provision depends on your denial of the truth?

83.Aisha Bewley: Why then, when death reaches his throat

84.Aisha Bewley: and you are at that moment looking on —

85.Aisha Bewley: and We are nearer him than you but you cannot see —

86.Aisha Bewley: why then, if you are not subject to Our command,

87.Aisha Bewley: do you not send it back if you are telling the truth?

88.Aisha Bewley: But the truth is that if he is one of Those Brought Near,

89.Aisha Bewley: there is solace and sweetness and a Garden of Delight.

90.Aisha Bewley: And if he is one of the Companions of the Right,

91.Aisha Bewley: ´Peace be upon you!´ from the Companions of the Right

92.Aisha Bewley: And if he is one of the misguided deniers,

93.Aisha Bewley: there is hospitality of scalding water

94.Aisha Bewley: and roasting in the Blazing Fire.

95.Aisha Bewley: This is indeed the Truth of Certainty.

96.Aisha Bewley: So glorify the Name of your Lord, the Magnificent!

1.Aisha Bewley: Everything in the heavens and the earth glorifies Allah. He is the Almighty, the All-Wise.

2.Aisha Bewley: The kingdom of the heavens and the earth belongs to Him. He gives life and causes to die. He has power over all things.

3.Aisha Bewley: He is the First and the Last, the Outward and the Inward. He has knowledge of all things.

4.Aisha Bewley: It is He Who created the heavens and the earth in six days, then established Himself firmly on the Throne. He knows what goes into the earth and what comes out of it, what comes down from heaven and what goes up into it. He is with you wherever you are — Allah sees what you do.

5.Aisha Bewley: The kingdom of the heavens and the earth belongs to Him. All things return to Allah.

6.Aisha Bewley: He makes night merge into day and day merge into night. He knows what the heart contains.

7.Aisha Bewley: Have iman in Allah and His Messenger and give of that to which He has made you successors. Those of you who have iman and give will have an immense reward.

8.Aisha Bewley: And what is the matter with you with you that you do not have iman in Allah, when the Messenger calls you to have iman in your Lord, and He has made a covenant with you if you are muminun?

9.Aisha Bewley: It is He who sends down Clear Signs to His slave to bring you out of the darkness to the light. Allah is All-Gentle with you, Most Merciful.

10.Aisha Bewley: And how is it with you that you do not give in the Way of Allah, when the inheritance of the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah? Those of you who gave and fought before the Victory are not the same as those who gave and fought afterwards. They are higher in rank. But to each of them Allah has promised the Best. Allah is aware of what you do.

11.Aisha Bewley: Who will make a good loan to Allah so that He may multiply it for him? He will have a generous reward.

12.Aisha Bewley: On the Day you see the men and women of the muminun, with their light streaming out in front of them, and to their right: ´Good news for you today of Gardens with rivers flowing under them, remaining in them timelessly, for ever. That is the Great Victory.´

13.Aisha Bewley: That Day the men and women of the hypocrites will say to those who have iman, ´Wait for us so that we can borrow some of your light.´ They will be told, ´Go back and look for light!´ And a wall will be erected between them with a gate in it, on the inside of which there will be mercy but before whose exterior lies the punishment.

14.Aisha Bewley: They will call out to them, ´Were we not with you?´ They will reply, ´Indeed you were. But you made trouble for yourselves and hung back and and doubted and false hopes deluded you until Allah´s command arrived. The Deluder deluded you about Allah.

15.Aisha Bewley: So today no ransom will be accepted from you or from those who were kafir. Your refuge is the Fire. It is your master. What an evil destination!´

16.Aisha Bewley: Has the time not arrived for the hearts of those who have iman to yield to the remembrance of Allah and to the truth He has sent down, so they are not like those who were given the Book before for whom the time seemed over long so that their hearts became hard? Many of them are deviators.

17.Aisha Bewley: Know that Allah brings the earth to life after it was dead. We have made the Signs clear to you so that hopefully you will use your intellect.

18.Aisha Bewley: The men and women who give sadaqa and make a good loan to Allah will have it increased for them and they will have a generous reward.

19.Aisha Bewley: Those who have iman in Allah and His Messengers — such people are the truly sincere — and the martyrs who are with their Lord will receive their wages and their light. But those who are kafir and deny Our Signs, will be Companions of the Blazing Fire.

20.Aisha Bewley: Know that the life of this world is merely a game and a diversion and ostentation and a cause of boasting among yourselves and trying to outdo one another in wealth and children: like the plant-growth after rain which delights the cultivators, but then it withers and you see it turning yellow, and then it becomes broken stubble. In the Next World there is terrible punishment but also forgiveness from Allah and His good pleasure. The life of this world is nothing but the enjoyment of delusion.

21.Aisha Bewley: Race each other to forgiveness from your Lord and to a Garden, whose breadth is like that of heaven and earth combined, made ready for those who have iman in Allah and His Messengers. That is Allah´s favour which He gives to those He wills. Allah´s favour is indeed immense.

22.Aisha Bewley: Nothing occurs, either in the earth or in yourselves, without its being in a Book before We make it happen. That is something easy for Allah.

23.Aisha Bewley: That is so that you will not be grieved about the things that pass you by or exult about the things that come to you. Allah does not love any vain or boastful man:

24.Aisha Bewley: those who are tight-fisted and tell others to be tight-fisted. If anyone turns away, Allah is the Rich Beyond Need, the Praiseworthy.

25.Aisha Bewley: We sent Our Messengers with the Clear Signs and sent down the Book and the Balance with them so that mankind might establish justice. And We sent down iron in which there lies great force and which has many uses for mankind, so that Allah might know those who help Him and His Messengers in the Unseen. Allah is All-Strong, Almighty.

26.Aisha Bewley: We sent Nuh and Ibrahim and placed Prophethood and the Book among their descendants. Some of them are guided but many of them are deviators.

27.Aisha Bewley: Then We sent Our Messengers following in their footsteps and sent ´Isa son of Maryam after them, giving him the Gospel. We put compassion and mercy in the hearts of those who followed him. They invented monasticism — We did not prescribe it for them — purely out of desire to gain the pleasure of Allah, but even so they did not observe it as it should have been observed. To those of them who had iman We gave their reward but many of them are deviators.

28.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! have taqwa of Allah and iman in His Messenger. He will give you a double portion of His mercy and grant you a Light by which to walk and forgive you. Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

29.Aisha Bewley: So that the People of the Book may know that they have no power at all over any of Allah´s favour and that all favour is in the Hand of Allah. He gives it to anyone He wills. Allah´s favour is indeed immense.

58.SurahEnglishNames: She That Disputeth, The Pleading Woman, She Who Pleaded

1.Aisha Bewley: Allah has heard the words of the woman who disputes with you about her husband and lays her complaint before Allah. Allah hears the two of you talking together. Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

2.Aisha Bewley: Those of you who divorce your wives by equating them with your mothers, they are not your mothers. Your mothers are only those who gave birth to you. What you are saying is wrong and a slanderous lie. But Allah is Ever-Pardoning, Ever-Forgiving.

3.Aisha Bewley: Those who divorce their wives by equating them with their mothers, and then wish to go back on what they said, must set free a slave before the two of them may touch one another. This is what you are enjoined to do. Allah is aware of what you do.

4.Aisha Bewley: Anyone who cannot find the means must fast for two consecutive months before the two of them may touch one another again. And anyone who is unable to do that must feed sixty poor people. That is to affirm your iman in Allah and His Messenger. These are Allah´s limits. The kafirun will have a painful punishment.

5.Aisha Bewley: Those who oppose Allah and His Messenger will be subdued and overcome as those before them were also subdued and overcome. We have sent down Clear Signs. The kafirun will have a humiliating punishment.

6.Aisha Bewley: On the Day Allah raises up all of them together, He will inform them of what they did. Allah has recorded it while they have forgotten it. Allah is a Witness of all things.

7.Aisha Bewley: Do you not see that Allah knows what is in the heavens and on the earth? Three men cannot confer together secretly without Him being the fourth of them, or five without Him being the sixth of them, or fewer than that or more without Him being with them wherever they are. Then He will inform them on the Day of Rising of what they did. Allah has knowledge of all things.

8.Aisha Bewley: Do you not see those who were forbidden to confer together secretly returning to the very thing they were forbidden to do, and conferring together secretly in wrongdoing and enmity and disobedience to the Messenger? And when they come to you they greet you with words Allah has never used in greeting you, and say to themselves ´Why does Allah not punish us for what we say?´ Hell will be enough for them! They will roast in it. What an evil destination!

9.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! when you confer together secretly, do not do so in wrongdoing and enmity and disobedience to the Messenger; rather confer together in goodness and taqwa of Allah. Have taqwa of Allah — Him to Whom you will be gathered.

10.Aisha Bewley: Conferring in secret is from Shaytan, to cause grief to those who have iman; but it cannot harm them at all, unless by Allah´s permission. So let the muminun put their trust in Allah.

11.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! when you are told: ´Make room in the gathering,´ then make room and Allah will make room for you! And when it is said, ´Get up´, get up. Allah will raise in rank those of you who have iman and those who have been given knowledge. Allah is aware of what you do.

12.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! when you consult the Messenger privately precede your private consultation by giving sadaqa — that is better for you and purer. But if you cannot find the means, Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

13.Aisha Bewley: Are you afraid to give gifts of sadaqa before your private consultation? If you do not and Allah turns to you, at least establish salat and pay zakat, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah is aware of what you do.

14.Aisha Bewley: Do you not see those who have turned to people with whom Allah is angry? They belong neither to you nor to them. And they swear to falsehood and do so knowingly.

15.Aisha Bewley: Allah has prepared a terrible punishment for them. How evil is what they have been doing!

16.Aisha Bewley: They made their oaths into a cloak and barred the Way of Allah, so they will have a humiliating punishment.

17.Aisha Bewley: Neither their wealth nor their children will help them at all against Allah. Such people are the Companions of the Fire, remaining in it timelessly, for ever.

18.Aisha Bewley: On the Day Allah raises up all of them them together they will swear to Him just as they have sworn to you and imagine they have something to stand upon. No indeed! It is they who are the liars.

19.Aisha Bewley: Shaytan has gained mastery over them and made them forget the remembrance of Allah. Such people are the party of Shaytan. No indeed! It is the party of Shaytan who are the losers.

20.Aisha Bewley: Those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, such people will be among the most abased.

21.Aisha Bewley: Allah has written, ´I will be victorious, I and and My Messengers.´ Allah is Most Strong, Almighty.

22.Aisha Bewley: You will not find people who have iman in Allah and the Last Day having love for anyone who opposes Allah and His Messenger, though they be their fathers, their sons, their brothers or their clan. Allah has inscribed iman upon such people´s hearts and will reinforce them with a Ruh from Him and admit them into Gardens with rivers flowing under them, remaining in them timelessly, for ever. Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him. Such people are the party of Allah. Truly it is the party of Allah who are successful.

1.Aisha Bewley: Everything in the heavens and everything in the earth glorifies Allah. He is the Almighty, the All-Wise.

2.Aisha Bewley: It is He who expelled those who were kafir among the People of the Book from their homes to the first gathering-place.* You did not think that they would leave and they thought that their fortresses would protect them from Allah. Then Allah came upon them from where they least expected it and cast terror into their hearts. Their houses were pulled down by their own hands and by the hands of the muminun. People of insight, take note!

3.Aisha Bewley: If Allah had not prescribed banishment for them, He would have punished them in the dunya. But in the akhira they will have the punishment of the Fire.

4.Aisha Bewley: That is because they were entrenched in hostility towards Allah and His Messenger. If anyone is hostile towards Allah, Allah is Severe in Retribution.

5.Aisha Bewley: Whatever palm-trees you cut down, or left standing upright on their roots, it was done by Allah´s permission in order to disgrace the deviators.

6.Aisha Bewley: Whatever booty from them Allah has given to His Messenger — and you spurred on neither horse nor camel in its acquisition, but Allah gives power to His Messengers over anyone He wills, Allah has power over all things —

7.Aisha Bewley: whatever booty Allah gives to His Messenger from city dwellers belongs to Allah and to the Messenger and to near relatives and orphans and the very poor and travellers, so that it does not become something which merely revolves between the rich among you. Whatever the Messenger gives you you should accept and whatever he forbids you you should forgo. Have taqwa of Allah — Allah is severe in retribution.

8.Aisha Bewley: It is for the poor of the Muhajirun who were driven from their homes and wealth desiring the favour and the pleasure of Allah and supporting Allah and His Messenger. Such people are the truly sincere.

9.Aisha Bewley: Those who were already settled in the abode, and in iman, before they came, love those who have made hijra to them and do not find in their hearts any need for what they have been given and prefer them to themselves even if they themselves are needy. It is the people who are safe-guarded from the avarice of their own selves who are successful.

10.Aisha Bewley: Those who have come after them say, ´Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in iman and do not put any rancour in our hearts towards those who have iman. Our Lord, You are All-Gentle, Most Merciful.´

11.Aisha Bewley: Did you not see the hypocrites saying to their brothers, those among the People of the Book who are kafir, ´If you are driven out we will leave with you, we will never obey anyone to your detriment. And if you are fought against we will help you´? Allah bears witness that they are truly liars.

12.Aisha Bewley: If they are driven out they will not leave with them. If they are fought against they will not help them. And if they did help them they would turn their backs, and then they would not be helped.

13.Aisha Bewley: You are a greater cause of terror in their breasts than Allah! That is because they are people who do not understand.

14.Aisha Bewley: They will not fight against you all together as a group except in fortified towns or behind high walls. Their hostility towards each other is intense. They are full of bravado in each other´s company. You consider them united but their hearts are scattered wide. That is because they are people who do not use their intellect.

15.Aisha Bewley: They are the same as those a short time before them who tasted the evil consequences of what they did. They will have a painful punishment.

16.Aisha Bewley: They are like Shaytan when he says to a human being, ´Be kafir,´ and then when he becomes kafir, says, ´I wash my hands of you. Truly I fear Allah, the Lord of all the worlds.´

17.Aisha Bewley: The final fate of both of them is that they will be timelessly, for ever in the Fire. That is the repayment of the wrongdoers.

18.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! have taqwa of Allah and let each self look to what it has sent forward for Tomorrow. Have taqwa of Allah. Allah is aware of what you do.

19.Aisha Bewley: Do not be like those who forgot Allah so He made them forget themselves. Such people are the deviators.

20.Aisha Bewley: The Companions of the Fire and the Companions of the Garden are not the same. It is the Companions of the Garden who are the victors.

21.Aisha Bewley: If We had sent down this Qur´an onto a mountain, you would have seen it humbled, crushed to pieces out of fear of Allah. We make such examples for people so that hopefully they will reflect.

22.Aisha Bewley: He is Allah — there is no god but Him. He is the Knower of the Unseen and the Visible. He is the All-Merciful, the Most Merciful.

23.Aisha Bewley: He is Allah — there is no god but Him. He is the King, the Most Pure, the Perfect Peace, the Trustworthy, the Safeguarder, the Almighty, the Compeller, the Supremely Great. Glory be to Allah above all they associate with Him.

24.Aisha Bewley: He is Allah — the Creator, the Maker, the Giver of Form. To Him belong the Most Beautiful Names. Everything in the heavens and earth glorifies Him. He is the Almighty, the All-Wise.

60.SurahEnglishNames: She That is to be Examined, Examining her, She Who is Tested

1.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! do not take My enemy and your enemy as friends, showing love for them when they have rejected the truth that has come to you, driving out the Messenger and yourselves simply because you have iman in Allah your Lord. If you go out to do jihad in My Way and seeking My pleasure, keeping secret the love you have for them, I know best what you conceal and what you make known. Any of you who do that have strayed from the right way.

2.Aisha Bewley: If they come upon you, they will be your enemies and stretch out their hands and tongues against you with evil intent, and they would dearly love you to become kafir.

3.Aisha Bewley: Neither your blood relations nor your children will be of any use to you. On the Day of Rising He will differentiate between you. Allah sees what you do.

4.Aisha Bewley: You have an excellent example in Ibrahim and those with him, when they said to their people, ´We wash our hands of you and all that you worship apart from Allah, and we reject you. Between us and you there will be enmity and hatred for ever unless and until you have iman in Allah alone.´ Except for Ibrahim´s words to his father: ´I will ask forgiveness for you but I have no power to help you in any way against Allah.´ ´Our Lord, we have put our trust in You. and have made tawba to You. You are our final destination.

5.Aisha Bewley: Our Lord, do not make us a target for those who are kafir and forgive us. Our Lord, You are the Almighty, the All-Wise.´

6.Aisha Bewley: There is an excellent example in them for you to follow, that is for those whose hope is in Allah and the Last Day. But if anyone turns away, Allah is the Rich Beyond Need, the Praiseworthy.

7.Aisha Bewley: It may well be that Allah will restore the love between you and those of them who are now your enemies. Allah is All-Powerful. Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

8.Aisha Bewley: Allah does not forbid you from being good to those who have not fought you in the deen or driven you from your homes, or from being just towards them. Allah loves those who are just.

9.Aisha Bewley: Allah merely forbids you from taking as friends those who have fought you in the deen and driven you from your homes and who supported your expulsion. Any who take them as friends are wrongdoers.

10.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! when women who have iman come to you as muhajirun, submit them to a test. Allah has best knowledge of their iman. If you know they are muminun, do not return them to the kuffar. They are not halal for the kuffar nor are the kuffar halal for them. Give the kuffar whatever dowry they paid. And there is nothing wrong in your marrying them provided you pay them their due. Do not hold to any marriage ties with women who are kafir. Ask for what you paid and let them ask for what they paid. That is Allah´s judgement. Allah will judge between them. Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

11.Aisha Bewley: If any of your wives rejoin the kuffar, you should have compensation. So repay to those whose wives have gone the dowry they paid out. Have taqwa of Allah — Him in Whom you have iman.

12.Aisha Bewley: O Prophet! When women who have iman come to you pledging allegiance to you on the grounds that they will not associate anything with Allah or steal or fornicate or kill their children or give a false ascription of paternity — making up lies about their bodies — or disobey you in respect of anything right, then accept their pledge and ask forgiveness for them. Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

13.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! do not make friends of people with whom Allah is angry, who have despaired of the Next World as the kafirun have despaired of the inhabitants of the graves.

1.Aisha Bewley: Everything in the heavens and everything in the earth glorifies Allah. He is the Almighty, the All-Wise.

2.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! why do you say what you do not do?

3.Aisha Bewley: It is deeply abhorrent to Allah that you should say what you do not do.

4.Aisha Bewley: Allah loves those who fight in His Way in ranks like well-built walls.

5.Aisha Bewley: Remember when Musa said to his people, ´My people, why do you mistreat me when you know that I am the Messenger of Allah to you?´ So when they deviated, Allah made their hearts deviate. Allah does not guide people who are deviators.

6.Aisha Bewley: And when ´Isa son of Maryam said, ´Tribe of Israel, I am the Messenger of Allah to you, confirming the Torah which came before me and giving you the good news of a Messenger after me whose name is Ahmad.´ When he brought them the Clear Signs, they said, ´This is downright magic.´

7.Aisha Bewley: Who could do greater wrong than someone who invents a lie against Allah when he has been called to Islam? Allah does not guide wrongdoing people.

8.Aisha Bewley: They desire to extinguish Allah´s Light with their mouths but Allah will perfect His Light, though the kafirun hate it.

9.Aisha Bewley: It is He who sent His Messenger with guidance and the Deen of Truth to exalt it over every other deen, though the idolaters hate it.

10.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! shall I direct you to a transaction which will save you from a painful punishment?

11.Aisha Bewley: It is to have iman in Allah and His Messenger and do jihad in the Way of Allah with your wealth and your selves. That is better for you if you only knew.

12.Aisha Bewley: He will forgive you your wrong actions and admit you into Gardens with rivers flowing under them, and fine dwellings in the Gardens of Eden. That is the Great Victory.

13.Aisha Bewley: And other things you love: support from Allah and imminent victory. Give good news to the muminun!

14.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! be helpers of Allah as ´Isa son of Maryam said to the Disciples, ´Who will be my helpers to Allah?´ The Disciples said, ´We will be the helpers of Allah.´ One faction of the tribe of Israel had iman and the other were kafir. So We supported those who had iman against their enemy and they became victorious.

62.SurahEnglishNames: The Congregation, Friday, The Day of Congregation

1.Aisha Bewley: Everything in the heavens and everything in the earth glorifies Allah, the King, the All-Pure, the Almighty, the All-Wise.

2.Aisha Bewley: It is He who raised up among the unlettered people a Messenger from them to recite His Signs to them and purify them and teach them the Book and Wisdom, even though before that they were clearly misguided.

3.Aisha Bewley: And others of them who have not yet joined them. He is the Almighty, the All-Wise.

4.Aisha Bewley: That is Allah´s favour which He gives to whoever He wills. Allah´s favour is indeed immense.

5.Aisha Bewley: The metaphor of those who were charged with the Torah but then have not upheld it, is that of a donkey loaded with weighty tomes. How evil is the metaphor of those who deny Allah´s Signs! Allah does not guide wrongdoing people.

6.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´You Jews, if you claim to be the friends of Allah to the exclusion of all other people, then wish for death if you are telling the truth.´

7.Aisha Bewley: But they will never ever wish for it because of what they have done. Allah knows the wrongdoers.

8.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´Death, from which you are fleeing, will certainly catch up with you. Then you will be returned to the Knower of the Unseen and the Visible and He will inform you about what you did.´

9.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! when you are called to salat on the Day of Jumu´a, hasten to the remembrance of Allah and abandon trade. That is better for you if you only knew.

10.Aisha Bewley: Then when the salat is finished spread through the earth and seek Allah´s bounty and remember Allah much so that hopefully you will be successful.

11.Aisha Bewley: But when they see a chance of trade or entertainment they scatter off to it and leave you standing there. Say: ´What is with Allah is better than trade or entertainment. Allah is the Best of Providers.´

1.Aisha Bewley: When the hypocrites come to you they say, ´We bear witness that you are indeed the Messenger of Allah.´ Allah knows that you are indeed His Messenger and Allah bears witness that the hypocrites are certainly liars.

2.Aisha Bewley: They have made their oaths into a cloak and barred the Way of Allah. What they have done is truly evil.

3.Aisha Bewley: That is because they have had iman and then returned to kufr. So their hearts have been sealed up and they cannot understand.

4.Aisha Bewley: When you see them, their outward form appeals to you, and if they speak you listen to what they say. But they are like propped-up planks of wood. They imagine every cry to be against them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. Allah fight them! How they are perverted!

5.Aisha Bewley: When they are told, ´Come, and the Messenger of Allah will ask forgiveness for you,´ they turn their heads and you see them turn away in haughty arrogance.

6.Aisha Bewley: In their case it makes no difference whether you ask forgiveness for them or do not ask forgiveness for them. Allah will never forgive them. Allah does not guide deviant people.

7.Aisha Bewley: They are the people who say, ´Do not spend on those who are with the Messenger of Allah, so that they may go away.´ The treasuries of the heavens and earth belong to Allah. But the hypocrites do not understand this.

8.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´If we return to Madina, the mightier will drive out the inferior.´ But all might belongs to Allah and to His Messenger and the muminun. But the hypocrites do not know this.

9.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! do not let your wealth or children divert you from the remembrance of Allah. Whoever does that is lost.

10.Aisha Bewley: Give from what We have provided for you before death comes to one of you and he says, ´My Lord, if only you would give me a little more time so that I can give sadaqa and be one of the righteous!´

11.Aisha Bewley: Allah will not give anyone more time, once their time has come. Allah is aware of what you do.

1.Aisha Bewley: Everything in the heavens and everything on earth glorifies Allah. Sovereignty and praise belong to Him. He has power over all things.

2.Aisha Bewley: It is He who created you. Yet among you are those who are kafir and those who have iman. Allah sees what you do.

3.Aisha Bewley: He created the heavens and the earth with truth and formed you, giving you the best of forms. And He is your final destination.

4.Aisha Bewley: He knows everything in the heavens and earth. He knows what you keep secret and what you divulge. Allah knows what the heart contains.

5.Aisha Bewley: Has the news not reached you of those who were kafir before and tasted the evil consequences of what they did? They will have a painful punishment.

6.Aisha Bewley: That is because their Messengers brought them the Clear Signs but they said, ´Are human beings going to guide us?´ So they were kafir and turned away. But Allah is completely independent of them. Allah is Rich Beyond Need, Praiseworthy.

7.Aisha Bewley: Those who are kafir claim that they will never be raised again. Say: ´Oh yes, by my Lord, you certainly will be raised again! And then you will be informed about what you did. That is easy for Allah.´

8.Aisha Bewley: So have iman in Allah and His Messenger and in the Light We have sent down. Allah is aware of what you do.

9.Aisha Bewley: On the Day He gathers you for the Day of Gathering — that is the Day of Profit and Loss. As for those who have iman in Allah and act rightly, We will erase their bad actions from them and admit them into Gardens with rivers flowing under them, remaining in them timelessly, for ever and ever. That is the Great Victory!

10.Aisha Bewley: But as for those who are kafir and deny Our Signs they are the Companions of the Fire, remaining in it timelessly, for ever. What an evil destination!

11.Aisha Bewley: No misfortune occurs except by Allah´s permission. Whoever has iman in Allah — He will guide his heart. Allah has knowledge of all things.

12.Aisha Bewley: Obey Allah and obey the Messenger. But if you turn your backs, the Messenger is only responsible for clear transmission.

13.Aisha Bewley: Allah — there is no god but Him. So let the muminun put their trust in Allah.

14.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! some of your wives and children are an enemy to you, so be wary of them. But if you pardon and exonerate and forgive, Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

15.Aisha Bewley: Your wealth and children are a trial. But with Allah there is an immense reward.

16.Aisha Bewley: So have taqwa of Allah, as much as you are able to, and listen and obey and spend for your own benefit. It is the people who are safe-guarded from the avarice of their own selves who are successful.

17.Aisha Bewley: If you make a generous loan to Allah He will multiply it for you and forgive you. Allah is All-Thankful, Most Forbearing.

18.Aisha Bewley: The Knower of the Unseen and the Visible, the Almighty, the All-Wise.

1.Aisha Bewley: O Prophet! When any of you divorce women, divorce them during their period of purity and calculate their ´idda carefully. And have taqwa of Allah, your Lord. Do not evict them from their homes, nor should they leave, unless they commit an outright indecency. Those are Allah´s limits, and anyone who oversteps Allah´s limits has wronged himself. You never know, it may well be that after that Allah will cause a new situation to develop.

2.Aisha Bewley: Then when they have reached the end of their ´idda either retain them with correctness and courtesy or part from them with correctness and courtesy. Call two upright men from among yourselves as witnesses and they should carry out the witnessing for Allah. This is admonishment for all who have iman in Allah and the Last Day. Whoever has taqwa of Allah — He will give him a way out

3.Aisha Bewley: and provide for him from where he does not expect. Whoever puts his trust in Allah — He will be enough for him. Allah always achieves His aim. Allah has appointed a measure for all things.

4.Aisha Bewley: In the case of those of your wives who are past the age of menstruation, if you have any doubt, their ´idda should be three months, and that also applies to those who have not yet menstruated. The time for women who are pregnant is when they give birth. Whoever has taqwa of Allah — He will make matters easy for him.

5.Aisha Bewley: That is Allah´s command which He has sent down to you. Whoever has taqwa of Allah — He will erase his bad actions from him and greatly increase his reward.

6.Aisha Bewley: Let them live where you live, according to your means. Do not put pressure on them, so as to harass them. If they are pregnant, maintain them until they give birth. If they are suckling for you, give them their wages and consult together with correctness and courtesy. But if you make things difficult for one another, another woman should do the suckling for you.

7.Aisha Bewley: He who has plenty should spend out from his plenty, but he whose provision is restricted should spend from what Allah has given him. Allah does not demand from any self more than He has given it. Allah will appoint after difficulty, ease.

8.Aisha Bewley: How many cities spurned their Lord´s command and His Messengers! And so We called them harshly to account and punished them with a terrible punishment.

9.Aisha Bewley: They tasted the evil consequences of what they did and the end of their affair was total loss.

10.Aisha Bewley: Allah has prepared a terrible punishment for them. So have taqwa of Allah, people of intelligence — those who have iman — Allah has sent down a reminder to you,

11.Aisha Bewley: a Messenger reciting Allah´s Clear Signs to you to bring those who have iman and do right actions out of the darkness into the Light. Whoever has iman in Allah and acts rightly, We will admit him into Gardens with rivers flowing under them remaining in them timelessly, for ever and ever. Allah has provided for him excellently!

12.Aisha Bewley: It is Allah who created the seven heavens and of the earth the same number, the Command descending down through all of them, so that you might know that Allah has power over all things and that Allah encompasses all things in His knowledge.

1.Aisha Bewley: O Prophet! Why do you make haram what Allah has made halal for you, seeking to please your wives? Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

2.Aisha Bewley: Allah has made the expiation of your oaths obligatory for you. Allah is your Master — He is the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.

3.Aisha Bewley: The Prophet confided a certain matter to one of his wives, then when she divulged it Allah disclosed that to him, and he communicated part of it and withheld part of it. When he told her of it, she said, ´Who told you of this?´ He said, ´The All-Knowing and All-Aware informed me of it.´

4.Aisha Bewley: If the two of you would only turn to Allah, for your hearts clearly deviated . . . But if you support one another against him, Allah is his Protector and so are Jibril and every right-acting man of the muminun and, furthermore, the angels too will come to his support.

5.Aisha Bewley: It may be that if he does divorce you, his Lord will give him in exchange better wives than you: Muslim women, believing women, obedient women, penitent women, women who worship, women who fast much — previously married women as well as virgins.

6.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! safeguard yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is people and stones. Harsh, terrible angels are in charge of it who do not disobey Allah in respect of any order He gives them and carry out what they are ordered to do.

7.Aisha Bewley: ´You who are kafir! do not try to excuse yourselves today. You are merely being repaid for what you did.´

8.Aisha Bewley: You who have iman! repent sincerely to Allah. It may be that your Lord will erase your bad actions from you and admit you into Gardens with rivers flowing under them on the Day when Allah will not disgrace the Prophet and those who had iman along with him. Their light will stream out ahead of them and on their right. They will say, ´Our Lord, perfect our light for us and forgive us! You have power over all things.´

9.Aisha Bewley: O Prophet! do jihad against the kafirun and hypocrites and be harsh with them. Their refuge is Hell. What an evil destination!

10.Aisha Bewley: Allah has made an example for those who are kafir: the wife of Nuh and the wife of Lut. They were married to two of Our slaves who were righteous but they betrayed them and were not helped at all against Allah. They were told, ´Enter the Fire along with all who enter it.´

11.Aisha Bewley: Allah has made an example for those who have iman: the wife of Pharaoh when she said, ´My Lord, build a house in the Garden for me in Your presence and rescue me from Pharaoh and his deeds and rescue me from this wrongdoing people.´

12.Aisha Bewley: And Maryam, the daughter of ´Imran, who guarded her chastity — We breathed Our Ruh into her and she confirmed the Words of her Lord and His Books and was one of the obedient.

1.Aisha Bewley: Blessed be He who has the Kingdom in His Hand! He has power over all things.

2.Aisha Bewley: He who created death and life to test which of you is best in action. He is the Almighty, the Ever-Forgiving.

3.Aisha Bewley: He who created the seven heavens in layers. You will not find any flaw in the creation of the All-Merciful. Look again — do you see any gaps?

4.Aisha Bewley: Then look again and again. Your sight will return to you dazzled and exhausted!

5.Aisha Bewley: We have adorned the lowest heaven with lamps and made some of them stones for the shaytans for whom We have prepared the punishment of the Blaze.

6.Aisha Bewley: Those who reject their Lord will have the punishment of Hell. What an evil destination!

7.Aisha Bewley: When they are flung into it they will hear it gasping harshly as it seethes.

8.Aisha Bewley: It all but bursts with rage. Each time a group is flung into it its custodians will question them: ´Did no warner come to you?´

9.Aisha Bewley: They will say, ´Yes indeed, a warner did come to us but we denied him and said, "Allah has sent nothing down. You are just greatly misguided."´

10.Aisha Bewley: They will say, ´If only we had really listened and used our intellect, we would not have been Companions of the Blaze.´

11.Aisha Bewley: Then they will acknowledge their wrong actions. Away with the Companions of the Blaze!

12.Aisha Bewley: Those who fear their Lord in the Unseen will have forgiveness and an immense reward.

13.Aisha Bewley: Whether you keep your words secret or say them out loud He knows what the heart contains.

14.Aisha Bewley: Does He who created not then know? He is the All-Pervading, the All-Aware.

15.Aisha Bewley: It is He who made the earth submissive to you, so walk its broad trails and eat what it provides. The Resurrection is to Him.

16.Aisha Bewley: Do you feel secure against Him Who is in heaven causing the earth to swallow you up when suddenly it rocks from side to side?

17.Aisha Bewley: Or do you feel secure against Him Who is in heaven releasing against you a sudden squall of stones, so that you will know how true My warning was?

18.Aisha Bewley: Those before them also denied but then how great was My denial!

19.Aisha Bewley: Have they not looked at the birds above them, with wings outspread and folded back? Nothing holds them up but the All-Merciful. He sees all things.

20.Aisha Bewley: Who is there who could be a force for you, to come to your support, apart from the All-Merciful? The kafirun are only living in delusion.

21.Aisha Bewley: Who is there who could provide for you if He withholds His provision? Yet still they obstinately persist in insolence and evasion.

22.Aisha Bewley: Who is better guided: he who goes grovelling on his face or he who walks upright on a straight path?

23.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´It is He who brought you into being and gave you hearing, sight and hearts. What little thanks you show!´

24.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´It is He who scattered you about the earth and you will be gathered to Him.´

25.Aisha Bewley: They say, ´When will this promise come about if you are telling the truth?´

26.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´The knowledge is with Allah alone and I am only a clear warner.´

27.Aisha Bewley: When they see it right up close, the faces of those who are kafir will be appalled and they will be told, ´This is what you were calling for.´

28.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´What do you think? If Allah destroys me and those with me, or if He has mercy on us, who can shelter the kafirun from a painful punishment?´

29.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´He is the All-Merciful. We have iman in Him and trust in Him. You will soon know who is clearly misguided.´

30.Aisha Bewley: Say: ´What do you think? If, one morning, your water disappears into the earth who will bring you running water?´

1.Aisha Bewley: Nun. By the Pen and what they write down!

2.Aisha Bewley: By the blessing of your Lord, you are not mad.

3.Aisha Bewley: You will have a wage which never-fails.

4.Aisha Bewley: Indeed you are truly vast in character.

5.Aisha Bewley: So you will see and they will see

6.Aisha Bewley: which of you is mad.

7.Aisha Bewley: Your Lord knows best who is misguided from His Way and He knows best those who are guided.

8.Aisha Bewley: So do not obey those who deny the truth.

9.Aisha Bewley: They wish that you would conciliate them, then they too would be conciliating.

10.Aisha Bewley: But do not obey any vile swearer of oaths,

11.Aisha Bewley: any backbiter, slandermonger,

12.Aisha Bewley: impeder of good, evil aggressor,

13.Aisha Bewley: gross, coarse and furthermore, despicable,

14.Aisha Bewley: simply because he possesses wealth and sons.

15.Aisha Bewley: When Our Signs are recited to him, he says, ´Just myths of previous peoples!´

16.Aisha Bewley: We will brand him on the snout!

17.Aisha Bewley: We have tried them as We tried the owners of the garden when they swore that they would harvest in the morning

18.Aisha Bewley: but did not say the redeeming words, ´If Allah wills´.

19.Aisha Bewley: So a visitation from your Lord came upon it while they slept

20.Aisha Bewley: and in the morning it was like burnt land stripped bare.

21.Aisha Bewley: In the morning they called out to one another,

22.Aisha Bewley: ´Leave early for your land if you want to pick the fruit.´

23.Aisha Bewley: So they set off, quietly saying to one another,

24.Aisha Bewley: ´Do not let any poor man into it today while you are there.´

25.Aisha Bewley: They left early, intent on carrying out their scheme.

26.Aisha Bewley: But when they saw it, they said, ´We must have lost our way.

27.Aisha Bewley: No, the truth is we are destitute!´

28.Aisha Bewley: The best of them said, ´Did I not say to you, "Why do you not glorify Allah?"´

29.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Glory be to our Lord! Truly we have been wrongdoers.´

30.Aisha Bewley: They turned to face each other in mutual accusation.

31.Aisha Bewley: They said, ´Woe to us! We were indeed inordinate.

32.Aisha Bewley: Maybe our Lord will give us something better than it in exchange. We entreat our Lord.´

33.Aisha Bewley: Such is the punishment. And the punishment of the Next World is much greater if they only knew.

34.Aisha Bewley: The people who have taqwa will have Gardens of Delight with their Lord.

35.Aisha Bewley: Would We make the Muslims the same as the evildoers?

36.Aisha Bewley: What is the matter with you? On what basis do you judge?

37.Aisha Bewley: Or do you have a Book which you study,

38.Aisha Bewley: so that you may have anything in it you choose?

39.Aisha Bewley: Or do you have oaths which bind Us, extending to the Day of Rising, that you will have whatever you decide?

40.Aisha Bewley: Ask them which of them stands as guarantor for that!

41.Aisha Bewley: Or do they have Divine partners? Then let them produce their partners if they are telling the truth!

42.Aisha Bewley: On the Day when legs are bared and they are called on to prostrate, they will not be able to do so.

43.Aisha Bewley: Their eyes will be downcast, darkened by debasement; for they were called on to prostrate when they were in full possession of their faculties.

44.Aisha Bewley: So leave anyone who denies this discourse to Me! We will lead them, step by step, into destruction from where they do not know.

45.Aisha Bewley: I will allow them more time. My subterfuge is sure.

46.Aisha Bewley: Or do you ask them for a wage so they are weighed down with debt?

47.Aisha Bewley: Or is the Unseen in their hands, so they can write out what is to happen?

48.Aisha Bewley: So wait steadfastly for the judgement of your Lord. Do not be like the Companion of the Fish when he called out in absolute despair.

49.Aisha Bewley: Had a blessing from his Lord not overtaken him, he would have been thrown up on the naked shore, for he was at fault.

50.Aisha Bewley: But his Lord chose him and made him one of the righteous.

51.Aisha Bewley: Those who are kafir all but strike you down with their evil looks when they hear the Reminder and say, ´He is quite mad.´

52.Aisha Bewley: But it is nothing less than a Reminder to all the worlds.

1.Aisha Bewley: The Undeniable!

2.Aisha Bewley: What is the Undeniable?

3.Aisha Bewley: What will convey to you what the Undeniable is?

4.Aisha Bewley: Thamud and ´Ad denied the Crushing Blow.

5.Aisha Bewley: Thamud were destroyed by the Deafening Blast.

6.Aisha Bewley: ´Ad were destroyed by a savage howling wind.

7.Aisha Bewley: Allah subjected them to it for seven whole nights and eight whole days without a break. You could see the people flattened in their homes just like the hollow stumps of uprooted palms.

8.Aisha Bewley: Do you see any remnant of them left?

9.Aisha Bewley: Pharaoh and those before him and the Overturned Cities made a great mistake.

10.Aisha Bewley: They disobeyed the Messenger of their Lord so He seized them in an ever-tightening grip.

11.Aisha Bewley: When the waters rose We carried you in the ship

12.Aisha Bewley: to make it a reminder for you and something to be retained by retentive ears.

13.Aisha Bewley: So when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast,

14.Aisha Bewley: and the earth and the mountains are lifted and crushed with a single blow,

15.Aisha Bewley: On that Day, the Occurrence will occur

16.Aisha Bewley: and Heaven will be split apart, for that Day it will be very frail.

17.Aisha Bewley: The angels will be gathered round its edge. On that Day, eight will bear the Throne of their Lord above their heads.

18.Aisha Bewley: On that Day you will be exposed — no concealed act you did will stay concealed.

19.Aisha Bewley: As for him who is given his Book in his right hand, he will say, ´Here, come and read my Book!

20.Aisha Bewley: I counted on meeting my Reckoning.´

21.Aisha Bewley: He will have a very pleasant life

22.Aisha Bewley: in an elevated Garden,

23.Aisha Bewley: its ripe fruit hanging close to hand.

24.Aisha Bewley: ´Eat and drink with relish for what you did before in days gone by!´

25.Aisha Bewley: But as for him who is given his Book in his left hand, he will say, ´If only I had not been given my Book

26.Aisha Bewley: and had not known about my Reckoning!

27.Aisha Bewley: If only death had really been the end!

28.Aisha Bewley: My wealth has been of no use to me.

29.Aisha Bewley: My power has vanished.´

30.Aisha Bewley: ´Seize him and truss him up.

31.Aisha Bewley: Then roast him in the Blazing Fire.

32.Aisha Bewley: Then bind him in a chain which is seventy cubits long.

33.Aisha Bewley: He used not to have iman in Allah the Magnificent,

34.Aisha Bewley: nor did he urge the feeding of the poor.

35.Aisha Bewley: Therefore here today he has no friend

36.Aisha Bewley: nor any food except exuding pus

37.Aisha Bewley: which no one will eat except those who were in error.´

38.Aisha Bewley: I swear both by what you see

39.Aisha Bewley: and what you do not see,

40.Aisha Bewley: that this is the word of a noble Messenger.

41.Aisha Bewley: It is not the word of a poet — how little iman you have!

42.Aisha Bewley: Nor the word of a fortune-teller — how little heed you pay!

43.Aisha Bewley: It is a revelation from the Lord of all the worlds.

44.Aisha Bewley: If he had made up any sayings and ascribed them to Us,

45.Aisha Bewley: We would have seized him by force,

46.Aisha Bewley: and then We would have cut off his life-blood

47.Aisha Bewley: and not one of you could have protected him.

48.Aisha Bewley: It is a reminder to the people with taqwa.

49.Aisha Bewley: We know that some of you will deny it.

50.Aisha Bewley: It is a cause of great distress to those who are kafir.

51.Aisha Bewley: And it is undeniably the Truth of Certainty.

52.Aisha Bewley: Glorify then the name of your Lord, the Magnificent.

1.Aisha Bewley: An inquirer asked about an impending punishment.

2.Aisha Bewley: It is for the kafirun and cannot be averted

3.Aisha Bewley: from Allah — the Lord of the Ascending Steps.

4.Aisha Bewley: The angels and the Spirit ascend to Him in a day whose length is fifty thousand years.

5.Aisha Bewley: Therefore be patient with a patience which is beautiful.

6.Aisha Bewley: They see it as something distant,

7.Aisha Bewley: but We see it as very close.

8.Aisha Bewley: On the Day the sky is like molten brass

9.Aisha Bewley: and the mountains like tufts of coloured wool.

10.Aisha Bewley: no good friend will ask about his friend

11.Aisha Bewley: even though they can see each other. An evildoer will wish he could ransom himself from the punishment of that Day, by means of his sons,

12.Aisha Bewley: or his wife or his brother

13.Aisha Bewley: or his family who sheltered him

14.Aisha Bewley: or everyone else on earth, if that only meant that he could save himself.

15.Aisha Bewley: But no! It is a Raging Blaze

16.Aisha Bewley: stripping away the limbs and scalp,

17.Aisha Bewley: which calls for all who drew back and turned away,

18.Aisha Bewley: and amassed and hoarded up.

19.Aisha Bewley: Truly man was created headstrong —

20.Aisha Bewley: desperate when bad things happen,

21.Aisha Bewley: begrudging when good things come —

22.Aisha Bewley: except for those who do salat

23.Aisha Bewley: and are constant in it;

24.Aisha Bewley: those in whose wealth there is a known share

25.Aisha Bewley: for beggars and the destitute;

26.Aisha Bewley: those who affirm the Day of Judgement,

27.Aisha Bewley: those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord

28.Aisha Bewley: (no one is safe from the punishment of his Lord);

29.Aisha Bewley: those who guard their private parts

30.Aisha Bewley: except from their wives and any slaves they own, in which case they incur no blame,

31.Aisha Bewley: but if anyone desires any more than that, they have overstepped the limits;

32.Aisha Bewley: those who honour their trusts and contracts;

33.Aisha Bewley: those who stand by their testimony;

34.Aisha Bewley: those who safeguard their salat;

35.Aisha Bewley: such people will be in Gardens, highly honoured.

36.Aisha Bewley: What is the matter with those who are kafir? They run about in front of you, with outstretched necks and staring eyes,

37.Aisha Bewley: on the right and on the left in scattered groups!

38.Aisha Bewley: Does each one of them aspire to be admitted into a Garden of Delight?

39.Aisha Bewley: Certainly not! We created them from what they know full well.

40.Aisha Bewley: No! I swear by the Lord of the Easts and Wests that We have the power

41.Aisha Bewley: to replace them with something better than them. We will not be outstripped.

42.Aisha Bewley: So leave them to plunge and play around until they meet their Day which they are promised.

43.Aisha Bewley: The Day they will emerge swiftly from their graves as if rushing to rally to the flag,

44.Aisha Bewley: eyes downcast, darkened by debasement, that will be the Day which they were promised.

1.Aisha Bewley: We sent Nuh to his people: ´Warn your people before a painful punishment comes to them.´

2.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´My people, I am a clear warner to you.

3.Aisha Bewley: Worship Allah, have taqwa of Him and obey me.

4.Aisha Bewley: He will forgive you your wrong actions and defer you until a specified time. When Allah´s time comes it cannot be deferred, if you only knew.´

5.Aisha Bewley: He said, ´My Lord, I have called my people night and day

6.Aisha Bewley: but my calling has only made them more evasive.

7.Aisha Bewley: Indeed, every time I called them to Your forgiveness, they put their fingers in their ears, wrapped themselves up in their clothes and were overweeningly arrogant.

8.Aisha Bewley: Then I called them openly.

9.Aisha Bewley: Then I addressed them publicly and addressed them privately.

10.Aisha Bewley: I said, "Ask forgiveness of your Lord. Truly He is Endlessly Forgiving.

11.Aisha Bewley: He will send heaven down on you in abundant rain

12.Aisha Bewley: and reinforce you with more wealth and sons, and grant you gardens and grant you waterways.

13.Aisha Bewley: What is the matter with you that you do not hope for honour from Allah,

14.Aisha Bewley: when He created you by successive stages?

15.Aisha Bewley: Do you not see how He created seven heavens in layers,

16.Aisha Bewley: and placed the moon as a light in them and made the sun a blazing lamp?

17.Aisha Bewley: Allah caused you to grow from the earth

18.Aisha Bewley: then will return you to it and bring you out again.

19.Aisha Bewley: Allah has spread the earth out as a carpet for you

20.Aisha Bewley: so that you could use its wide valleys as roadways."´

21.Aisha Bewley: Nuh said, ´My Lord, they have disobeyed me and followed those whose wealth and children have only increased them in loss.

22.Aisha Bewley: They have hatched a mighty plot

23.Aisha Bewley: saying, "Do not abandon your gods. Do not abandon Wadd or Suwa´ or Yaghuth or Ya´uq or Nasr."*

24.Aisha Bewley: They have misguided many people. Do not increase the wrongdoers in anything but misguidance!´

25.Aisha Bewley: Because of their errors they were drowned and put into the Fire. They found no one to help them besides Allah.
